review_body: Everything very very good, except couldn't do work requires internet. Great staff, very friendly, patient, helpful front desk staff. Room is clean, bright, bathroom is clean, everything is stocked well and nicely.Except I needed to do urgent work, sending some video through internet, it was very very slow.

Room was selected online although there wasn't an online tour that could of assured what the room looked like before reserving . The room smelled like corn chips and some funky tangy spoiled dip. Had to freshen it up with some febreze and Giovanni Versace cologne oh yes yes! The playstation was an nice upgrade it needs an new controller left an good movie in there hopefully someone will enjoy it. The room and the entire hotel is overdue for renovations all over as well as updated amenities. Almost slipped and fell out of the tub, there is no made in rough surface mat that is needed to assure guests won't injure themselves trying to clean them selves up. The was alot of dust and debree everywhere as well as broken or disabled hangers that can cause major health problems and insurable risks to guests and employees. The windows where needing cleaning and didn't provide an good outlook or view to the ocean or city area. The carpet smelled very musty and a few stains where in there and it seemed contagious as well as an few insects flying around mating on anything they wanted to mate on. The bed was comfy although the sheets and covers smelled like tobacco products felt like I was dumped into an astray next to an filthy trash can. The microwave worked although it was handicapped in remembering how many seconds to heat up my eatable items and it smelled like melting plastic so I threw away my hot food and was forced to buy an tuna sandwich from the convenience store right under my room. The convenience store looked okay from the outside although inside it smelled like there was an power outage, the floors need sweeping and mopping and products properly placed on the shelves instead of the floor that was kinda unsanitary to the fullest degree. Some of the products was out of date and warm when they should of been cold dripping wet. The elevator seemed okay although it was faulty and felt like an amusement park ride with out the seat belt. The roof needs pro sealing.!

Stayed at the Pagoda hotel last night, this place should be ashamed charging $100 a night. It is more like a $50 a night hotel.The website pictures must have been taken with a Snapchat filter because the hotel looks kinda like the pictures, only worse. Hallway and rooms smell musty. Not sure what was going on with the smoke detector, but there was a washcloth over it. The bathroom door was so dirty on both sides. There isn't a chain lock on the front door, and I just didn't feel very safe here. The area isn't the best area either, but it is close to the Walmart. The only reason I gave it 2 stars is because they offer free movie rentals at the vending machine and have a PlayStation 3 in the room. They are also next door to a cool restaurant that has tons of Koi fish. The lady at the front desk gave us food for the fish. There is a mini fridge, microwave, and toaster in the room. We won't be coming back here.

From head to toe this property is terrific. Great Pagoda experience... "Reviews must be 200 characters (minimum)" are you all kidding"? If I used that many characters it would be in a derogatory review...

My wife & I arrived for a week's stay but am now required to stay a month after a pending operation next week....my wife leaves today without me. Debbie cheerfully confirmed my room via phone and Carlos' beaming smile awaited us and check-in was a breeze. We had breakfast & was welcomed by Tori's & Esa's aloha & Anna's great coffee! We had a problem with our phone and Leilani (our new friend) cheerfully got it replaced. We invited friend's for the Seafood Buffet & we all thoroughly gorged and enjoyed the fantastic food....unbeatable deal and well worth it! Shopping is handy we strolled to Walmart a couple times to buy necessities but there is also a small fully-stocked shop in Pagoda's lobby for drinks, sandwiches, snacks, soap, etc.. I end here after a week and will review the rest of my stay after my operation next week.

review_body: Pagoda hotel location is fabulous. It’s walking distance to everything. Aka Moana center beach Waikiki Downtown. salt area. The rooms are rundown. The carpets and decades old and years of dust on the sprinklers and fire alarms. The ceiling looks like starting of mold. Ugh.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Pagoda - it is a little bit of an older hotel, but the lobby and rooms are renovated and modern. The room was clean and comfy, the beds very comfortable and koi pond and restaurant/bar are very charming and comfortable to eat in and have drinks. The views are good and shower was great and nice and hot! I didn't have the dinner buffet, but the breakfast buffet is delicious and priced right. All of the staff were very friendly. I only had two issues while there: A minor cleanliness issue in my first room, which when I told the front desk agent (didn't get her name) she immediately moved me to another room with a smile. Also, I could not get the tv off of anything but the menu screen - none of the remote buttons did anything - but did not bother to mention it as I decided to just go to bed. The neighborhood was decent, with several good restaurants nearby as well as some fast food and WalMart for supplies and the hotel also has a shop for supplies and gifts. I will choose this hotel again, since it is much better than other hotels in the affordable price range. I would be great to stay here as a couple.

Pagoda Hotel is located on the island of O’ahu.Check-in was very fast.All employees at the Pagoda are very nice and accommodating. Especially Ron.Look out for him at the front desk.There is a $200 security deposit. You have an option of paying cash or charging it to your credit/ debit card.Cash security deposits are returned to you upon checkout after the staff checks to make sure that the room is not trashed. It takes several days for security deposits placed on your card to be returned.WiFi is free.There is a small pool, a laundry room and a mini convenience store located on the ground floor.There is also a free DVD dispenser on the ground floor.DVDs are loaned out one at a time.Free daily local newspapers are located right next to the DVD dispenser.Free sunscreen is also available from the front desk.There is also a free, air conditioned shuttle that stops at all other Aqua properties. The drivers are very nice and are more than happy to give you advice on what to do and where to eat.Since there are numerous Aqua hotels, the stops will vary.You can check the shuttle’s route progression on the screen that is in the hotel’s lobby.The shuttle usually stops at the Pagoda every 15-20 minutes.Consider using the shuttle if you want to check out Waikīkī and other areas of Honolulu.There is also a Pagoda restaurant that “floats” on a koi pond. Buffet and ala carte is available.Prices are reasonable and be sure to ask for the restaurant coupons upon check-in.Parking is located across the street right next to Ross Dress For Less.Our room was located next to the elevator and there was no problem with noise.Our room was clean and included a microwave and mini fridge.Housekeeping and maintenance is very quick and friendly. The Pagoda is in walking distance of numerous restaurants, stores, nail salons, Don Quixote, Wal-Mart, Ala Moana shopping center, Walgreens, and Target.Choose the Pagoda if you would like affordable accommodations and a very welcoming staff.

Hotel is old but nice. They wrap blankets in sheets, but carpet looked dirty. In room microwave oven and frige. Free parking and great location. If you're kamaaina, they have special rates usu. lower than anything on internet. each room has 2nd sink and small counter OUTSIDE the bathroom. Makes getting ready to go out quicker for families. Microwave oven and frige make eating leftovers easy. Grocery store 5 minute walk away. Walmart, Samsclub, Ross all across the street. Not as nice as big name hotels.

This is a 12 story hotel within walking distance of the Ala Moana mall and Waikiki beaches. This is not a new and modern resort, but the rooms are comfortable and the price is nice. Each room is cooled by a through the wall AC unit. Service from the staff is great. For added security, you need to use your room key to operate the elevators in the late afternoon and evening. You pay for parking which is in a convenient garage across the street. The only thing keeping this from a 5 star rating is the age of the facility. I would gladly stay here again.

MOLD EXPOSURE VERY HIGH! We came to the Pagoda Hotel for a 2 day conference. It was suggested we stay at the Pagoda and were offered a special rate for our stay which added up to $179 per night. We were given a "deluxe" room. On the 12 th floor, we found our room and entered to immediately notice a moldy smell. The carpet at the end of the bed was in a small depression, and the carpet itself was wet and spongy. On the interior of the A/C window unit you could see it was covered with black mold, and there was actually a huge - 1/4 inch mold spore hanging on the edge of the window frame, just above the a/c unit. There was mold coming through the paint on the ceilings, walls, and in the shower the mat was circled with mold. It looked as if a recent paint job had been intended to cover the mold seeping through. Attending our conference in the room above the Koi pond was no better - mold smell blowing all day through the a/c, with many of the attendees complaining about trouble breathing, raspy throats, and hoarse voices by day 2. By the end of our stay I was so sick that I was unable to speak directly with the hotel staff, altho they did a great job of ignoring us as we checked out and waited for our ride to the airport. Now that I am home and beginning to feel better, I am following up so no one else has to experience this dangerous place. MY ADVICE IS DO NOT STAY HERE. MOLD EXPOSURE IS EXTREMELY HIGH.  I have attempted to contact the health department, and have yet to speak with an actual person. I have today called corporate office for Aston Aqua, the owners of the Pagoda Property and await a return call.

We flew in from Australia at 6:30am and even though our room would not be ready till 3pm, Carlos looked after us and we were able to get a room at 10am. After a 9 hour flight with 2 kids, this small gesture was AMAZING! He made the check in experience quick and easy. My daughter had a virus and vomited on the bed... the cleaning staff fixed our bedsheets straight away and we are so grateful! The staff are friendly and we come here all the time because of our experience. 100% recommend this place if you have small children!

Older hotel. Elevator service could be better but kitchenette servicable and building is clean and quiet. Staff is very accomodating. Good location for shopping and long term stay. Not close to the beach but travel is easy.

The Pagoda holds a sweet memory for me, but it needs renovation. The staff was wonderful! The rooms need new towels...they were a bit stained.The koi are beautiful!!! I enjoyed spending time sitting and watching

From the start, staff was very friendly, especially Mr. Carlos Acob! Shout out to this front deskman! The room was kept tidy and clean by housekeeping and we didn’t find anything like hair left in the sink from previous guests as some of the locals commented when i told them where i was staying.Locking myself out of my room was not intimidating or anything since the security was willing to help and understanding.The movie rental kiosk is pretty good since it has some recent movies and even a very sparse selection of video games.It was definitely a pleasant stay and a good cheap place to have if you’re just looking for a place to sleep and stay.Only thing is the towels weren’t always replaced for everyone since it was a 3 person rental. But everything else was great!

Pagoda is a good and clean hotel, with a an ideal location. It is within walking distance to WalMart, Don Quijote, Ross, and Ala Moana Center. Its restaurant is excellent. For a smoker, it is a real hassle.

My house had to be fumigated so we looked for a hotel that allows dogs (she is a family member too!). I was told the Pagoda allows dogs (25 lbs and under). The Pagoda was a nice surprise. The staff were pure ALOHA. The price was great. The hotel is a bit dated, but our room with a kitchenette was very clean. Walmart is half a block away which was a good thing. For those who want a cheap room in Honolulu, this is the place.

Staff were amazing. Room was great, a little old but good place to stay. Had a great swimming pool and the restaurant had all these Koi swimming in it. Clean friendly and comfortable. We were near the lift but you couldn't hear it opening and closing.

The place doesn't look like the pictures and it should be listed as a motel. Parking is $47 which is outrageous. I was unwell and needed a bed ASAP, so I was willing to pay. I'd say if you're not driving and it's four to a room (there are two beds) this might be ok. The women at the front are very nice. I guess it's a 'know before you go' type of thing.

Stayed one week in this hotel because it was centrally located, away from the crowds of Waikiki, close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Walmart and Ross. Not disappointed with the location - easy to find restaurants and places to eat and to shop at. However, the hotel needs renovating and is showing its age. Room air conditioner was loud and there were black stains on the ceiling above it! We might have been breathing that soot or mold everyday. Minimum of toiletries in bathroom: small soap bar for sink use and for taking a bath. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. We were given a video card to see free movies in the room, but after getting a disc, could not figure out how to use video machine. Minimum of on-site parking stalls. Most are located in the parking shared with the Ross store across the street and this entails an addiitional cost, paid at the hotel. Beds are comfortable. Maid service is adequate.

They charge a deposit of $165 and they don't tell you about it. It's like a surprise and it's too late when you notice it. I'm a local guy here and I feel that's a huge amount for just a overnight stay.

The Pagoda hotel, ball room, restaurant and "carp", is a part of our island history. For many locals, it represented a special night when staying there or attending a family or social event. Today, it still draws many neighbor islanders and travelers who are looking for a reasonable priced not "Waikiki" hotel without high material expectations. What wins you over is the staff who goes out of their way to greet, assist, make you feel appreciated and a part of their family. Debbie Arakaki is one of those special down to earth and positive people who always greets you with a smile and acts in your best interest. The Pagoda Hotel should be very proud to have Debbie on their team!

Locals do favor this budget hotel as the prices are low and the location is central. The rooms and service leave much to be desired. Deferred maintenance can be seen in the rooms and bathroom, and the front desk service was perhaps the worst I have experienced in a long time, Friendly, but one person for many people resulted in an hour long wait for a key.

We stayed three weeks and it was a real home away from home. The staff were very friendly and helpful. the whole experience made us feel very comfortable. Combined with great food and excellent service at the restaurant made for a perfect holiday.

No complaints about staff and reception, helpful indeed.However the hotel rooms are in need retrofitting starting with carpets.Carpets are not suitable for asian pacific weather. Having tiles or faux timber is easier to maintain. If you are catering for tourists from temperate countries n need to have carpet then at least refurbish. next you have obsolete box aircon with thermostat which keep switching on and off when a certain temp is achieved. Well the periodic auto re start is a nuisance Next you have a basin in the room on the dresser table, and a basin in the washroom .. care to explain why?Above said , many positives such as the convenience store, free dvd rentals (no body has time to watch), lots of eateries nearby, short walk to Moana Loa(also in need of retrofitting as with airport!)If the major retrofittings were done, obviously we have to pay a much higher room rate

The local is very clean and I felt safe in the neighborhood, close to an Walmart and McDonalds. My room had a microwave and refrigerator, what was really helpful for a long trip (7 nights) but I'm not sure if this is available in all the rooms. Pool has a good size and it was pretty clean, just like the bathroons, the pool area in general was really enjoyable. I was just disappointed about not having breakfast included.

They had a good buffet. Not too many around now. The atmosphere was nice, and the staff treated us well. I like that they had a big variety of food, and everything I ate tasted good! I will definitely come again!

My wife and I arrived @ the lobby around 0730, an inconvenient time far from check-in @ 3:00pm.. Luckily Bill was kind enough to give us a temporary room till our 11th floor room was available....beats sitting around the lobby & it gave us a "home base" to stash necessities/toiletries from nearby Walmart till check-in. Debbie arrived by the time we arrived back and assisted in getting our room early.....much appreciated! We always find it convenient to have breakfast @ the Pagoda & you can either enjoy the ample buffet or order from their menu. Keith/John/Austin were always helpful and cheerfully accommodating which made our stay more enjoyable. Alice and Carlos were helpful as always with any problems/questions we had or assisting with getting a cab. We enjoyed the weekend seafood buffets & the ample offerings are quite tasty & a good deal....my mouth salivates as I write this! We shopped nearby Ala Moana, Walmart and Don Quijote & all are within walking distance from the hotel. There are numerous eateries close by but we ate mostly @ Pagoda.....more convenient as well. Our room was clean, beds comfy, aircon worked fine and we always enjoyed quality sleep throughout our one week stay. I love the ambiance here but it wouldn't be without the great people working there and why we've considered it "home" year after year! Looking forward to another stay in a few months!

review_body: my stay in the hotel, was very nice. The hotel room was really clean and the hotel at night was very beautiful. The lady in the front desk, Alice was really, really helpful. Pagoda is a very convinient place to stay. And i will DEFINITELY come back :) mahalo & thank you Alice for making my stay feel like home !

Lynda at the front dest was SOOOOOO helpful! She never made me feel like an inconvenience! Greeted me as soon as she was done with the last guest! You know how so many places dont even greet you?! Or finish up filing something before they call you to their desk?! That was jot the case here! Lynda helped me understand what i needed to pay for, found me a great rate for a room upgrade, helped me figure out the free shuttle, and helped with helping us find parking! The room is very clean and spacious! Lots of great amenities! SOOOOO WORTH THE PRICE! great location! Did i mention that Lynda was the best?! Love coming to places where the service is great! wish there was a Lynda everywhere we went! Great sincere service!

We had an excellent stay in this hotel, the room is very clean, pillows and beds are awesome! Super friendly staff! The location is great, close to shopping centres, restaurants and the beach! I will definitely recommend it to my friends and families!

We waited in line 30 minutes while two groups were attempting to register. We had preregistered and prepaid, however they scanned our credit card again for a deposit of another $170. No breakfast, rough crowd, and when we got to room only two outlets worked, garbage hadn’t been dumped from previous tenant...and they had parking garage but we drove around block two times trying to find parking, ended up paying $13 for overnight parking. Our room didn’t look like picture they advertised, beware! Plan was to lay out by pool until leaving for airport, pool didn’t open until 10am and we couldn’t wait to get out of there. Not a good experience!

The customer service provided by Kelly R. Bokin is just great! In such a location as Honolulu, where great hotels compete with each other, it's really the quality of its customer service that make a hotel stand out. Mr. Bokin provides great customer service just by his overall friendliness, his courteous professionalism, and taking proactive initiative in solving customer's issues. Besides Mr. Bokin, the hotel has such a fantastic location! It's prices is very affordable despite its prime location!

Love the bang for your buck you get when staying here. Love all the free movies and PS3 games you can get. Quaint hotel and nice remodeled lobby. Just a block from the biggest mall in the state. The rooms were clean and I found it unusually delightful that their were 2 sinks that was located in the main room as well as the bath room. Paul the Manager there was quite helpful. The handwritten note with well wishes for a pleasant stay was appreciated. The breakfast buffet and dinner buffet is definitely a must eat experience with local fare. Mahalo Pagoda hotel

Huge shout out to the staff and management of Pagoda Hotel for helping me enjoy a new year of life. I was excited to spend the weekend here because of the location, size, convenience and atmosphere. I don't enjoy gigantic buildings and properties that take you all day to navigate with a map, and through large crowds of people, where everyone is just blended together. The Pagoda Hotel offered all the comforts of home which I appreciate and prefer. The elevators to the rooms is a quick few steps away from the front desk. The public spaces were clean, well kept and always had a great smell to them. It was nice and cozy, simple and enjoyable. Our room was clean and well put together with more than enough space to enjoy but also to feel relaxed in. Convenient location allowed us to simply walk to different eateries around the area whenever we felt. Parking was simple. Shop located in lobby with so many things to choose from. There was power outage on the block our first nigh there, but there was no panick anywhere. Hotel staff were addressing things well and when we were able to confirm our safety, we ended up going right back to bed. It felt so great to relax and I want to thank Hotel Manager Paul and staff for helping me celebrate my birthday. Paul even took the time to wish me a Happy Birthday in a hand written letter. Fricken awesome! Aloha All Day!

This is an older hotel which reminds us of Uncle Billy’s Hilo & Kona Hotel back home on the Big Island. From when we checked in, to changing our check-out date, Carlos has been AWESOME. He’s friendly, very helpful, and an all around hospitable person. Do not let the physical appearances fool you; great for those on a budget, close to convenient shopping (even some high scale shopping), and a great value.

Haven't been to the Pagoda in over 30 years, but it's still an old favorite. Yes, it's an older hotel, but the standard double beds room is spacious and comfortable. Although I was on the 7th floor, I didn't expect the noise level from Rycroft Street, and garbage trucks at 4:30 am on a Sunday morning making a ruckus for 20 minutes.Checking in staff, Lynda, was very helpful with shuttle pass and breakfast coupon for a fabulous breakfast brunch at 7am for $9.95. I had miso soup, fresh green salad, fried rice, soft scrambled eggs and fish! Took pictures of the koi ponds surrounding the restaurant. Beautiful!The hotel is conveniently located next to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Sam's Club and Walmart and Ross across the street, and many eateries all around. Hotel has a shuttle service to the mall and Waikiki. City buses nearby make it a convenient place to stay, to Chinatown and airport.Mahalo, Pagoda. Definitely

Pagoda isn't on a beach and doesn't have great views from rooms but you can't beat the location and value for your money here. If you need a car, parking is only $13 a day in either the small parking lot at the back of the hotel or the large garage across the street. Every one we met at the front desk and other areas of the hotel were always very helpful and pleasant. The rooms aren't fancy but they are clean and comfortable. There is a small refrigerator and microwave in the room along with a coffee maker so we had some meals right in our room.Pagoda is located very close to a very interesting store, Don Quixote which you have to see. it has groceries, clothing, food,and almost everything you need at good prices. They also have a lot of locally made products for tourists. There are many restaurants within easy walking distance along with Walmart, Walgreens and Sam's club. A little further walk is to the Ala Moana Center where you can shop till you drop and also dine at 3 food courts and many restaurants.We were there visiting family and stayed there for the first time. We usually stayed with family and friends but opted to try the Pagoda for a change. Based upon our visit, we will stay at the Pagoda anytime we return.

Front Desk People and housekeeping are a happy bunch and I enjoyed the stay even more because of them.Walking distance from the shops and the beach.Rooms were clean, bed was comfy, plenty of closet space and room above the closet for our two big suitcases....and then the big screen TV was great.We stayed for 7 days and enjoyed how easy it was to the freeways and the beach.We will be back.

front desk service is excellant and housekeeping too! love this property and all my stays in Honolulu will be at the Pagoda. shopping near by all walking distance and walk to ala moana beach in slippers no problem. Thanks Pagoda staff!!!!

We grew up in Hawaii and were visiting family and knew this property for a long time, having eaten here from "small kid time". Stayed here for 3 nights. It is not fancy but is tidy and has good security. The location is central with good access to lots of things, so as long as you aren't hoping for beachfront, you're good. Very loud overnight with garbage service occurring. We could tell by smell that the property is being treated for bugs. Nevertheless, we were disappointed to find cockroaches _in the refrigerator_. This should be fairly airtight and roach-free. Luckily our food was all bagged tightly. When we checked out that morning, front desk response was not "I'm sorry" but "did you tell maintenance?" No, I'm checking out so I'm telling you. Disappointed in roaches and response.

Great location to amenities, very nice people. Lynda at the front desk was especially helpful and kind. The rooms are not fancy, but perfect for an extended stay. We have had family members come and go and hey have been very accommodating.

Stayed there for 6 weeks every year from 1974 till 1984. Loved the koi, location, food, bar and room service. When I started paid $10 a night. In 1984 paid $28 a night. So close to Magic Island, Ala Moana Shopping Center, Waikiki, easy trip downtown. Easy trip to Tantalus lookout.

The hotel has been there for a long time, so some rooms were being renovated, but it was still a nice place to stay with reasonable price. The most interesting part is over at the Floating Restauraunt's koi pool. There are hundreds, maybe even thousands of all sizes and all colors of koi fish. You can even get food to feed them. Beautiful sight.

From the time we arrived at Pagoda Hotel front desk to checking out was an overall good feeling. Special Thanks to Lynda who answered my call at the very beginning of making accommodations. Lynda provided a Welcoming atmosphere while we waited to be taken care of for our room. Anyone that stays at a hotel knows that all you want to do is get checked in and rest from that long day. Location of Hotel is within walking distance from shopping, eating, etc. Trust you see the value of staying at Pagoda Hotel.

Stayed here for 2 nights on return from Las Vegas to Perth. Stayed here because the reviews were good and the prices was what we were looking to pay. Hotel was a bit old, on check in we were given a room that had ants but they quickly moved us to another room higher up which was not problems. Lovely lady that checked us in, nothing was an issue. The complex is great with a pool and restaurant with a pond that has heaps of fish. The complex had a laundromat which was a bonus. Great location to the shopping mall. Walmart and Ross's across the road, both great for shopping. Walmart had a great Haiwaiin BBQ eatery that was good price and food. Would recommend if you dont mind the older style hotel. Staff great.

You have to accept this hotel for what it is and what it is not. It is not by the beach. It is in a business and residential area. We stayed here as we had family business to attend in Honolulu. It was perfect for that. The rooms were clean, quiet, and the air conditioning was a loud window unit. There is a very small pool and the hotel is attached to the Pagoda Floating Restaurant (a local all you can eat place). The location is good and you can walk to local restaurants and shopping. It is not a tourist hotel, but most of the hotel guests that I saw appeared to be tourists! They charge a resort fee (for what I don't know) but they also have good parking for a very reasonable rate (for Honolulu). I would stay again, but only if I had local business to attend. If I were a tourist, I would stay near the beach.

Good location, and great customer service. Thanks Carlos Acob and Kelly :) The AC was nice to have if I needed it. I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet next door. I'd stay here again. Bring a cash deposit to avoid holds on your credit card.

I was there for 2-weeks work attachment, and even brought my family along so it was a work-cation.Let me tell you why Pagoda Hotel has been my only preference: it has the best location - Walmart, Sams Club, Ross, and Ala Moana Mall, which theres a shuttle every 30-35mins;Of course, there are eateries in close proximity so you really have all your shopping needs; andNot far from the Waikiki area if you want to try the beach. Just take the shuttle to Park Shore.I personally love that my daughter enjoys swimming in the pool, and is super fond of the Koi fish pond!So I can also add that it really is a family oriented hotel.Dont forget to try Pagoda's Dinner Buffet - it is to die for - all you can eat seafood, sushi, and assorted desserts! Let them know youre staying at the hotel and you get 10% discount. Great deal!From my experience, Pagoda Hotel has always been my go-to for short stays or transits.And over the years, I have maintained good communication and eventual longterm friendship with Mr Kelly Bokin, Customer Service Supervisor. I 200% recommend him for all your booking needs because he always, always, delivers with the Aloha spirit!Thank you again Pagoda Hotel for yet another great experience! Mahalo and Kommol tata!

Check-in with Alice and Carlos was efficient & the warm smiles of recognition was quite welcoming. Our week stay was trouble-free & Debbie, Alice & Carlos always asked if we needed anything each time we passed the front desk. This time we ate @ the Pagoda most times because the food is significantly tastier, more convenient, and better deal than eating elsewhere. We usually stay on the 11th floor but opted for the 5th as it's handier for my bad knee & amount of shopping we usually do when there. Our room was clean, the aircon worked perfectly & service by housekeeping was excellent.....we always enjoy our stays here because everyone is always so genuinely cheerful & willing to make our stay enjoyable. We were able to walk to Walmart, Walgreen's & to some of the eateries which are all within walking distance from Pagoda. For places further away a taxi is only a phone call from the front desk if there isn't one waiting in the front. I love the ambiance @ the Pagoda and truly an oasis in the midst of the hectic touristy scene in Waikiki. This has a more "family" or "ohana" feel to it and quite comforting, genuine and laid back! Of course, the Pagoda wouldn't be what it is without the people who make it such a memorable stay & the staff here will move mountains to assist you!! Thanks....without a doubt we will be back for sure! Our special thanks to Carlos, Alice and Debbie. If you moan and groan.....you'll never be happy wherever you are! Smile & you'll get smiles in return! Aloha and a hui hou!

review_body: We enjoyed our one night stay at the Pagoda on our way to Las Vegas. The hotel was very comfortable and in a convenient location to Ala Moana mall and the top of the Waikiki strip. Our room was spacious and well-appointed. The hotel’s facilities were good and included a pool, on-site convenience store and an attached restaurant. We had both dinner and breakfast in the restaurant and we were very pleased with the food and service.

I had booked a room at the hotel directly with Mr. Kelly Bokin, Guest Services Supervisor, and I cannot thank him enough for the excellent services provided...from booking a room to checking in and checking out. The room provided was just the right size and accommodated my needs without any hassles. It is away from the noise and crowd of Waikiki Beach but close to a major shopping mall (the Ala Moana shopping center), Wall Mart, Ross, and other convenient stores within short walking distance. It has a good restaurant adjacent to the hotel and located near other restaurants with varied cuisines of choice. What I like best about staying at the Pagoda is the friendly atmosphere and excellent spirit of aloha displayed by the staff. I always stay at the Pagoda Hotel during my visits or transit through Honolulu and will continue to do so.I would highly recommend the hotel to other visitors who are looking for a good reasonably priced place to stay in Honolulu. M. Henry

review_body: I stayed at the Pagoda from Aug 20-26 2018. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I like staying at Pagoda because of the location, it is very convenient to stores walmart and the mall. Mr. Kelly Bokin was very helpful and professional from when I did my booking to when I checked out. Hurricane cause a disruption in our travel plans, but Mr. Bokin was there to assist us. Thank you so much Kelly!

The service was very good I like it especially the front desk Alice and Carlos they help me a lot even Cora at housekeeping the room is ok but the problem there's some bugs but they are very accomodating to move me to a better room.

This hotel is a place to stay if you're looking for low budget. It wasn't awful however, the room itself was mediocre. In our room we actually had mold on the ceiling and had to call the front desk for them to clean it. The location is in a sketchy area. I didn't feel comfortable walking anywhere without my husband. There is a floating restaurant on hotel grounds however, the food wasn't anything to write home about. If you can afford it, stay elsewhere.

Spend a little extra money and go somewhere else. This place is not worth the few bucks you’ll save in the long run. My husband and I needed a last-minute hotel, and we also didn’t want to spend a ton of money on an expensive resort-type hotel, so we landed on the Pagoda. The pictures online are deceiving. The place is an absolute dump. In addition, they required a $200 deposit that we’re still waiting to receive back.

Pagoda is a long time local destination. Lynda at front desk was great for customer service. aloha g can't think of anymore details; location is great for all the restaurants in the area. jlakjds;lfkjsa;dlkjsd;alfkdjsa;lsdkjf;ds

Well from the Booking to the Checking in all was awesome, the website help a (1) night deposit however i was wanting to pay my reservation in full, they were friendly and fast. Upon checking in Carlos was awesome and they had one room available as the other was being cleaned and was able to precheck all rooms and guest at the same time. This was a wonderful weekend with the Ohana and will recommend for future visits.

We flew in from Sydney and stayed here for one night before boarding the ship. Our room was not ready, but the lady at the front desk kept our luggage in a safe location. Our room was ready earlier than expected. It was clean, the shower worked well, the bed was also comfortable. We had a late dinner in the floating restaurant. The service was really fantastic at the front desk and in the restaurant. It's a close walk to Walmart, Sam's Club, and the famous Ala Moana Shopping Center, as well as all kinds of different restaurants. The free shuttle bus picked us up right at the hotel and took us to the waterfront where we could walk and explore Oahu and get on the Hop on Hop Off tram. We loved staying at this budget-friendly place.

We used this hotel as a place to stay for less than 24 hours - a place to shower, and sleep a bit before heading out on a 1:45 am flight. The hotel seemed clean, but a bit dated. That being said, our room was clean and the shower had good temperature and water pressure. Mattresses were a bit saggy. The elevators did have air fresheners - I am not a big fan of artificial smells...but the room was not bad. The air conditioner worked well. No view for us. We walked to the Walmart for some miscellaneous items and also walked for dinner. Many Asian-based restaurants in the area. There were a lot of homeless on the street which always is difficult to see.As we had a rental car, the meters on the street stopped at 6:00 pm, so we just paid the meter for 2 hours, and left for the airport at 11:00 pm avoiding the hotel parking fee (thought it was reasonable for Waikiki). The front desk allowed us to waive the resort fee as well because were were only there for 5 hours and did not use the public facilities or internet. Very kind an good customer service.Overall - a more budget based hotel on Oahu. If I were staying for more than a day or two - I would definitely look for something closer to the beach. But, the hotel worked perfectly for our purposes and budget.The laundry area was fairly large - easy to get a washer or dryer. The ice was located in the laundry room on the first floor.

I stay at Pagoda every chance I get to go to Oahu. It is affordable and well worth the price. The location is perfect for those without a rental car or transportation, walking distance to Ross's across the street, Walmart and Sam's club close by and Ala Moana Center just a block away. How Convenient. Also it is next door to LikeLike Diner, Pagoda floating Restaurant with beautiful Koa and 1 huge Ulua in the pond that surrounds the restaurant. Many other restaurants close by such as Thai, Japanese, Chinese foods and many other places to eat nearby. Also there is a small convenient store downstairs if you need toiletries or snacks.

I stayed here for 2 nights with my 6 year old son. We arrived before check in time and unfortunately our room wasn't ready yet. The lady behind the counter told us she could hold our bags for us, gave us some food to feed the fish and offered some suggestions of where we could go for lunch nearby. When we returned our room was ready. We were greeted by a different person who was as equally helpful as the first. Our room was clean and comfortable. It had a small fridge, cooktop, microwave and dishes as well. The room was pretty large also. Every time we called on the staff they went above and beyond to help us with whatever we needed. They treated my son so sweetly. We accidentally left behind a few small toys and the housekeeping mailed them right away, we received them the very next day. I can't say enough good things about the staff here!! We had a wonderful time here and will be sure to stay here again on our next trip to Honolulu.

My wife and I stayed from April 20th to the 26th to attend a trade show, check our eyes and a bit of business and shopping. We arrived @ the Pagoda around 0700 & was greeted with a big smile by Jo Ann @ the front desk and left our suitcases with her till a room was available, we strolled over to Walmart to buy toiletries, water and snacks we needed. We finally got a room @ noon and despite the long wait, the welcoming smiles during check-in from Debbie and Jo Ann was pleasant and started us in the right mood for the day. I kept seeing these ladies over the week and I felt like coming home each time we passed the front desk and we smiled and joked @ each other! Carlos was also very friendly and helpful. People make or break any business and these people are dedicated and definitely keepers! I plan to return in September and hope they will still be there!Our room was clean and had all the amenities we required, the air-con kept the room nice and cool throughout our week stay. We enjoyed the Sunday Buffet and there was plenty of tasty food to choose from. There is also a convenient shop near the elevators for necessities you may need, a handy Hertz rental car desk is located in the lobby as well as a tour desk should you want to tour Oahu.One of the main things I love about staying here is the location, plenty of various eateries of different ethnicities nearby and within walking distance, including Walmart, Sam's Club, and Ala Moana Shopping Center. There are usually taxi's available in front of the hotel but one can be had quickly if you ask the front desk to call one.We've stayed here for a few years now and it's become my go-to "home" whenever we're in Honolulu & won't stay anywhere else! A lot of Polynesians, locals and others from neighboring islands stay here and the majority are friendly and good to talk to.

review_body: Very basic hotel in a good location. It's definitely a little outdated, but it's a good option if you are on a budget. Most of the hotels here are very expensive, so this isn't a bad option if you don't want to spend a fortune.

The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our visit. Our room was clean, comfortable, and very spacious, with a mini refrigerator and microwave. The air conditioner is window mounted, but works well and is quiet. The location of this hotel is great. It is a 10 minute walk to WalMart, and about 20 minutes to Ala Moana Center shopping mall. Just across from that is Magic Island park, with beautiful sunrise and sunset views. We didn't use the swimming pool, but walked by it, and it looked nice and clean. The $10 per day parking fee is very reasonable, and includes "come and go" privileges. Our only regret with this hotel is that we did not stay here more nights - it was much nicer than the other places we stayed on Oahu.

Ending part of their renovation. A lot better than before.Lots of good restaurants in walking vicinity.Ala Moana Shopping center, 15 minute walk away.We stayed there for a conference so we only slept, showered and freshened up there.ROSS, a discount clothing store is right across the street. A covered parking garage is right a cross the street.

This is a very clean and serviced hotel. Has great amenities, alittle walk to Ala Mona shopping close to many great shops and restaurants. Has upgraded alot of the rooms. staff are always helpful and polite. We have stayed here many times. It is very well priced.

The rooms are older and clean.Security in the lobby. Parking lot is smoking area.Access to shopping is easy.Staff are friendly. Food is exceptional.I have stayed at The Pagoda often in the last 30 years.I feel safe when there and can sleep comfortably.I would rate them a 4

Chose this hotel for 2 nights because of the low price. Very glad we didn't have to stay longer. The staff was friendly enough and it is an easy walk to Ala Moana Center and there's a Walmart across the street. The downside is you don't want to walk around that area after dark with the kids, homeless and junkies all around (one guy was holding a lighter under a spoon right across the street). Our 8th floor room almost seemed to amplify the outside noise, probably because of the old window mount AC unit. Cars, sirens, people talking (or yelling), and early morning trash pickup all very loud, make it very hard to have a relaxing family vacation here.

The Pagoda is a famous old hotel located a couple blocks from Ala Moana Shopping Center. Shopping is probably the main reason people would want to stay here. Having lived in Hawaii in the 90s, this hotel was already decades old then, so I was a little worried when I was sent here on business and put in the Pagoda. Honestly, I was expecting the worst, but it was better than expected. It’s an average mid-range hotel. I can appreciate that they are trying. The sea blue wall in the rooms is a nice touch. There are minor frustrations from street noise, but it’s Honolulu, and it’s normal no matter where you are. The rooms are spacious and have a good size bathroom. There is a little snack shop off the lobby which was handy. If you would prefer to spend your money at the mall and not on the hotel this is a good choice. For me, it served its purpose. Plenty of restaurants near the hotel, and Walmart is a block away.

We stayed one night and the keys had to be re-done twice to get them to work w/elevator and door. Room was clean and comfortable. Beds were small but comfy. It was quite noisy but that is to be expected in downtown city area. Free DVDs and Wi-Fi with stay, parking is $10 a day and the parking garage is tiny. If you have a van or SUV the ceiling clearance is very low. Roof racks may not make it. No bugs or noise from other rooms that we noticed. Decent hotel for the price. Cool koi fish pond outside the restaurant next door.

very roomy, mini stove with sink and two mini frig and a microwave. great for family stay. furniture a little older but no complaints. front desk check in was pleasant. the check out was a bit confusing, receipt not easy to understand when paying cash and credit card.

A bit of old fashioned aloha. The hotel is not in perfect shape (old carpet) but the atmosphere is very congenial. Moderately priced, spacious rooms, numerous varied restaurants near-by. Wish the pool had been heated. The shuttle is useful if you don't have a car.

I lived in Honolulu for few years in the past, so I knew what to expect, that is why my rating is "so generous". Hallways are smelly, rooms are old and outdated. But sheets and towels seem clean, there was hot water and the studio had fridge, microwave, hot plates and even some dishes. If you like retro style motels and don't mind in-window A/C units and loud street noise, and just want to stay few nights outside of Waikiki, this hotel is fine. It is located close to Walmart, grocery store, discount apparel store and many restaurants. Beware - the amenity fee, taxes, parking could significantly increase the advertised price. Also, the $200 deposit is quite unusual in hotel industry, particularly for such an old and run-down hotel.

I live on Kauai and recently stayed at the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu. Just found out I have cancer and was there for tests. The folks at the Pagoda where some of the friendliest I stayed in during vacations or this stay. They were exceptional in helping me get through the week and people who were there on vacation gave me the same feedback. It's not the Ritz but the rooms are clean and quite, the beds are comfortable, the house keeping is good and the restaurant connected to the hotel was very convenient and good.

Was very disappointed at the lack of room amenities....only a coffeemaker, toaster and microwave. No tea or milk for non coffee drinkers or any cutlery. However, all the staff were very nice and we appreciated the convenience of the little onsight shop and the free hotel shuttle.

conveniently Located , walking distance to Ross, Walmart and Macy's there is a mini mart at GF. there is a salon beside the hotel and a coffee shop. The hotel itself is not new BUT the staffs are so polite and helpful,the room is spacious, there's ref, vault, ironing utilities, TV, a playstation with (1) One console. unlimited rent of dvd. I would love to go back and stay at this hotel again. Cons: stayed at 6th floor, the doors are quit loud, and you can hear the noise from the swimming guests

If you are looking for a low cost hotel, then this might be for you. It is clean and has a mini-market and ATM. Location is not near the water and even though I was on the top floor, the street noise was loud. Nothing at all special or notably nice. I won't stay here again.

The room is quaint with barely enough room for 3 adults. The bathroom has only one towel rack, so there is not enough room to hang towels to dry and/or hang clothes while showering. There are only two elevators that can probably hold 5 people with suitcases, but one was inoperable. We had to walk up and down several flights of stairs to allow folks with bags to use the elevator. The location is convenient, but I would not walk around at night alone. The streets appear unsafe with dark side streets and a very busy main Street.

This hotel has been around for many years and I'm afraid it's showing it's age a little. I stayed here once as a child and I am both nostalgically pleased and a bit disappointed that it looks pretty much the same as it did 22 years ago. The bathroom fixtures are old and the grout is cracking, especially in the spots where glass doors have been removed from the tub. Some wall damage (was the kitchenette remodeled?) was noticeably covered over with blank switch plates. The walls seemed thin and I could hear other guests fairly distinctly in the hallways, as well as the garbage truck in the morning. We had a hard time using the keys in the elevator, and that seemed to be a common problem. That said, the room was spacious and comfortable. My partner and I spent a lot of time cuddling in bed and the sheets were lovely. The kitchenette had everything I needed for the basics. The location is extremely convenient, with bus stops, bike kiosks, and the mall all very nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful. Amenities include morning newspaper in the lobby, free shuttle to Waikiki, free movie and game rentals (playstation set up in each room), pool, and a discount at the attached restaurant, which is worth a visit for dinner.

If you're used to staying at Hilton, Sheraton or Holiday Inn, this place is maybe a 1-2 star at best. Old tired rooms with a dirty floor and old-old doors. Children running down the hall at night, sketchy people hanging out in the parking lot and noisy as doors slamming and wall behind bed shaking when the guests slam the door. Also, no food available. Only reason I gave it 2 stars was because it's within walking distance of Ala Moana Shopping center.

Well equiped and spacious rooms and bathroom. Convenient location nearby historical sites and park and within a walking distance from railway station. No meals (including breakfast) are available at the property.

Hi everyone, If ur looking for the exact middle of things then Pagoda Hotel is your choice. As you know Honolulu has it all from extravagant Hotels to a crack in a wall kinda Hotel/Motel. Pagoda Hotel's deal, is right smack in the middle. Price is good and the room is good. Hotel looks like it's been there for ages speaking of the building however it's renovated from the inside looking clean and very decent. Now I did say Pagoda Hotel is right in the middle of things except for one thing, Location! It's location is extremely excellent! Alamoana Mall, Walmart, Ross, Waikiki... You name it. All are in walking distance! Yes and a ton of food local food place all around the Hotel. I would definitely go back to Pagoda Hotel.

review_body: We chose this hotel because of its location. Ala Moana is within walking distance, as are a few chain stores. The Pagoda offers a shuttle service to various hotels which are located near some of Honolulu's attractions. Since we had a rental car, we did not use it. The rooms were spacious, the beds very comfortable, but there was something tired about ours. However, who spends much time in their hotel room in Hawaii!! Free parking was available in a structure right across the street. Views were of nothing but tall buildings and streets, which did make considerable noise. The window A/C unit added more noise. Countertops were of some industrial-grade fabrication, not attractive at all. Discounts were available for guests at their adjacent restaurant. The food was just okay--many of the buffet offerings were cold when they should have been hot (cold scrambled eggs). Staff in the hotel as well as the restaurant were very good. The Pagoda offers a lesser price for stays in Honolulu, including a pool and nice landscaping. They have a caveat about bugs in the room, which didn't bother me. I sent two tiny creepy crawlies in the bathroom to their doom. Bugs in Hawaii are common, so don't let that sour your opinion of the Pagoda.

We booked a short stay at the Pagioda, in large part because of its central location in downtown Honolulu. It did not disappoint. Except for a rocky check-in, we were very happy with the hotel and its staff, and the hotel's famous floating restaurant (see my separate review) was great. This is a modest hotel with modestly priced rooms with anenities that include a shuttle service to the Alamoana shopping mall and Waikiki. Unless you need a more upscale hotel -- or one right on the beach -- the Pagoda should be on your radar.

Stayed there twice in last two years. First time it was enjoyable, second time not so much. Other guests were noisy at night with open door partying. Notified security after second and third night. Overall a great place to stay with two double beds and microwave oven and convenience to shopping and restaurants.

This hotel quite close to alamoana shopping centre which very convenient to get anything such as food or shopping... the staff really helpful. They also provide shuttle to waikiki whereas good spot to see the sun set.

I stayed 2 nights which was 2 nights too long. The rooms are old and in need of update eventho they have done a little painting. All night long the window air conditioner rattled and was noisy. It turned on and off and when it turned on it was like a freight train coming thru the room. I got maybe 2 hours sleep. This hotel is the last on my list of acceptable accommodations when I visit Honolulu again. 2 nights cost over $400.00 which is way too high for a terrible hotel like this one is

Like some of the others mentioned, convenience is a major plus as this hotel is located just minutes from Ala Moana Beach/Shopping Center, Waikiki along with stores such as Walmart, Ross, Don Quijote and Sam's Club and several restaurants/eateries located within a couple of city blocks of this hotel. There are also free shuttle vans available that pick up guests and drive them to various locations in the area. Those who wish to venture beyond Ala Moana and Waikiki have the option of using public transportation, TheBus, which has several major bus lines/stops located within a few blocks away or renting a car from Hertz car rental which has a desk in the lobby. If you decide on eating at their restaurant, I would highly recommend their savory $12.95 breakfast buffet or scrumptious dinner buffets which are priced at $19.95 from Monday to Thursday. In addition to convenience, I would also have to say that this hotel offers very good value for the price. On a final note, I must add that the owner of this hotel, Peter Savio, has to my knowledge, single-handedly done more in supplying affordable homes to local residents here on Oahu than any other individual over the past decade--which I take to mean that he is more interested in helping people than making a killing in real estate investment, which I honestly believe has a positive trickle down effect on the friendly and accommodating staff at Pagoda. In my opinion, I can't ask for anything more.

We spent a week and found the staff very friendly and helpful. Room was spacious, clean, with good wifi and cable. Restaurant next door has good buffet breakfast for $10! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Stayed here for a baseball tournament and had a blast. Room needs more renovations, but good room for a great price. Who actually hangs out in their room on vacation any way right?The restaurant buffet is totally worth it! Pagoda guests get 10% off which comes out to a $10 breakfast buffet! Definitely can't go wrong with that!

All hotel staff was pleasant and friendly. The room was nicely renovated. It was clean. There was a microwave, good size refrigerator, safe and a sink even other than the one in the bedroom which came in handy. There was free newspaper everyday. Another amenity that was awesome to us was the free DVD rental. You can watch as much as you want. The location was awesome. Close to stores, beach and eateries. Parking was $10/day. If there wasn't any parking on the property you can park in the Ross' parking structure. We were lucky two days we had parking but one evening we had to park at Ross', however, it's right across the street. We would definitely stay at the Pagoda again.

Bitter taste at the end of our stay because of theft in our room by staff (I assume). Items were not in full view but in the freezer. Excuses given by housekeeping but circumstances do not match report.

2 stars for location, and good food during conference. No such thing as quality anything here. Staff was not joyous to speak to, "deluxe room" is a joke, carpet in room was horrendous, bathroom looked scary, view was nothing to look at, A/C was obnoxiously annoying, faulty phone that kept turning on speaker, and last but not least; ants, and roaches to keep you company. Don't waste your hard earned money here unless you're willing to settle for less...

The front desk associates were professional, personal, and helpful. The housekeeper was helpful and friendly.I felt comfortable upon arrival and the hotel was appropriate in appearance, odor, and feel.Perfect central location for business. There adequate shopping locations, restaurants' and tourist attractions within a mile radius.The ocean is located about 3 miles from the hotel and can be reached by walking.

The people at Pagoda Hotel were super helpful and nice. However, the hotel itself was in such bad shape I could not wait to check out. The pictures online do not really represent what it looks like in person. The room I checked into was very outdated and the bathroom needed a renovation - there were hard water stains around the tub's drain. It was also weird that the wall right by the bed was mirrored and that there was a sink right by the bed. The AC unit is a wall unit and every time it would turn on, it sounded like a car engine. I was also by the pool which mean I heard everyone screaming day in and out (the pool was also very very tiny). The location was great because it was walking distance to the Ala Moana Center but that's really the only highlight - the location.

We stayed at the Pagoda for 2 days while in Honolulu for a reunion. We knew it was a budget hotel, but decided we'd try it to save some money rather than staying at an expensive hotel in Waikiki. The staff was always friendly and helpful. On arrival we were told our room was being changed to one that had a newly remodeled bathroom, which I really appreciated. The room was basic, but clean, the bed was comfortable. There was a microwave, a small fridge, and flat screen TV. The restaurant with bar is attached to the hotel, and both appeared to be clean. The food is buffet style, but we didn't eat there so can't comment on the food. The bar area was warm and inviting, the staff very friendly. The hotel is 3.5 blocks from the largest outdoor mall in the world, called Ala Moana. They have a very large food court there with many choices, plus restaurants. Food we had there was very good. The shops are mostly high end plus Macy's, and it's a great place to walk through, get some exercise, and people watch. One of the best amenities with the Pagoda is that the room rate includes free shuttle to Waikiki Beach and Ala Moana Shopping Center (and anywhere in between) and back every half hour from about 9a.m. to 9p.m. Overall, our stay was fine, no complaints or unhappy surprises and the price was right. I would stay at the Pagoda again if it was a short stay, but probably not for a longer vacation where I'd prefer a little more luxury and a place closer to the beach.
