review_body: Great location and great price. It's far from the main beach, but very close to walmart and the large shopping center. It's also within a 15 min walk to a small park and beach area on the other side of the mall. I had a little "sticker shock" for hawaiian hotels, so when I was looking for a one night layover hotel, this one hit the spot. It's clearly old, and in need of updating. There was a funky smell in the hall on my floor, but the room was clean and the funk didn't smell in there. The A/C was very loud, but it worked, so I wasn't going to complain. Would stay again on a layover, but would be unlikely to stay for extended period. The staff I interacted with were all super friendly and check-in and check out were a breeze.

My wife and I recently visited Honolulu for a medical convention and my company booked us at the Pagoda Hotel due to its lower rates. It looked nice enough from the online photos, so we decided to stay. Our room was large and had a king-size bed. It had a window air conditioner which worked well. That's the good news. The entire hotel needs to be updated. It is in downtown Honolulu, far from the popular Waikiki Beach area. There are not a lot of restaurants around the hotel, except their own on-site restaurant, which has old facilities and limited selection. It is conveniently located near a WalMart and a Walgreen's and local grocery stores. On a brighter note, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. From check-in to check-out, we were treated very well. Another plus was the DVD rental program which was included in the room rate. We watched a different movie every night. However, during the week we stayed there, the water was turned off completely during one weekday morning and the hallway carpeting was replaced over four days. Next time, we will personally pay the difference and stay at a higher class hotel (Hilton Waikiki Beach Resort or the Ala Moana).

We were arriving late for our trip tp Honolulu,and wanted a comfortable place that had a car rental on site so i could rent a car the next day,because I did not want to drive that night with little sleep. I booked the Pagoda and was please with the hotel and its attached restaurant.It is an older hotel, that has updated most of it's basics, like the beads chairs painting etc. things like sinks bathtub are somewhat dated but clean and work. It had a comfortable feel, and the staff were accommodating.For us it hit all our needs. We really liked the gift shop it had everything, and the staff on duty was great.

The Pagoda Hotel is a good no frills hotel if you want to get by cheap(ish) in Honolulu. We paid about $120 per night, which is pretty good considering Hawaii hotel prices and extra amenity fees. You can get a AAA discount as well as other discounts shown on their website. If you want to bring a car, parking is $10 a day at the parking garage across the street (the garage is shared with the Ross store). Amenities include a small pool, air conditioning, and access to new release DVDs (there is a small kiosk in the lobby). The hotel room I stayed in was clean and maintained well. There is no free breakfast, but there is a breakfast buffet ($10/person if you're a hotel guest at Pagoda) a half block down at the Pagoda restaurant. The hotel is about a 15 minute drive from Manoa Falls Trail and Diamond Head.The Pagoda is located within walking distance to a 24 hour Walmart and Walgreens, a Ross store, and to the Ala Moana mall. It is also located very closely to plenty of restaurants. It is about a 1.5 mile walk to the Honolulu Art Museum and to Waikiki. Overall, I found the Pagoda to be reasonably priced and maintained well. It was not super fancy and did not have an ocean view, but for the money saved it was worth it staying away from Waikiki hotels. If I find myself back in Hawaii, I would be happy to stay here again and get by cheap.

I really enjoyed staying at the Pagoda for one night. The room was great, there's a bathtub and you could rent DVDs for free. I also took advantage of the pool in the morning, since the check out was comfortable late at 12 o'clock. The hotel is close to the Mall, but a bit away from the beach. Its only downside maybe.

Walking into the Pagoda made us feel like we were Island locals. The front desk was so helpful and keeping us informed about parking - since it was President's Day, the meters weren't enforced saving us parking fees for the day! It's close to the Ala Moana mall, Walmart, Don Quijote & Ross.When we got to our room on the 8th Fl, you could tell it was an older building but it was a good size room for the two of us & it was clean and comfortable. Cute little pool & the free DVD rental in the lobby was a nice plus!

My husband had to spend another night in the hospital so I had to find another hotel to spend the night. I made reservations at 5 pm and the clerk was very helpful and gave me a decent "kama'aina" (local) rate. The hotel is an older structure with multiple layers of paint but well maintained and clean. Decor was Asian. The bed was comfortable and the towels absorbent, if a tad harsh. There was an extra sink in the bedroom, a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, safe and iron/board. It probably would be acceptable for an extended stay. My only complaint was that, although there was a larger window beside the window AC, I couldn't get the curtains to open, so the only light came in the small jalousied window above the AC unit. Staff was efficient but not overly friendly. The hotel is in a neighborhood with a Ross for Less and Walmart (which I needed to buy underwear, gown and extra T-shirt since I had not planned on spending 2 nights in Honolulu). There are also numerous small eateries in the area. Since I was alone on the street, I was extra vigilant but the area is probably OK. The lobby is an open area and you have to use your key to make the elevator work

We have been staying at the Pagoda Hotel since 1977. Over the years we have seen many changes at the Pagoda. Some things have always stayed the same, but this year there were lots of upgrades to the rooms and buildings! As always the front desk staff was helpful and courteous (same staff as last year!) The housekeeping staff always speaks to you in the hallways and elevators which makes for a pleasant stay. The location of the Pagoda is the best so convenient to Ala Moana. We will continue to stay at the Pagoda as the location, staff and value are remarkable!

I called front desk thursday morning and asked if there were rooms available for the 17-20th and was told yes and was given what my total would be. So after work on thursday i went to the front desk (1255am) and spoke to a guy at the front desk with the name tag "Bill" and tried to pay for a three night stay (17-20th) and he said there no rooms available for those dates except one that was their most expensive one wich cost around $230 per night. So i left upset and thought maybe its because the way i looked (a bit dirty from working) or he was being racist or he just judged me as being someone who looks like a bad person. Anyways i got up at 8am and called the fron desk again asking for the same dates and the person on the phone said yes there were rooms available, so i gave my info and went back down to the pagoda and met a "carlos" at the front desk and paid for the room. Never going back again.

Very helpful front desk staff, especially Alice. Loved the Dining Room especially the Koi fish feeding time, the food was good and all the dining staff most helpful, with a special thanks to Reyna, the Manager of the Dining Room. Our room was very clean, well-maintained with a superbly comfortable bed. Would have liked bigger mugs for our morning coffee and a few more coffee/sugar/creamer sachets. If I visit Honolulu again this hotel would be my first choice. I was a bit disappointed that after arranging for a shuttle from the Airport (being confirmed too) there was no booking made.

Our stay in this hotel was awesome. My wife and I checked in later in the afternoon with our 2 kids but were greeted by a friendly front desk, Alice. She made the check in process easy. She was so helpful in giving us the direction where to park our car. Our kids didn't had to wait too long while we were doing all these process because Alice was so efficient. When we got to our room, we found a very comfortable and very clean bedroom. When we checked out after 2 days, my daughter was holding a paper shopping bag with her gifts but it accidentally broke when we just stepped out of our room but the housekeeper who was cleaning the room next door at that moment saw what happened and gave my daughter a plastic shopping bag to replace it with. The staff in this hotel are all friendly. Their customer service is excellent . We would definitely come back again and refer this hotel to our friends.

The rooms are well maintained. The cleaning staff are extremely helpful. We enjoyed our stay and the hotel is very convenient to stores and a free trolley that will make your stay there even more enjoyable.

The hotel is good for short stay but you have to pay one extra night even if its early check in and they never ever accept early check in requests unless you pay for one whole extra day.When you travel for almost 11 hours, you need to rest and if you check in even 2 hours early they wont accomodate early check in.

I stayed here because it was conveniently located and less expensive then places I would have liked to stay. Locals from the other islands stay here as well as older people who stayed there before. It seemed vaguely clean, but there were roaches in the room so I left the light on all night - they hide if you do that. Otherwise carry a spray bottle of Simple Green which kills any bug by degreasing it and aim in the dark where you hear noise. The bathroom needed bleach but the sheets seemed clean and beds were comfortable but it is a very local and not too expensive place to stay if you are there working or on a layover. I do, however like the atmosphere of the restaurant because it reminds me of my childhood and it is a more retro version of what the Willows Restaurant used to feel like but does not now. I would stay there again if I didn't stay with friends and was feeling pinched for cash. The hotel desk people were extremely nice and helpful and even if you don't see the roaches in the fancy hotels, they are there. They wait on the roads at night over all of Oahu.

My son, girlfriend, and I stayed here for two nights. The online booking was simple and easy, as was the check in process. The hotel is older however, everything was clean and well maintained. All of the staff was very pleasant. The hotel was only a few blocks from several restaurants and the mall.I would stay here again!

This is a great hotel but not close to the hustle-bustle of Waikiki which is why I like it so much. This is my home-away-from-home in Honolulu. The hotel is clean and safe and secure for single women. There are food places nearby and the mall is 2 blocks away. Shoppers will appreciate Walmart for last-minute souvenirs, drinks and snacks. The staff is friendly and helpful. I don't stay anywhere else in Honolulu - the Pagoda makes me feel like I'm a "local."

I continue to be amazed with the service I received when registering at the front desk. I was met with a wonderful holiday smile and greetings from both Debbie Arakaki and Alice Pastoral as Debbie searched her computer for my unexpected early arrival. Both she and Alice always make me feel like I am back home again and they are going out of their way to exceed my service expectations. First impressions will make or break your stay and they have not yet failed me. I don't expect they ever will. I will be back again.

Pros: excellent location--walking distance to Don Quijote store, Walmart, Walgreen's, Ala Moana Shopping Center; room was clean, had a nice view, cleaning staff very prompt, laundry room on the first floor, fee includes free newspaper, has safe inside the room, felt secure because of their card-key elevator, cleaning staff very friendly, hotel guests are very friendly, lots of local people. Cons: didn't like filling out a checklist when I checked in, warning me of all the charges. Since I had already agreed to pay for the total charges for the room, I didn't see a reason that I had to initial for the daily charges. That didn't make sense to me.Word of advice: check the hotel's website instead of relying solely on priceline or booking.com. You may get a better deal.

This is the only hotel in the US where I can email the hotel manager (Mr. Paul Dun) directly to book a room for me and he does so graciously, even my last minute requests. The hotel staff are also very gracious and the whole atmosphere of the hotel is so familiar and welcoming that I feel like I'm home whenever I stay there. Pagoda Hotel is pretty much the only hotel I stay in whenever I come to Hawaii for work or for pleasure.The hotel is also very near to great shopping places so I don't need a car to shop for whatever I need.

I just want to commend the service of Ms. Alice Pastoral. She was so nice and helpful to me. My relative came to visit me here in Hawaii. I didn't know they had reservation at pagoda hotel. They didn't know anybody here except me but they feel comfortable because of her generous service to them. I was so thankful she's there to assist them.

I visit and stay at this hotel at least four times a year. It's a great place to stay for local travelers as we visit our doctors and then go shopping. We can walk to shop and dine all at the Ala Moana Shopping Center or at the many shops and restaurants surrounding this hotel. One can even catch The Bus at the Center and go around the island. There's also a free small bus to Waikiki at the hotel if you prefer to visit there. Ask for ALICE at the front desk to check in.

We went to Honolulu to visit family and stayed at the Pagoda Hotel for 2 nights. It was very comfortable, clean, and friendly, just as we remember from years past. The rooms have been recently refurbished but are not overdone, so we did not have to feel like were in Waikiki. Location was perfect for us . . . close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, Likilike Drive-In, and right next door to the Pagoda Floating Restaurant where we ate every night because of their great food.

Headed off island again for the Garth Brook concert and decided to stay again at the Pagoda. Still as inviting as the last time. Room was very clean and staff was very helpful. This hotel will always be my go to first choice when heading to Oahu. Want to say thank you to the Pagoda's hotel manager Paul Dun for being so helpful each time our family has visited the Pagoda. Much Mahalo!!

The Pagoda is our hotel of choice when on O'ahu. It's super convenient location along with great staff makes staying there a pleasure. Checking in is quick and simple. The staff is always very helpful and makes our stay hassle free. We also enjoy the spaciousness of the rooms. Excellent for a family!!! Simply put, The Pagoda is great. Superb location. Walking distance from several shopping and dining areas. Major shopping mall also in walking distance.

I stay here for more than 1 month by myself and I feel comfortable staying in this Hotel . I like the place because it's very convenient for all shopping center. I feel like im a part of Pagoda family. .all the staff's are very friendly and especially Alice, she's very nice and very helpful. I'm gonna come back here and bring my family ♡♡♡

Older hotel but very well maintained,the staff make you feel at home,clean rooms (better than most I have stayed. Quiet area out of busy Waikiki but close by ..safe area at night. This hotel is where us local people stay when we travel from the outer islands.aloha

Do not look at the stars classification: a NICE hotel in the shopping area of Honolulu !!! we had 3 great overnights stays as part of a group: friendly & helpful staff, great-spacious-clean rooms with all the amenities ( and possible more) You would find in Waikiki but in a much peaceful atmosphere.We used to book in Waikiki area but now we have been converted to The Pagoda Hotel: we will be back.

the place hasn't changed, the neighborhood looks different. I guess there weren't so many high rise building around that area in 1977!.The hotel itself is pretty much the same which can be bad or good depending on what you're looking for. A friend booked as we were going to a concert at the blaisdell Arena. The Pagoda is a long standing "locals" hotel for out island visitor needing to stay in Honolulu at a place with reasonable prices, I think our resident rate was around 130.00 The rooms are basic, with basic amenities, ours with a brand new air cond, which was quite loud but cold. This is not a hotel want to book if your looking for your 'dream vacation" at Waikiki beach. It is clean, front desk service is on 'island time' but friendly if you are friendly'. Yes it's dated, I've stayed in worse for twice the money. I liked it because it was a throw back to the days I first came to Hawaii in the late 60. early 70's...it's a little oasis of 70's Hawaii amidst all the new stuff, very close walk to ala moana center, close to the concert venue, we walked back from the show. The neighbor hood is mostly japenese and Korean restaruants and most of the guests were locals from other islands, everbody was friendly.If you want some of the old local style food, go to the restaurant, diiner buffet 20 bucks, poke, noodles, salads, namasu, fish, chicken, pork done in differents tastes and good quality. is it hipster modern, no. just good local style food. they served me a 'green river' soft drink. when was the last time you had of those. the happy hour menu looked good also, oysters, poke, shrimp, etc......reduced rates. I had breakfast there and skipped the bufted and ordered the SF omelette, with crab , scallops, cheese it was really good in a simple kind of way..........it's a deal for us who live in the islands and feels like 'home'.......

The Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu is located very near a bus line from the Honolulu airport and to other parts of the island of O'ahu and near all kinds of shopping from high-end to Walmart, Ross (next door) and Don Quijote. I especially appreciate the friendly and kind staff, including Bill at the desk who facilitated our checking in for flight home to another island and printing our boarding passes. The hotel is basic, but the prices are reasonable. If you live in Hawai'i, be sure to ask for Kama'aina rate.

I work at Panda Travel and I book my customer for SEP 27 for 3 nights. During their stay I called them just to check if room is okay. They said they are happy at the hotel. When they check out Ms Santos left her eye glasses she called the hotel and talked to Alice Pastoral on the front desk and they were able to find and return it to her.

We really enjoyed our stay we stayed on the 9th floor and our house keeper there her name was feliza I think she was amazing always kept our room clean and stocked thank u so much and Carlos front desk thanks all the staff there was very nice and courteous always smiling and making u feel welcomed. We stayed from Sept 30-Oct 12 our baby had surgery and we are from the big island. Mahalo again look forward Ti staying with u all again

I spent three nights in October 2016 at the Pagoda Hotel on an unexpected trip to Honolulu when my sister ended up in nearby Straub Medical Center hospital. This hotel was the nearest (1.1 mile) of the suggested places to stay provided by the hospital. 25 minute walk or ride back and forth on the #1 or #2 buses for the $1 senior fare. About a 15-20 minute walk to Waikiki Beach I took one morning.Very friendly and helpful staff. Courtesy shuttle every hour to Waikiki Beach and Diamond head locations. Complimentary newspapers each morning in lobby.Very nice 1970-80's era room nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. Older tub style shower with curtains, but great shower head high enough for a six footer to not have to bend over. The mattresses were very comfortable. The individual room air conditioner was quite quiet and effective.The Pagoda Restaurant had a great full breakfast buffet including coffee and tax for $10.48 each morning . . . nice large wood and glass restaurant perched over koi ponds and beautiful landscaping.Just a nice friendly comfortable place to stay in Honolulu.

I am a former kamaina(resident) so I wanted to go to a place where locals go so I could feel at home. I was not disappointed. It was like traveling back in time. Lots of local people at the hotel and pidgin(local dialect) being spoken. There was several things that I wanted and again, I was not disappointed. The location is wonderful. Lots of restuarants around with a huge shopping center(Ala Moana Center) and a beautiful beach(Ala Moana) within walking distance. there is a Sam's Club and a Walmart across the street which made it easy to buy treats to bring home with me(42.5 lbs worth). The staff was very friendly which I had read in the reviews on Tripadvisor and saw first hand. The rooms is a little dated but it was clean and comfortable. I will be staying at this hotel when I come back again in the future.

Stayed two days at the Pagoda this trip through Honolulu. It is much better than it is rated. It is a friendly place. Very convenient to Ala Moana. The restaurant is good. I usually do the breakfast buffet. Happy hour is a good deal also. Many small but tasty restaurants near by. Also a few spas and massage parlors. Thai Issan Massage gives an outstanding massage. Andy's Kahuku Shrimp has very good kimchee and garlic shrimp. Good place to stay and walk around checking out small dining establishments. Mainly local crowd.

I was booked here because there were no other rooms in town, and it was still more than the corporate allotment. Big convention week. a 12 story 1950s hotel elevators are slow and require a room card entry to select a floor. Only 2 cars for a large number of guests. the room was clean and neat but very dated, 2 burner elect stove and sink combo surrounded by aluminum and a small refrigerator. everything worked and housekeeping was in everyday. Parking was in public garage across the street for 10 dollars a day with hotel pass. 1 block to walmart for food snacks 3 blocks to Ala Moana Mall. Overall I must say I enjoyed the convience and the staff was vey friendly and pleasant.

Stayed here before embarking on a cruiseNot a T bag in the house !I had to purchase one from the shop cost - 48c hmmm haven't they heard that us Aussies like tea ?Then when I got back to my room to make it after paying almost $5 for a litre of milk... No T spoons grrrr I had to stir with my toothbrush !!!! Noisy room was woken at 5am by construction outside.

Our home needs to be termite fumigated. We have little dogs and I was hoping to find a pet friendly hotel so we would not have to board them. Sally was so personable and helpful that I felt compelled to write this review. She was so patient and explained the process along with the cost so there would be no surprises. Sally was extremely informative. What a relief it was to learn that I would not be charged if I had to cancel my reservation due to bad weather. This is only if you are booking a room due to fumigation. Thanks to Sally I was able to book the room. What a relief to have this checked off on my fumigation "honey do list". I will keep you posted and write a review on our stay. Just needed to send a big MAHALO out to Sally in reservations. She was AWESOME!!!

Found the check in staff just doing the basic without any warmth but efficient. Location is good and room spacious although we found the wall electrical sockets come off the wall when we tried to plug in our appliances (See photo). Very noisy airconditioning and if you are a light sleeper, forget it.Overall, we found the room functional but nothing outstanding.

I have been coming to pagoda ever since I was a child until now, and it has been a place for me and my Ohana for decades. The Property is well maintained regardless of how old it is and even better with the staff from housekeeping to front desk and everybody else, Kelly from from desk always make our stay memorable and enjoyable with his exceptional service and unforgettable smile. Mahalo

If you are expecting a five star Grand Hyatt or St Regis hotel, this is not the hotel for you. But if you are looking for accomidations close to a major shopping center, a variety of restaurants, outside of but close to Waikiki (which they have a free Waikiki shuttle available for you), check this hotel out. It's affordable and comfortable, not new but nice, and the super staff makes up for all that five star comfort. I have stayed at this hotel several times now and their employees positive can do attitude has been outstanding. In particular the front desk which gives you, your first and a lasting impression of your stay. My Five Star registration desk vote for outstanding service and a award winning can do attitude with a smile would go to Alice and Debbie who has consistantly exceeded my expectations.With employees like Alice and Debbie, who cares if the bar of soap in your bathroom is too small or the air-condition to loud . . .

This hotel was very comfortable, and conveniently located in downtown Honolulu. The staff at the hotel and restaurant were amazing and helpful! Always a smile! Who needs the Marriott or Hilton when you have 5 Star service at the Pagoda? After being out on a 7 month deployment it was nice to just get away! I recommend this hotel to anybody visiting the area who doesn't want to stay at the over priced Waikiki Hotels. Wal Mart, ROSS, and various other stores are within walking distance.

Haven't even checked in yet... which is in about a week ....However, my first impressions is Great because of Pat ... the wonderful friendly Resv agent ... so very helpful. Ask for her ... she will tell give you the local scoop. This is why I started with 4 stars.. without seeing the property as yet. First Impressions are very important to me. Thank You ... Pat.

I recently stayed at Pagoda Hotel while on a business trip to Oahu. The room itself was simple, yet still had amenities. There was a small refrigerator and a two burner mini stove in the Ron. There is free Wi-Fi access as well. I was given a card to use if I wanted to rent DVDs from the small kiosk downstairs in the lobby, which I did not take advantage of. Parking is across the street in a shared garage with Ross. Hotel patrons must park on the fourth floor or above. Ala Moana Center is a couple blocks away and easy enough to walk to. There are plenty of food options close by, including Likelike Bakery, L&L (inside Wal-Mart), or at Ala Moana.

Have stayed in the hotel before about 6 years ago. It was terrible. This time, I was surprised how different it was. Their pool area was very nice, the staff was extremely friendly and their little store was very nice. The room had a pretty strong smell of spoiled food, as did the fridge (same problem as last time). The air conditioner was newer and there was a rubber strip covering the bottom of the door (other rooms had an inch or more gap). The bathroom looked like it had been remodeled recently and there wasn't any mold (common problem in HI). For the price my company paid, I would have been disappointed. But considering the location (block away from Ala Moana shopping center), not a bad deal.

The hotel was definitely vintage. The staff were great though and the room clean. We where close to the beach, a huge mall and a 24 hour Walmart. There was plenty of parking and the price fit our budget wonderfully. I would staff here again.

The Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu is walking distance from the Ala Moana mall and it is also surrounded by a lot of restaurants nearby. It is a great location! The hotel uses a multi-level parking structure across the hotel (connected to Ross) and there is ample parking. We stayed during the Christmas break and the room price was at peak season. The hotel is old and adequately maintained. The guest room uses window A/C unit (which needed cleaning badly - moldy), the tub was painted over! The bathroom and fixtures need renovation. The staff is friendly. Our room included a breakfast buffet next door. There was a misunderstanding on Christmas day as to the hours of operation for the breakfast buffet (hotel and restaurant provided different opening hours); as a result of the confusion, we missed a breakfast. We would return to this hotel because of the great location but probably during the low season when the room rate is more reasonable.

Friendly front desk personnel, cold AC and that's it! As soon as I exited the elevator on the 7th floor, there was an odor that was similar to a skilled nursing facility. My room number was 763 and it was dated. There was a stain on the popcorn ceiling right above one of the beds. The stain was yellow. The shower curtain had mildew on it and a hair band was hanging on one of the curtain hooks. There was a stain on the accent pillow. At 5:30 am the next morning the garbage truck was heard loud and clear emptying the garbage can(s). Free WiFi did not work.

no matter what i planned to do or where to go this place saved me time and frustration with traffic just far enough off the main roads . staff treats you like family also the floating restaurant is great but also lots of good places to eat close by .I have stayed at 8 other hotels in Honolulu and this one was the best

Only needed 1 night in Honolulu because I was traveling to another country and wasn't interested in staying at the airport properties. Pagoda is located just a few blocks from the Magic Island, Ala Moana Mall, WalMart, Sam's and Walgreens. In just the few short hours I was there, I went to everyone of these. Pagoda staff were very friendly and provided directions and local map to help navigate the area. Room was very clean. Just wish the window AC was not located that it blew right over the heads of the beds. I will recommend this to others and will be staying here again.

My grandson joined me for a week's stay during July 4th & thoroughly enjoyed it. Arrived early morning and Bill cheerfully kept our bags while passing time for a room, he was kind enough to give my grandson a bag of fish pellets to feed the koi @ their floating restaurant which sits above a large pool surrounded by a Japanese garden...very relaxing! We were lucky to finally get a room around 11:00. The room suited our needs and had a couple of twin beds, tv, micro, fridge, coffee/tea pot, safe......the aircon worked and room very clean. Cleaning staff cheerfully provided extra towels, soap, etc..and did a good job keeping our room clean. They were kind enough to turn in some medication I had forgotten in the fridge when I checked out. We enjoyed breakfast and esp. the buffets in the evenings, good tasting variety! You can't beat the location for shopping and nearby eateries. Front desk staff (Alice,Stephanie, Jasmyn) are cheerful and helpful. Taxi's are usually parked just outside the lobby. Great shop on premises for snacks & drinks. Great ambiance, an oasis in a concrete jungle. Comfy beds...great sleep.

review_body: We frequent this hotel for events and occasional stays in that area. Although it is dated the staff are full of Aloha and the food is exquisite! I have been to many seminars and educational sessions on property and the staff are always very helpful, the property is very well-equipped and the food is very memorable! This hotel also helps American Red Cross clients who are displaced from their homes and the staff go out of their way to make sure these people who are in shock feel comfortable.

We recently stayed at the Pagoda last week. We used to stay here when I was a young child. I'm now older with my own family. When entering the property I felt so safe. There was so much aloha from the staff. The guess there was smiling having a good time. The surrounding area on both sides felt safe too. Our rooms was great! The bed was very comfy and overall the room was clean. I will most definitely stay here in the future. I stayed at other hotels in near by areas and felt very unsafe but not at the Pagoda. The food at here was great too!

The personnel at the hotel reception were quite friendly and very helpful. Check in and check out was done effortlessly. Worthy of mention is one of the staff at the reception (Carlos Acob). He was always ready to answer all questions and provided useful tips on how to get round town and visit places of interest at affordable rates. Also in-room wifi is super and free!

Stayed one night in Jan before continuing our trip to Kona. Very friendly front desk staff. Room were clean and big but walls are a bit thin. We can hear everything. The best part about this hotel is the location. I am glad to have finally picked this hotel. Restaurants, outlet, mall, supermarket, fast food are very nearby the hotel. Would recommend to friends.

The lobby are has been updated. Looks much brighter and more modern now. Use of the elevator is restricted to guests with a key. The rooms have also been updated and are cleaner & the bed is much more comfortable. There us also very good high speed wi-fi that was included in the price. There are great restaurants nearby, wal-green's, Wal-mart, Sam's Club & Ala Moana Shopping Center are all very close.

Six of us were there for eight weeks, They staff very accommodating , this was my first time to Hawaii and I didn't know the my way around and the lady at the front desk copied a map and where they're shuttle went and a bus schedule , the rooms were clean every day, central great location, close to every thing shopping, and the beach is in walking distance. The coy pond around the restarant is

We stayed at this place in June 2016, Never again will we put our foot inside this hotel. We had the nasty experience of bed bugs. Our room was infested and management do not want to know about the issue, other than say how sorry they are. Security where called to the room to inspect and take photo's of these nasty critters in the bed and the bites (see photo). Security acknowledged that they were aware of the infestations, and admitted to receiving other complaints from hotel guests. In addition to this, there are many homeless people within the vicinity of the hotel, with their worldly possessions in a shopping trolley, and looking for the nearest places to sleep in late evening. This is rather depressing for a tourist to see this inequality amongst the American people. Pagoda also advertises the risks of car break-ins in its car park. The appearance of the guests that stay at this place are questionable. Many look like they could have done with a good wash, and plenty had a feral appearance. Overall recommendation, don't stay there.

We almost always stay at the pagoda hotel for its affordable price, convenient location for restaurants, shopping-Walmart, Ross, don Quixote, and ala moana shopping center- and the central locale of honolulu. And they just renovated the entire hotel and it looks great.

Loved our stay. Very nice on the budget, close to all sorts of shopping, Ala Moana mall, Ross', Walmart, Starbucks/Jamba Juice, Don Quijote, Asian market, a large variety of restaurants all around, etc. Loved the kitchenette, included 2 good sized fridges (so you don't have to try to cram everything into one fridge), microwave, toaster, coffee maker, plates, bowls, utensils, etc. Staff was very friendly and attentive to our requests. Room also included a PS3 which you could rent movies and games in the lobby free (it's part of your convenience fee), and they had a good selection of movies. Also good really nice pictures of the family at the waterfall and looking at the beautiful koi fish and other fish they had. Would definitely recommend staying here.

This hotel is a favorite. Budget friendly and close to all shopping amenities and bus route (Alamoana Shopping Center). Staff are very friendly and accommodating. Small convenience store on site is great for snacks and other stuff, if you don't want to stroll out and about. Room was nice, microwave came in handy. Ross across the road with Walmart about a 1/2 block away. Lots of eateries to suit everyone's taste. Breakfast at the floating restaurant is good value. Definitely a recommendation for friends and family.

Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The Pagoda Hotel is a nice budget Hotel. The staff was very helpful with accommodating of our needs (disabled). The ADA room that we had was very comfortable and the big shower chair was an unexpected plus. The hotel is conveniently located to walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, Walmart, and Sam's Club. We enjoyed meals at their restaurant. The only negative was the small on site parking. Although they share a parking structure across the street with Ross's.

Room was fairly small but it was comfortable. Refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker were available in the room. Ideal spot to walk to the shopping mall as well as other stores nearby. Places to eat was in walking distance. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.

Good size room, clean and everything works. Easy access to Ross and Walmart. Not far from the Ala Moana Mall. Security in the lifts and in our room. The staff were friendly and polite and no problems leaving luggages to be picked up later. The internet was available with excellent speed. We love the breakfast at the restaurant. We will recommend this hotel to our family and friends

I always stay at this hotel when laying over due to its location and the price. Truly within my budget during my vacation with the kids in the summer, the staff are friendly and accommodate our every need but not to forget the housekeepers who are very friendly and helpful in every way. I also chose this hotel because of the parking cost, all other hotels in Hawaii charges more than $20 per parking, Pagoda only charges $10 and that price hasn't increased for years since I've stayed at this hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, especially when you're surrounded with shops (walmart, jamba juice, mcdonalds, etc), restaurants, and many more.

Not a usual 5 star hotel, but serves the purpose, 4 of our friends stayed in a 2 bedroom room, linen is clean and bathroom, the thing I liked about the hotel the room didn't have any smell, and I cooked, next to Walmart, stores and if you are young and can walk, 10 to 15 min walk to Waikiki

Nice staff, very friendly people, tacky hotel.My room smelled bad. Dark hall ways, dirty carpets. Not worth the money I paid for a room. I would not stay there again. That's all I can really say about it.

We had 8 adults in our group flying to Honolulu to go on a cruise, and we stayed at the Pagoda Hotel the night before the cruise. We were able to book just 2 rooms for the 8 adults. The hotel was very reasonable compared to many others we checked, and the rooms worked well for 4 adults in each room. I think the beds were doubles instead of queens, but that was fine with us. The hotel and rooms were not fancy or new, but we didn't expect that for budget prices. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and comfortable.There are some restaurants very close by, and there is also a Walmart within walking distance if someone needs toiletries or breakfast foods, etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially when we were asking for directions and recommendations for a place to eat dinner. And the hotel was very helpful when my husband forgot his laptop and left it in our room when we checked out. We were in a panic the next day when we realized we left the laptop. We called Pagoda, and they located the laptop -- very honest staff! The Pagoda locked up the laptop in the manager's office and kept it there until we could come back to get it a week later on our way back to the airport from the cruise. We were obviously please with their honesty and assistance!I would definitely recommend this hotel!

If you're from the neighbor islands, you've probably stayed at the Pagoda and know what you're getting. A comfortable, no frills, old but well kept place to stay in a great location. Some things can be irritating, like light bulbs with no cover and an oddly designed entryway that requires you to step into the bathroom when opening the main door. But the bed is comfortable, there is a mini kitchenette in the room, and the room was clean. We had parking across the street in the same parking structure as Ross'. There is Don Quixote on the next block (like an Asian Wal-Mart), Ross' and Like Like Drive in less than a block, and a short 10 min. walk to Ala Moana Center. Purple ube pancakes at Yogurstory across the street too. It was all good.

Last minute trip to HNL due to family emergency. Always wanted to stay at the Pagoda ever since I was a youngster growing up in Central Oahu. We would come into town to eat at the Floating Restaurant and admire the koi. Hotel experience was beyond what I had expected. Location -location-location! Nice, central, close to Ala Moana and beaches, main thoroughfares. Walmart, Don Quixote, Ross - fun shopping! Many yummy eateries close by. Courteous and genuinely aloha staff. Appreciated the low-cost parking, compared to other places. Facilities somewhat tired, but clean; bathrooms need updating badly. But the overall laid-back ambience, great location and fine staff made for a great experience overall.

The room was clean and nice. Close to shops and bus stops right outside. Wallmart is just up the road. Staff was friendly and helpful. Had pool and restaurant that looks over a japense like garden. The price was reasonable and the food good. Felt very safe walking around the streets.

Once again, we had an excellent experience at the Pagoda, from check in to check out!Everyone we encountered was friendly, kind and helpful. Our room was on the top floor at the end of the hall, which was especially quiet. There was a new air conditioner, which was great. A little finch serenaded us on the tiny ledge outside our window, which was special.

The hotel is located in the heart of the city. It is close to most shops and food courts. Accommodation is good as the place is clean, spacious and well ventilated. The hotel staff are very helpful,polite, and hardworking. The gardens are well kept. The koi pond is a joy!

We just returned from a short stay on Oahu and were booked into a room at the Pagoda, a place my family used to stay in when we visited years ago.My husband and I were pleased with the sizeable room with the big bed, good sized TV, and a small kitchenette complete with a 2 burner stove, a small sink, a small refrigerator, a small freezer, and even a counter to prep on. There was also a PS3 game system on which one can either play games or watch DVDs rented from the machine in the lobby. For a convenience fee of about $10, these entertainments are unlimited.The staff was friendly and very helpful and the hotel located right in the middle of everything, across the street from Walmart, around the corner from a good local restaurant, and very close to Ala Moana Center.

The Pagoda hotel has a nice location that is walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center. It's a no frills average hotel. The hotel is clean but needs major updating. Lots of people stay here who are visiting Queens Medical Center.

The staff were accommodating and very helpful especially for first timers like us. Mr. Carlos Acob, our fellow Filipino, gave us assistance from day 1 of our stay up until the last day. Pagoda hotel's location is actually strategic since it's just a few steps away from Walmart, Ross and other establishments, not to mention the bus stops. We stayed at a room that is spacious enough for 4 persons. It includes a kitchenette with microwave and minifridge and a decent bathroom. All in all I enjoyed my stay here.

I live on the Big Island but usually every year go to Oahu. Many of these visits I have stayed at the Pagoda, often by myself. The staff has been adequate to friendly, never rude. The rooms are plush but clean enough and I had no problem sleeping. The restaurant in the hotel was terrific, and even though it was a buffet the chef made my husband a special.dish as he has severe dietary restrictions. But most of all, you can't beat the locale. Short walk to Ala Moana, a two story Ross and even a 24 hour diner. What more can you ask.for? In all.my visits I have never felt unsafe. My husband had surgery at Kaiser. I stayed at the Pagoda and it was a short walk to the Kaiser clinic, where I could catch a ride to the hospital.. This spring he needs another surgery and I will be making reservations to stay again.

First, we came in the hotel a little bit early for our check-in time but we were still allowed to bring our baggages down so we could explore more of the country. Staffs are so kind, very accomodating and never intimidating. I'd like to specially mention Mr. Carlos Acob, he helped us a lot. I am literally beyond thankful to have him as one of the staffs. He called our room and woke us up early in the morning just as we asked because we are all lazy sleepers and we need to wake up early to do more during the day, typical tourist thing. He advised us about perfect time of travel when going to somewhere, he instructed us about the directions he basically approached us in a holistic manner. Also, the hotel's location is geographically strategic. Its basically near a church, a beach, a mall and so many more. Thank you Pagoda hotel for having such nice and kind-hearted staffs. Mahalo!! :)

This is NOT your Westin, but this is a decent hotel for families on a budget, or anyone who needs to crash over night. The staff we encountered was very helpful and thoughtful. The room was clean, generous in size and included a kitchenette. While it is a little rundown, it is hard to beat this location if you want to avoid tourist prices. It is ideally located with bargain shopping and restaurants that won't burn a hole in your pocket all relatively close by. It was an improvement to the hotel we stayed in the previous night whose system shutdown and could not give us our hotel key to get into our room.

Friendly staff: I have had a wonderful experience at the Pagoda Hotel. The staff is what made this place worthwhile. The staff at the front desk is very friendly and helpful. Carlos Acob is one of the people at the front desk and he was so helpful and made me feel very comfortable. They made me feel like they really appreciated my stay at their hotel. Clean Room: The room is your basic average room. The view is not too great and it is not very updated however, the bed is very comfortable and the sheets are clean. The room is clean and all your basic needs are met. Location: Great location, it is right next to a huge mall (Ala Moana Mall) at walking distance, there is a ROSS right across the street, and restaurants all around. The location is very convenient however, the appearance of the streets may not seem too nice. I definitely enjoyed my stay at this hotel and I am still currently at the hotel. I am enjoying my stay and love the Free Wifi and great channels on the TV.

I enjoyed my week long stay at the Pagoda Hotel. I was satisfied with the price, free movie rentals from the lobby, location of laundry room, especially it was convenient to all my favorite shopping and eating places and ATMs: ROSS, WALMART, BANK OF HAWAII, ALAMOANA and the infamous Alamoana food court.

Front desk staff not very cheerful/receptive Housekeeping was very good. Location is close to Ala Moana Shopping Center and between hotel and the Center there are different types of restaurants. The hotel itself has an excellent restaurant.

Ms. Corazon Cabingabang is very accommodating and very helpful each time we check in. She always check on us if we need anything in our room. She make sure that our room is ready whenever we arrive. Also the front desk staffs are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend and we're keep coming back.

A great Hotel ...our room was clean well looked after while we were there , nothing was too much trouble The hotel had shuttle service taking guests to the shops and city However our hotel was within walking distance of a large shopping center and also smaller shops and eatery'sOnly a short walk to public transport as wellThe only hiccup we had was with one staff member on the front desk , she did not know the email address of the hotel we had finally ask to see the manager .....I would stay there again and again ......Their breakfast and dinning room was something "out of the box" a magnificent restaurant surrounded by the most fantastic fish pond ( floating restaurant ) . the fish were big and health and the caretakers feed them every morning It also has a pool and well equipped gymA must if you are staying in Honolulu........

It's a very good location. Perfect if you're not going to spend much time in the room. We just used the room to shower and sleep. The beds were comfortable, room was clean. It was also nice that they have guest laundry open 24 hours a day. Friendly staff.

We flew in from the neighbor island and need a place to hang out, take a shower a sleep for a few hours until our flight that evening. We stayed in the room for less than 5 hours. Great place to hang!

Hotel is within walking distance to Walmart, Sam's Club, Ross, Starbucks, and Jamba Juice just to name a few. Love that the Hotel offered a free shuttle to get to the shopping center and Waikiki. Driver was very friendly. In the room I had an issue with my PlayStation and hotel staff fixed it ASAP.

I researched quite a few hotels. The Pagoda fell in my budget and they had good reviews. You never know till you get there though. I manage a hotel and I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the room. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. A great place to lay your head at night.

I had a short trip to Honolulu. Booked a room at the Pagoda Hotel, Honolulu, Ohau. The hotel is convienently placed in Honolulu about 15 minutes walk to the ever so beautiful Waikiki strip. The hotel had shuttle transport arrangement from the premises to Waikiki but I prefered to walk. Luckily it did not rain while I was visiting. About the hotel: Like i said nicely placed with walmart and eating joints stone throw distance away. Waikiki only a couple of minutes walk away. The hotel has a small sized open swimming pool , a convenience store for your everyday needs, a well run restaurant(was full every time i passed it). The staff at reception was polite but no porter service. I was put up at 12th floor-not a great view from my room, possibly better view from other side facing rooms. General clealiness of the room was good but the carpet did not smell nice.Though the room size was acceptable.Lots of places to eat at Waikiki to suite all palates. I too did not have problem finding veg food, easily accesed. Plenty of souvenir shops...... dont forget to pick up hawaiian grass skirt girls figurine and hawaiian shirts. Aloha to all.

We only needed a day room in HNL after a cruise and before flying home that night. We couldn't get a day room anywhere so in the end settled on this hotel as the rate wasn't too ugly and the location was great - Ross' Dress for Less, Walmart/Walgreens and Ala Moana really close by. Pool was tiny; rooms were a decent size but not soundproof. No double glazing and big gap under the entry door so noise was an issue - not so bad for us as we weren't overnighting but it would have been a nightmare if we were. Room was dated but perfectly comfortable. Could definitely do with a facelift - which I believe their restaurant is getting now so hopefully that is the start of things changing. We had told the hotel we only needed a dayroom and when we would be arriving; their reservations department said they would try to have a room available for us. When we arrived at 1000 the room wasn't ready but they did hold our bags for us. Went back at 1300 and the room still wasn't ready, however the lovely receptionist switched things around for us so we got into the room then. Free internet was good, as well as a transfer to /from Waikiki Beach but we didn't use this. Lots of restaurants nearby so really good options for eating out.

Perfect location with a parking spot for a very reasonable price. All facilities in working order, practical kitchenette with two little fridges. As my flights from Australia arrived early in the day and left late the helpful people at the front desk were able to store our luggage as a complimentary convenience. Walking distance from Honolulu Mall and all the major retail outlets.

My stay here was lengthy due to flooding issues at my home. I found the room to be dated and not cleaned properly on a daily basis (hair in bathroom and sheets, carpet needed cleaning in the room and hallways). The daily add on fee for extras which included in room wireless internet, daily dvd, daily newspaper (available to all in the lobby) and 2 breakfast buffets was not worth the extra $23.00 a day. The Playstation 3 did not work properly to play dvd's. Even the hotel workers could not get it to play dvd's. The room doors slam shut loudly and makes the walls shake. I held my door to gently shut it and it still closed loudly. The breakfast buffet at the Pagoda Restaurant is okay if you like cold cereal and yogurt. The potatoes, french toast, eggs, pancakes and bacon were all cold every time we ate there. A single small burner was used on a large catering pan for each item. At the cost of $12.99 for the buffet I recommend ordering off the menu if you want a hot breakfast. The highlights of the hotel and restaurant is it's in walking distance to the mall, Walmart and Sam's Club. For the first time tourist who wants to experience Oahu, Hawaii. I recommend Waikiki for the view of world renowned Diamond Head and access to the famous Waikiki beach and to all the fun tourist sites available for booking at most hotels.

With Honolulu prices, you get what you pay for. If you're looking for somewhere to sleep without all the bells and whistles, this is the place. Designated parking in parking garage across the street for $10 was great. The beds were good but the bathroom needs serious help. You can't get around paying their "resort fee"...I guess being a hotel in Honolulu classifies you as a "resort"...even without any resort amenities.

This is maybe my second visit in about two months and both visits were extremely pleasant. The staff are very courteous and knowledgable about the hotel and surrounding area. They were quick to provide assistance from directions to the nearest eatery to explaining charges. I even had to call front desk from my room to clear my misinterpretations of the information provided to me regarding my stay and when the front desk answered, a very pleasant voice greeted me by name. It was a pleasant shock. So much so that I had to look over my shoulder that she wasn't referring to my father in her pleasantries. Imagine that! In any event, I look forward to the next function in that area requiring hotel accommodations. I can't think of any where more centralized between shopping, dining, sight seeing and functionality than the Pagoda Hotel. The floating restaurant is pretty awesome too!!

I used the Pagoda website and booked a room. I prepaid the entire amount. When I checked out, the front desk said "no balance", so I left. When I reviewed my online statement, I found a $81.88 charge. I called Pagoda. The front desk said Expedia handles their website. They gave me Customer Service, Expedia. They promptly told me to call another number (1-877). After waiting several minutes, they immediately referred me to a 1-888 number. When I spoke to the agent (after waiting again), he said the charges came directly from the hotel. So, going full circle I called the hotel. They could explained that they charged me for parking (which was correct - $40) and a convenience fee (which I already paid when I booked the room). They referred me to Expedia....The Pagoda hotel is totally clueless on the billing. NEVER BOOK THIS HOTEL THRU ANY WEBSITE. IF YOU ENCOUNTER A BILLING PROBLEM, GOOD LUCK HAVING ANYONE WITH THE BRAINS TO HELP YOU.

Although the front desk staff was very nice and they accommodated my request for an accessible room, the room itself was less than satisfactory . The air conditioning kept going off, sliding doors for bathroom was jammed, closet door hard to slide open (door kept falling off the track) and although they offered DVDs for the additional mandatory $10 fee, the instructions to use the player were so vague, so I couldn't get it to workParking was across the street from the 4th floor up, so on a rainy day it would've been miserable walking with luggage. The price wasn't that reasonable either as I have paid about the same price $167 for a bigger nicer room with a kitchenette . Sorry Pagoda, you need to have a "boss" check out each room and fix it. B

We always stay at the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu whenever we are away from home. We love the renovations in the lobby area. Our room was well prepared for our weekend stay and we are very very pleased...

Booked in advance from Australia and pictures a little better than what we foundHowever it was quiet, and very close to Ala Moana shopping complex so handy and a little out of the tourist traffic.Staff were efficient but not focused on service or ensuring your needs were met.Some great small eating places for locals as well as tourists are nearby and it is easy to get to bus services anout 5 mins walk

This hotel is dated and upon entering the room it felt like a converted Hospital. Average might be a bit much but it is not poor. A/C was mildewy and struggled to cool room. Counter employees friendly!!

I stayed here twice during day-or-two long layovers in Hawaii. It is centrally located in Waikiki and very close to many shopping areas. The room was comfortable. The negatives were a few tropical visitors my first morning (termites) and the small elevators which fill up quickly by guests and even quicker as they are also used for hotel services. I appreciated the in-house washers no dryers...2 of each.

Fogagogo, American Samoa, United States

review_body: If you're in a budget this is the perfect place. It's one the cheapest hotel but nevertheless it's still good, close to the beach and the staff is very friendly. I was traveling with a large group of girls and we didn't want to be separated into different rooms and they gladly accommodated us into a 5 person room. If I do return to Hawaii this is where I'll be staying at.

The hotel pictures online are deceiving. The rooms are dark and dingy;;did not look like room that was showN online..I refused to stay in the room; and asked if we could get our money..They offered us a free upgrade; room was semi-remodeled. .Many homeless seem to hang around the general location.

It's centrally located, within walking distance of a number of places including Ross's, Walmart and the Ala Moana Shopping Mall. On the corner is a terrific breakfast restaurant too. I find it a good place to stay with someone or by myself.

Called made reservations for same day check-in. Within "short" walking distance from many restaurants and Walmart (downtown area). Front desk staff was friendly, the hotel lobby was clean and airy. The rooms had window unit A/C, TV, clean and relaxing beds. Rode the bus to location. Walked around, felt safe and the adjacent restaurant menu and price were excellent. Hotel charged $5/30mins. for internet use @ the business center. Approximately 20 minutes from airport via shuttle service. Bus fee $2.50 (exact change) travel time is long due to stops; taxi (very expensive)

Once again we experienced nothing but kindness, courtesy and aloha from the time we checked in. The staff in all departments couldn't have been more helpful. We had a quiet room on the top floor. Before leaving, they even printed out our boarding pass for us!

Decent price, location, nice people. What can I say. Kama'aina rate helped. 10$ for parking. $10 fee for other stuff (internet and who knows what) but it was not a bad place. Secure from elevator by key card.

When we were planning our Hawaiian holiday, we had 3 criteria the hotel had to meet. It had to be clean, it had to be secure, and it had to be cheap. After all, we weren't coming all the way to Hawaii to spend our holiday in the hotel, and any money we weren't spending on accommodation, we could spend on enjoying ourselves. We read all the reviews on trip advisor and although all the reviews weren't good (are they ever?), the thing I noticed was that the manager Paul Dun replied to each and every review, be they good, bad or indifferent, and were he could, he took corrective action for any complaints. Well that was good enough for us so we booked.We found our room was clean and very spacious. What we weren't expecting after reading older reviews, was wi-fi access in our room. And it was quality wi-fi too, not lie a lot of public wi-fi which is frustratingly slow. We skyped with our family back home in Australia most nights without any issues.The staff were always friendly, be they the housekeepers, or those behind the front desk. The location was great. We were outside the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but only a short $2 trolley ride if we wanted to go there, and the Ala Moana shopping centre was only a five minute walk away down the street. What more could we ask for? All in all, we had a fantastic time. So from the bottom of our hearts, thank you. :-)

We landed late in the evening… At first I was disappointed by some cleanliness issues but didn't see anything as I figured long black hair must be very common in this part of the world. I mentioned to the front desk about a couple of issues and they were very quick to make it right.Super friendly staff. Five minute walk from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Absolutely worth your money to stay here, every single penny. Right beside wall mart and a 24 hr diner.

This old hotel is showing it's age and gratefully, in the middle of a facelift. With that knowledge - you can expect some inconvenience and less than beautiful construction.Check-in was easy and friendly.Taxifare to hotel from airport was $30….Taxi back to airport was $40. Traffic in Honolulu is a constant.I was in for just an overnight on business and my hotel room served just fine for this purpose. It was outdated but clean. The bed was comfortable, fluffy towels and lots of pillows. There were many outlets and the Wi-Fi delivered.They did provide a coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator and air conditioner - all that worked.The neighborhood is a little questionable and I was warned to walk home before dark. Overall, the other guests all spoke nicely of their stay and felt it was a good value and conveniently located. On the 6th floor - there were no views, just city life as the building is in the middle of taller buildings.Practical for business and should benefit by the facelift for future stays.

review_body: The Pagoda Hotel is located in central Honolulu and in walking distance to Alamoana Shopping Center, Walmart, restaurants and other business establishments. Transportation from the airport on the hotel recommended shuttle bus took quite some time to load as people from various flights gathered. The return to the airport by taxi for two persons was only a couple dollars more than the shuttle. My husband and I stayed two nights at the hotel before our cruise around the islands and one night after the cruise. The price was very reasonable in comparison to many of the other hotels nearby. For a first time visitor to the hotel, the major construction work can be very disconcerting. The Reception desk is temporarily located in a very small room in the back of the property. This meant going through a dim passageway to get to the main portion of the hotel and the elevators. This was somewhat of a negative, but our purpose for being in Honolulu was to visit the city and see the sights rather than spend the day in a luxury hotel. Although a budget hotel, we found the rooms to be pleasingly comfortable once we were inside despite the need for some minor work. Any negative impressions were totally made up by the friendliness of the staff. Everyone was so accommodating and helpful. We did not have an opportunity to eat in the restaurant, but were impressed by its unique style --floating with waterfalls and ponds. A list of items covered in the daily convenience fee was posted at the front desk. The two of value to us were the wireless internet service and the free shuttle to Waikiki. Overall we had a very good experience and would recommend the hotel without hesitation.

I recently stayed in this hotel and enjoyed it very much. I had a room on the 12th floor with nice views of the mountains and city. The room itself was comfortable and quiet. The air conditioning worked great, there was tons of amenities in the room including a toaster, fridge, and coffee pot, and the beds were quite nice. The room had a flat screen tv and also had a PS3 if you are traveling with children. They stocked the room with plenty of towels, soaps/shampoos/etc. The hotel was remodeling but it didn't bother me at all. Pagoda is in a great location. It is 2 blocks away from Ala Moana shopping center and the beach. I walked to both places daily. There is a Ross, Walgreens, Walmart, and Sams club located right across the street, and tons of eateries in the area to choose from. I felt safe walking around the neighborhood as well. I did not find the area rough at all which I was worried about after reading reviews. I recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and want to still have a nice vacation. I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely come back to Pagoda the next time I am in Honolulu. Great overall experience!

This hotel is close to the real people in Honolulu. It is close to Alamoana Shopping Center, Ross, Walmart,etc. I have a grandbaby in Kapiolani Hospital so it was easy to get there. The local Bus system is really excellent. You can get to Wiaikiki easily. I rented a car this trip and found even with all the one way streets it was fairly straight forward. My room was very clean and has been remodeled recently. I found the room quiet and had a view of the misty mountains. After winding my way through construction sites and makeshift hallways I found the front desk. Staff is helpful. A nice experience.

Great location, parking across the street at $10/day is probably one of the cheapest around. Hotel is dated and needs work. Construction was going on when we were there. Shuttle to Waikiki unreliable. Ala Moana within 2 blocks. WalMart right across the street.

Pulling up to the hotel we originally thought our cab driver brought us to the wrong location. It was in what I would call a pretty rough part of town (looks wise anyway) and the hotel didn't match any of the pictures we saw on line when booking until we walked around back and saw what we assumed was the one wall they had painted nice for their website. The lobby is nice and the staff very friendly but once you leave the lobby and head to your room the nice stuff ends. Small, dirty, outdated, scummy all in all a horrible room. The restaurant next door that shares the same name is the only reason this gets two stars and even that is only based on appearance. It is very cool surrounded by koi ponds and has a little path you can walk around the grounds. However, when we got there the only dinner option was the buffet so we took it. We should have looked a a menu or asked for a price because we got the shock of a lifetime when the bill came and it was almost $90 for two buffet dinners and pop, the food wasn't even that good and had little to choose from.

My husband and I stayed at very cheap (and even camped) for most of our stay in Oahu, so we wanted to splurge just one night to have a nicer hotel. This definitely was not the place to do that. There was major construction in the lobby, we didn't have water for the first couple of hours of our stay, and the rooms look thirty years older than the pictures depict. It was a fine place if you're looking for the cheapest hotel right in the city, but it's nothing special.

I arrived a day late after being stuck at JFK Airport for the night. My mum called to let them know and she said the lady who responded was very polite and kind.On arrival I was greeted at reception by a warm friendly face and was checked in straight away.My room was very clean with two double beds clean linen, towels ect a wide screen TV and coffee and tea facilities. Hose keeping kept the room tidy.Paul the manager was so helpful after explaining I needed a dentist urgently due to my wisdom tooth he got me details and I was booked in straight away to have the dam thing out. Thanks Paul :)The girls and guys on reception made me feel so welcome after going to maui and returning they stored my luggage which was fantastic. There's a great little shop and small pool.My only negative comment is the wifi is not available in the room but they are currently doing some maintenance to improve this. And it works just as well in the lobby. The pagoda is in a fantastic location minuite a away from the Alah moana centre with shops and good stalls. Also through the centre is the beach and park with beautiful walks. Thanks everyone for a lovely stay and all your hard work and help Mahalo Catherine :)

Due to a last minute cancellation on a previous booking, I had to scramble to find another hotel to stay at. Looking at the reviews for this hotel, I expected that it would be a clean place but nothing special. And I was right. The location of the hotel makes it easy to walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and the numerous shops/restaurants in the area but the room could have been much better. The room was clean but the A/C wall unit had a large gap running around where it met with the window frame. It was large enough that traffic and conversation noise from the street could easily be heard. And I was on the 11th floor! Also, there were several mismatched paint spots above the bed and the bathtub surface was peeling. At least these cosmetic issues will be addressed on February 23rd when the hotel goes through a major renovation to bring the hotel back to its former glory according to the employees and locals I spoke to. Be prepared that if you think you will have wireless Internet access in your room, you will be wrong. The hotel only provides wireless Internet at their lobby area. Free Internet access in your room is only via Ethernet cable. So only your computer will work. Smartphones, iPhones and tablets are left without a connection. Getting past the cosmetic issues of the room, it is a quiet and comfortable. When comparing room rates for my business trip, the Pagoda Hotel was half the price of the hotels along Waikiki beach, an area I wanted to avoid due to traffic.Be prepared when using your GPS to find this hotel, Google Maps will send you to their shared parking structure with Ross Dress for Less. You will need to park in the Ross parking structure from the fourth floor and above. The first three floors are reserved for the Ross customers. The Pagoda Hotel is across the street from the parking structure. The Pagoda Hotel will provide you a parking pass for in/out privileges to the Ross parking structure but you will pay a daily rate of $10/day for your stay at the hotel separate from the room rate. The area around the hotel at night is not the greatest. When I was returning from the Ala Moana Shopping Center during the evening, I was asked by several homeless people for money. Unfortunately, they seem to camp themselves on the main routes of foot traffic people must use to get to and from the hotel. Overall, I probably wouldn't return to this hotel again until they complete their renovations. Unless you are under a budget constraint and like me, wanted to stay away from the Waikiki beach area traffic, I would try to find a condo or room elsewhere.

Room was ok. Hotel/rooms were a bit dated. Room service was accomodating. Swimming pool was small, but we didn't care for it because we'd rather soak up the sun @ the beach because not everywhere you'll find a "Hawaiian Beach" but a better chance @ finding a pool. lol. Didn't eat @ the buffet because it was a bit pricey but there's other "hole-in-the-wall" eateries that you could walk to. Pretty cool Coit pond. Gift shop in lobby was basically like any other, pricey. Parking was $10/day & across the street in the Ross Store parking garage. It wasn't so bad parking there because you can go shopping @ Ross! which is what I did almost everyday. lol. Walmart is a block away and Ala Moana Shopping Center (World's Largest Outdoor Mall) is about 2 blocks away! :-) Across the street from the mall is Ala Moana Beach! It's a pretty "central" location. Free shuttle to Waikiki (which we didn't use). Overall, it wasn't such a BAD place, because when you've had a long day @ the beach, shopping or exploring the island, the last thing you're gonna worry about is the color of the room and such. Trust me, you'll just wanna take a quick shower and LIGHTS OUT! lol. ;-) Thanks Pagoda, we'll be back for sure!

The reason me and my girlfriend booked this was because it was in a decent area and relatively cheaply priced. We were a bit nervous about going after looking at very mixed reviews but I don't have too many complaints about Pagoda. The receptionist wasn't a smiley character but our room was clean when we arrived and so was the bathroom and so for our 5 night stay it was no problem. One issue I have is that the maids don't clean, they basically come in and make the bed and leave when I think they should Hoover and do some cleaning. Also it's a bit cheeky paying your room price and then paying $10 + tax every night for things that you probably won't use such as dvd selection, toll free calls etc. But if you're looking for a clean room with air con (but noisy) then this is a place for you!

I have stayed at the Pagoda many times over the past 20 years & will continue to stay there when in Honolulu. If you want to experience "local" flavor, this is the hotel to stay at. The location is really convenient - not only to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, but to lots of little local eateries & shops - all within walking distance. You will meet a lot of other islanders there as well. The recent upgrades are very welcome - particularly in regards to the room furnishings. The Pagoda employees are polite, welcoming & helpful. My only dissatisfaction really is with the shower plumbing - water always runs inconsistently hot to cold rather than warm. Also could use some new shower fixtures. But if your trip to Honolulu is not all about spending all of your time in a fancy hotel & you like walking - you can't beat the Pagoda.

review_body: If I could give this place less than terrible I would. Yes, the original price was CHEAP however, after the "convenience fee" (which included in room internet access that was not up and running" and parking fee everyday ended up being MORE than staying at the Courtyard Marriott in Waikiki. We ended our stay early and decided to check into the Courtyard Marriott for $119! WITH WIFI and incredibly clean. Back to my review for the Pagoda Hotel...I ask for them to come back to the room to clean the headboards filled with fingerprints and something sticky (not sure if that was from the guest staying before us). The housekeeper came to the room...WITH A RAG, no clean supplies, just a dry rag. I mentioned to a teacher I work with (we live in Oahu) that our landlord made reservations for us to stay at the Pagoda Hotel while our apartment was being renovated and she was appalled and kindly informed me of the type of guests that stay there....those guests typically charge by the hour. Yes, it is that kind of hotel. Please don't waste your money staying here.

Overnight only, check in was easy and coordinated, room was a slight upgrade - mostly in size. No real views here to speak of but close to lots of places you may want or need to go. Ala Moana Center is just out the door, plenty of local style food spots and some really good recent finds for our trip. Room had been rehabbed some and was pretty clean, stocked OK and pretty quiet for an old hotel. Elevators had just been rehabbed. Overall would stay again when you just need a bed. The food place is supposed to be good but not open when we were there. "It is a yes-do it again OK".

Lets start with the good.I will give this hotel the benefit that it is located in the heart of Honolulu and within walking distance from Alla Moana Mall as well as many other local locations. However everything from there goes down hill. The rooms are relatively priced however their is fee on top of fee for every standard hotel amenity. It is $10 a night for them to clean your room, which is minimal, new towels only if they are on the floor in the bathroom if they are anywhere else they stay where they are, remake the bed with the same sheets, the entire 9 days we were had the same sheets on the bed, as well as change the trash but once again they only took out what was directly in the garage can. On top of that the house keeping walked in without knocking twice while we were in our room, one time I was in my bra and she just continued to clean giving me no privacy. The other fee I found ridiculous was another $10 parking fee to park in the parking garage however you had to park on the fourth level or higher which made this convenience into a pain in the butt.Nose was another huge problem I had with this hotel. The doors needed force to close them therefore every time someone closed a door on the floor you could hear and feel it in your own room. As well as every morning around 6 am there would be loud banging from the dumpsters being empty in the food court across the street. This went on for at least an hour, there were only two dumpsters so I don't know what they were doing but I was up by 6:30am every morning due to them, which was a huge bummer for being on a leisure vacation. My final complaint was the fact that the vents in the bathroom were connect to the room to your right. This was a problem because the people in the room next to us would smoke in their bathroom and it would fill out bathroom and room if the door wasn't shut with the smell of smoke. On top of this, the hotel in none smoking all over.This hotel overall is out dated however that can easily be over looked if the service and standards were their as well as wifi in the rooms, all they have is a Ethernet cable which is not compatible with tablets which is what I travel with. If you need a one night stay in Honolulu last minute this hotel will be...do able but not for longer.
