review_body: We just spent 6 nights at the Pagoda. It was a last minute booking and after seeing some of the reviews I expected a scary dirty dump.It actually was pretty close to excellent! We were given a room on floor 9 with two doubles and when I requested a king bed, Carlos smiled and gave us a corner room on floor 12. Some fixtures were a bit outdated but the room was huge, bed was comfy,and the room service was fine about cleaning and making up the room everyday.Breakfast at the lovely Pagoda restaurant was included and we enjoyed that most days. Lots of restaurants in the area to choose from too. I recommend the Yogur cafe and their excellent ube pancakes. I guess the elevator service was a bit slow at times but everything else was great! We could walk to the beach and the very fine Honolulu Museum of Art from there.

On Thrusday, December 25, 2014 I was in need of a room and came in as a walk in to this hotel. When I checked in, Bill, the front desk attendant started to check me in with no problem. When my partner approached, after the room had been paid for, Bill's attitude switched once he found out I was openly gay. He then started to have an attitude problem with me and my partner by interrogating my partner to the point my partner felt discriminated, fustrated and unwelcome. My partner told me to forget about this hotel and demanded I get a refund. I did get a refund, then we proceded to a near by hotel called The Ala Moana Hotel, rates were slightly higher. However, we did not feel discriminated, Unwelcomed and disrespected because of our sexual orientation. We had a amazing time at The Ala Moana Hotel. The reason I felt the need to write a review was because the following: a.) I phoned the Hotel Manager, Paul Dunn and left several messages at his office as well as his cell phone 2.) Four days after the incident and no call back showed me that this hotel displayed no respect for their guests and any concerns. So due to lack of management I felt this review was important for me to convey to the public. If you are openly gay DO NOT stay here as Bill will disrespect you beyond belief.

Always stay at Pagoda when on Oahu for business or pleasure. Location is great and rooms are clean. Staff is always friendly. Close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Sam's Club, Walmart. Great restaurants. Near Neil Blaisdell Arena. Love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I stay here every time I travel to Oahu. In fact I have been staying at this property for 30 years. The location is great because you are walking distance from many restaurants and stores. Ala Moana Shopping Center is walking distance. It is reasonably priced and the rooms are clean and spacious. I like staying there because of the price and location. The employees are friendly and courteous.

This hotel is off the beach but a great value for a couple of a family. It is near several major shopping centers. The rooms have full cooking facilities so you can save on restaurant costs. Beds were extremely comfortable. Only drawback is there is no wi-fi in the rooms.

We stay here when things do not allow us to stay at room. Good value and central location.The neighborhood is not one a lone female would walk alone late at night though. Moderate priced restaurants are near by.

I stay at the Pagoda each time I'm in Honolulu. The location is perfect for shopping, restaurants, and convenient to doctors at Queen's Hospital. The rooms are large, comfortable, and clean with a microwave and a fridge. The elevators are secure and require a room key to access guest floors which helps safety as a single woman. Taxis are available at the door and a Hertz car rental desk near the lobby.

I live on the Big Isalnd and stay at the Pagoda every time I visit Oahu. The staff there is friendly and really do their best to showcase that Aloha Spirit that we locals look for! I don't know about others who may have a different opinion but they were top notch in making the guests feel like family! A big Mahalo to the Aunties at the front desk for always making my stay there enjoyable and relaxing even when I'm there for only a night or two!.

We live on Maui and the Pagoda Hotel has always been convenient and affordable for Neighbor Islanders. Now, it is better than ever. The rooms are still comfortable and clean. The staff is still friendly and helpful. There is an onsite restaurant once more --- serving breakfast, lunch and dinner--including a buffet. I took my husband to Honolulu for his 65th birthday and we stayed for two nights. We got to the hotel about 2 PM and the staff got us into our room early. Even though I had a car and could have gone anywhere on the island, we chose to dine in our first night. Wise decision. The Pagoda is near shopping---Walmart, Ross, and a block from Ala Moana Shopping Center, the biggest mall on the island. We'll plan to go back for his 66th birthday---if not sooner--and we'll stay at the Pagoda, of course.Audrey Rocha Reed, Maui

The concierge to the house keeping employees had been nothing but sincere..showing the true meaning of ALOHA. They took care of my mom and I with open arms and showed great service. Because of their excellent hospitality, we were able to have a place to stay while in the hospital with my father. Mahalo nui a nui loa employees of PAGODA (:

I ended up calling them directly to book the room. Surprisingly, I got a better deal than any of the travel sites. Stayed for three nights. No complaints, everything was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was available in the garage for $10 a day but they told me I could park on the street since it was the weekend. I found parking right in front of the hotel two nights. What a deal in Honolulu!

I was at a conference in the Conference Center for a couple of days and needed a cheaper hotel in the area. I saw the Pagoda on a website and booked a couple of days. I arrived late at night and the staff were very welcoming and explained how to get around. There is a shuttle running from the hotel into town as well as lots of buses. There were some kids making noise in the lobby where there is free wifi but they gave me a room on the 11th floor away from the noise. The room was clean and quiet. You have to pay $10 a night resort fee but this gets you a paper in the morning, wifi in the room and the shuttle. There is also a stand to hire cars through Hertz in the hotel which I used one day and the car came immediately. All in all a decent place to stay

We've been staying at the Pagoda once or twice a year for about 40 years. In our experience over those years, the staff has been friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and with expected facilities (air conditioning, refrigerator, TV, coffee maker, toaster, radio-alarm-clock). The hotel is within walking distance (1 to 7 blocks) from Walmart, Ross, Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Moana Beach Park and Magic Island beach area. The attached restaurant is pleasantly surrounded by fish ponds (fun to look at, especially for Kids), and serves breakfast, lunch & dinner and has buffets for dinner and brunch on weekends. These are excellent and all-you-can-eat, but a bit expensive ($36 brunch, $39 dinner).

Every year our church host our annual Transformation Conference and the Pagoda is where we always stay for the week. Every year it gets better especially with the recent renovations - we love our room! It is very comfy! Yodie Mizukami and the housekeeping staff was always on time preparing our room for us coming "home" to our room after a long morning or night at conference. Mahalo for always making us feel like family. We look forward in returning back again soon!

Don't believe the pictures on the website. This is the first time I've ever seen a hotel photo not match up with the actual hotel. I stayed in the tower of the lower part of the hotel, so it was cheaper and also much creepier.The bad:The noise was awful. People were slamming their doors or making other noise all through the night. The room had louver windows, which I will never understand the purpose of in a hotel. They let in all the street noise, which went on at all times of the day. I recommend bringing ear plugs and turning on the air conditioning to drown out the noise at night. The room was dirty. There was mold growing in the air conditioner and mold growing in the vent in the bathroom. I brought cleaning wipes with me, so I got rid of some of the mold in the aircon before I turned it on. The door has one lock. I'm used to double-locks, so this made me pretty uncomfortable.The curtains are thin, so there's no blocking the light to not be woken up early in the morning.The okay things about it: If you need something super cheap and aren't staying too long, I might recommend this place. Otherwise, spend the extra money to get the vacation you want. The staff is pretty nice. I didn't have any trouble with them.It's nice that it's close to Ala Moana Center, Wal-mart, and other shopping. I thought with such a great location, this hotel would be better. I heard from locals that this is the cheap place they stayed in for school trips or other short trips to the island.

We always stay at the Pagoda when visiting Oahu. The location is great for shopping as Ross is right across the street and Walmart and Ala Moana Shopping Center are both about a 5-10 minute walk away. Additionally, we love shopping at Don Quixote for Asian and local goodies to bring back home and they are about a 7 minute walk away, as well. I wouldn't walk around at night however as the surrounding area outside of Keeamoku is a little questionable. If you want elegance you can pay the $300 plus rate elsewhere, but for the money we feel the Pagoda is a bargain!

There's not much to rave about this hotel. Staff customer service wasn't too good. While at the front desk, even with no other customers, I was not acknowledged and made to wait until they wanted to assist me.My daughter arrived a few days after me and complained about getting bitten in her bed. On a couple occasions, I stayed to watch housekeeping clean the room and noticed that they didn't change the sheets.Our toilet got plugged twice. Thankfully, it didn't take them too long to come to fix it.The sound insulation wasn't too good; because you could hear the people and traffic both inside and outside of the hotel.

The best thing about this hotel is that you can walk to Ala Moana mall which was has the best food court!! There is also a Walmart located basically across the street which is great if you want to run out for snacks (which helped us save money on food) . . . or to pick up a candle and a lighter if you're room smells musty (like ours did). If you're looking to save money this hotel is perfect. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The restaurant next door had great food and excellent service.

No complaints. Very pleased. Not a great neighborhood, but it just didn't matter. All my needs were met at the Pagoda, and I actually used some of the stores nearby. Room was clean, hot shower, fridge, etc., etc. I would totally recommend this hotel to any one looking for a clean, pretty, and great hotel at a very affordable price. Good quality. Try it, you'll like it. --- Joy

The location to the Ala Moana mall makes this a plus location(a mere three blocks). I mention the mall because the teenagers we traveled with loved the food court (it was massive and the variety is great for all appetites). The shopping at this mall is really upscale, all the really big designer names are there. Surprisingly, just outside the mall is a 24 hour Wal Mart and next to that is Starbucks. The Ala Moana beach is not a good choice, there are a lot of homeless sleeping everywhere.  From the hotel it is about a three mile hike into the main strip of Waikiki beach shopping and hot beach spots (tourist heaven).There is a $10 per vehicle, per day parking fee. Wifi is a charge of $10 a day and only accessible in the main lobby. The swimming pool is as big as a oversized jacuzzi. Sleep in Tower 2 is difficult at best. It is currently being renovated for sale as low income housing. Construction is all day long, work and noise. At night people walking on the block can be heard as though they are the room with you (the walls are that thin). Trash trucks come even on Saturday morning at 5:00 am and feel like they are in the room with you as well. The beds are twins and actually comfortable with clean smelling linens and towels. Maid service is spotty.Despite all this I would stay here again and ask for a different Tower? Yes, just because of the location.

We booked two double beds and ended up with 4 singles. A room that sleeps 4 and only has enough cutlery and crockery for two is not good enough.You have a coffee machine but no kettle.Between the two sites only 2 washing machines worked . The Wifi wasn't working in reception but nobody seemed to care. Mary Lou was the only person on reception who took notice.It was close to shops and suitable from that point of view. The current make over looks substandard in workmanship. Training in giving service wouldn't go amiss.

I was let in on the local secret of the Pagoda Hotel when I was on a one year fellowship on Oahu at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. Many locals from other islands book their stay on Oahu at the Pagoda because they give a 'Kama'aina (local) rate' if you have a Hawaii drivers' license. Even without the local connection, you can usually get a very good rate for a very basic room at the Pagoda, and you can get a room on short notice!The hotel isn't located on the beach or in Waikiki, but pretty centrally in Honolulu, within reasonable walking distance of Ala Moana Shopping Mall, lots of restaurants of all types and local bus service.If you want to sample traditional Hawaiian food, the Pagoda Restaurant is a good choice, especially for breakfast - all the eggs, bacon, Portuguese sausage, white rice and sides you'd ever want, plus local juices and teas.If you are on a budget and need a room for just a few nights while awaiting your flight to another one of the Hawaiian Islands, I highly recommend checking out the Pagoda. A basic room has full bathroom, AC, TV, queen or 2 double beds, maybe a small fridge and microwave, maybe a cooktop and some cabinets to store some snacks and food. Wi-fi is optional for a fee or maybe free in the lobby - it was sketchy the last time I stayed. If you want to park there, there is a fee, but considering how much parking is in Honolulu, it's reasonable and safe. So if you want basic, clean, reasonably priced and available, this is a great option in Honolulu.

Just what I ordered, 2 beds very comfortable. Carlos at front desk was most helpful, taking our luggage until we got back later.When I asked for extra towels, sugar or the faulty key-card, they came straight away and were most helpful, even logged my daughter onto the net when her purchased ticket was slow.Enjoyed our 6 day stay, with Ross, WalMart & Alamoana close by. Also easy directions to UHManoa which is why we chose them and will definitely rent a car next time, especially with the Hertz Rental in house - handy.

review_body: If you expect luxury, don't go for the terrace. You'll be walking across the street instead of being at the main hotel. The terrace was going through renovation so the look wasn't that great, but understandable. Although if you walk around the corner you'll see beds and furniture piled up next to two dumps trucks, not inside the dump itself. A small ant problem in the kitchenette, but I liked having the kitchenette. If staying in the terrace location, be prepared for the more ghetto side, people walking past your doors late at night with no consideration of others while talking very loudly. Because of the renovation the pool was out of order so you have to walk across the street to the main lobby and use that pool. Don't walk out at night, seems that party goers and crack heads will be all over, possibly walking in and out the hotel possibly from someone they know opening the door for them. Staff was very friendly and room itself was clean enough although I did find a fork on the ground. The bathroom sink was a little off, if you pushed the hot water off all the way the water would still run, you needed to push it half way in order for it to stop running. I give it an average score if you don't mind the "issues" but I understand they're renovating so things may seem worse at the time, I'm hoping it'll get better because I've heard good reviews about it before from family and coworkers. But they may have stayed at the main hotel itself.

I only stayed for a night because I extended my trip a day and the hotel where I spent the rest of my vacation was booked the extra day. Nice hotel over all. I got a 2 bedroom suite which also included a living area, kitchen, dining area (6 chair dining table) and 1 bathroom. Main room had a queen bed and the other room had a full size bed and a twin bed (no TVs in the rooms only in the living room). Worked out perfect for my family for a low price. It was clean. Curtains don't block the light so if you're not a morning person and light bothers you, this room may not be for you. I stayed in the 1st floor closer to the street and you can hear everything. It is not soundproof. Staff at the lobby was friendly.

Overall review was very good. Easy to get checked in. No nonsense with the staff. Very friendly.Good room.Very COLD AC!! Room was quite. Beds were great. Close to Walmart and Ala Moana Shopping Center. But Pagoda COULD use an Honolulu Airport Shuttle.

We spent a week at the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu. It is the best hotel if you consider its room and car package ($153 per night), its location - you can walk to a bunch of restaurants, stores like Ross and Walmart and the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, although somewhat dated, and the housekeeping staff works hard to keep the place spic and span.There are two drawbacks to this hotel. While each room can sleep four, most rooms have two double beds which is difficult sleeping arrangements for tall or large people. Secondly, the elevator key system for getting to your room doesn't always work...at least not for me...I kept having to have other people help me out. If you are claustrophobic and anxious, not a good situation.The hotel is in the process of renovating and they are putting in new furniture in the rooms on a daily basis. We would stay in this hotel again because of its advantages.

We like staying here cause its close to Airport, Alamoana, and Waikiki. Its Value is pretty good for how old it is. You can walk to Beach and Shopping in minutes. I already booked 2 more stays here in Sept and Dec. On property dining is delicious and great bar.

Love staying at the Pagoda. Have been a returning guest for many years mainly because of the very convenient location of the hotel and the surrounding shopping and eateries. I use the Pagoda for both business and personal trips.

I was very happy with my stay at the Pagoda. The location was excellent. Walking distance to the mall, walmart, and Ross. Yes, the hotel is old. This is not the Marriott, but you are paying much less than the Marriott also and I thought the cleanliness was great. My room was very clean every, single day. I never had to ask for extra towels which is something I always have to do. The front desk staff was great. Every person in this hotel is friendly. The pool area was nice. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay again. Being able to rent movies for free and the boys could rent games for the PS3 was an added bonus. The hotel was perfect for what I needed it for, a place to sleep and shower while I explored Hawaii. Thank you for making my experience great.

The staff at The Pagoda Hotel and also The Pagoda Restaurant provided me with excellent customer attention! What a breath of fresh local air in the midst of the changing city. Carlos and the rest of the staff at the front desk ensured my trip went perfect, thank you! If your looking to book a five star hotel, I'd recommend calling elsewhere; but if your looking to book with five star customer service, THIS IS IT! Trustworthy housekeepers, hard working maintenance crew, genuinely concerned staff, friendly food servers, add up to FIVE STAR CUSTOMER SERVICE! Mahalo no ka kokua O Honolulu!

I stayed at the Pagoda for two nights. I have nothing to complain about (although I did read the bad reviews before I travelled). I would not say this was the best hotel in town, but I do think the room I got was nice and cosy, but for me it was just a place to sleep and relax, after a long day exploring Honolulu, Waikiki and the island of Oahu.. The hotel is located in a residential area, but close to the shopping centers (a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Center). If you like walking it would take about 20 minutes to reach Waikiki beach.

Druggies and homeless harassing me all the time. I will NEVER stay here again. The hotel also waited 6 months to notify me there was a problem with my bill. Actually that is incorrect. I wasn't notified. They just charged me 2k 6 months later. Total crooks. I recommend this place to no one. None of the local attraction shuttles will do business with this place and that should be a good indicator as to what type of establishment you are considering....

Very disappointed. My room wasn't very clean. The rooms could use a face lift. Parking was not very convenient (although parking is cheap). No internet access. A lot of street noise. I guess next time I will pay a bit more.

The hotel was nothing like what the Web-site shows unless you are on the tope floor 10,11,and Penthouse floor. First of all when we got to the airport we were told the the hotel does not have a shuttle bus so we had to pay $ 35.00 per person and it was 4 of us to get to the hotel. Then when we get their we had to give them another $50.00 deductable for our room inspite of paying for everything six month in advance. when we finally got to our room on the 5th floor I was stun to see the room in the shape that it was in. It was the worse hotel room that I ever seen in my life, let me put this way. I would not let my worse enemy stay at this hotel. When we complained to the Manger Paul, he was very apolegetic and accomodated us generously. After we left the hotel we came itching from what I believe to be bed lice. The moral to this review is stick to what you know even if it cost you a little bit more.

A group of us stayed at the Pagoda a couple of weeks ago for a total of 12 nights. I understand getting what you pay for but I couldn't believe the amount of problems we experienced while staying here. Most of the rooms had cockroaches in them; in ours specifically we not only had them in the bathroom, but also all over the kitchen. There were hundreds of tiny ants covering the kitchenette counter and crawling into the microwave vents. The water for the showers was always fluctuating from scalding to freezing and some of our rooms wouldn't have sufficient pressure coming from the shower heads in order to properly rinse out your hair. Room service would sometimes skip over our room unless we called around 5pm to ask for our towels to be replaced. Room service and security do not knock prior to entering, they simply use their keys and enter the room. The Pagoda is currently undergoing some construction as they plan to turn their towers into condominiums. A letter was left in each of our rooms stating that investors would be stopping by to view the rooms with a security guard for a week long period, during hours that covered the majority of the day, and that our consent was implied, not requested. I find it very unprofessional that they did this, and couldn't offer a scheduled date and time that a room was empty for someone to come and view it, or even talk to the people who were in that room to schedule an appropriate time. There were a few people from our group who actually had security come into their room unannounced (not even knocking) and wake up someone who was taking a nap because they wanted to show that unit. I couldn't believe the audacity of someone to barge in like that and invade someone's privacy.On top of all of this, whenever we would call down and ask for something from the front desk (ex. an extra pot or a bottle opener) we would sit and wait for about 30 minutes and would have to call back again to ask for things. I'm not sure if they hoped we would forget or they were legitimately always busy, but when we called back to ask they would have someone come up within 5 minutes. Sometimes the service at the front desk wasn't even close to personable, as you would be continuously be interrupted by someone starting to do another task. Needless to say I would NOT recommend the Pagoda to anyone, and I hope that what we experienced was simply bad service due to their attempt of overhauling the building.

pagoda hotel was a nice place to stay for the weekend, the amenities were great, service was wonderful, the pool was wonderful, the people at the hotel was very nice to talk too. the rooms were great.

The hotel is old but is a good price. There are clean rooms with good location and great staff. I always stay here when I visit Honolulu. Stores are very close to walk to. The Floating restaurant is a good restaurant next door or there are other good ones close by and within walking distance.

review_body: Good place for a tight budget,close to shopping malls,local restaurants,groceries,5 min away from public transportation.Room has microwave,refrigerator,coffee machine and toaster.You can easily make your own breakfast.

Pagoda is a decent hotel for a quick stop over. I was looking for a place to sleep for a few hours after a long day of flying and a late check-in. I did not want to pay $250+ for a couple of hours of sleep, so we booked a cheaper hotel for the first night, then checked in to my real vacation hotel for the rest of the Oahu trip. Inconvenient, but I knew that going in and really wanted to save some money on that first night. Pagoda is old, and a bit out dated, but clean and inexpensive. That was what I was looking for. However, my boyfriend forgot something and we've been having a hard time getting some help having it returned. A bit disappointing, but we are still working on it.

Great location. Walking distance to many attractions. New towels were provided each day along with the beds being remade. Microwave and refrigerator were in good working order. There is a fee for parking but the parking garage is close by and clean.

As has been noted many times here, the Tower seems to be the preferred building to stay over the Terrace. First the many positives....large room, nice TV, decent # stations, good lighting, hair dryer, microwave, refrigerator, shampoo, moisturizing lotion, tub and shower, two lavratories, good air conditioner, convenient location, good price, parking only $10 a day in the Ross parking garage, toaster, coffee maker, nice check-in clerks, firm bed, noise level OK, water pressure good, and I left one of my car windows down just a bit and was given a courtesy call by the front desk so I could fix the issue (nothing left in car but still a nice thing for them to do). The only negatives were minor cosmetic issues on shower/tub tiles (beige paint covering peeling off in places where it covered blue tiles underneath), and the basin worn in one lavratory. The main complaint is they charge $1 for local calls and toll free calls...almost no motels'hotels do that. Parking note: It only costs $10 a day to park in Ross garage across the street from Tower (4th through the 6th levels), BUT there are many meters around the perimeter of the hotel that are NOT enforced at night until early morning. Thus, if you are smart and don't mind a slight inconvenience, you can use meters which seem to be available and can probably park for maybe $2 a day to cover late afternoon, early morning.

Stayed for 5 nights and extremely disappointed. Everyday we returned to the room there was no room service. Everyday they failed to remake the beds, vacuum the floor, replace towels needing washing,or restock toilet paper. Every day!!! No matter how late you return. Then they charges us for a rollaway that they never brought in. Normally, I'm not bothered by other guests, but when they are pounding their doors, party g and smoking Marijuana every night until 3 am... it's a problem. Even reporting it go the fro t desk and security did nothing. Time to find d a new place to stay

It was my first time on Oahu. I did not know anything about the area or hotel. I was given a great rate, when my room was not ready for early checkin they provided me with another room. Location was perfect, walking distance to the Mall, restaurants, and the Waikiki Strip. This is an older hotel, but I was there to experience the island. Hotel was clean, pool was nice and restaurant is awesome. I will stay here again.

The original room was in an adjacent building across the street. It was under renovations and left a lot to be desired. I had requested a double or queen bed and this room had twin beds. This room had yet to be renovated and it was in desperate need of same. It was very late at night when we arrived and we were far too tired to trot back across the street to make any changes until the next morning. We went to the main desk the next morning planning to check out and the desk clerk was willing to refund the money for the next 2 nights that we had already booked for. She then suggested we stay in the main building with a double bed and we settled for that. It was spacious and comfortable. This hotel has no wi-fi and nothing close by other than Starbucks a few blocks away for internet service.We very much appreciated the manager on duty when we dealt with him and another staff member regarding a situation that in the end righted itself. Both staff were professional and I am pleased to say the outcome was a positive one. The manager gave us a box of chocolate covered macadamia nuts as an anniversary gift as well.

We stayed at the Pagoda because money matters. The first room we stayed in was floor-level, and in all honesty, I was not impressed. However we did stay in a room higher up in the hotel on a later visit, and it was quite okay.This is my take... this hotel is where the locals (from the various islands) stay. It's clean, affordable, it is certainly dated, but it has a fantastic pagoda restaurant next door, and it is simply a walk away from the beach.If or when we return to Oahu, we will stay here again. All in all, it was a good experience.

I just arrived in Manila from a week stay at this hotel and can only think of two positive points on this hotel. 1.) The location and 2) Your staff at the check in counter name Alice who was very helpful and the best hotel employee i have ever encountered so far. Kudos to Alice. The rest of my stay was all in the negative. The terrace room was really really old. There were also cockroaches in the room and the toiletries where not regularly replenished. If you're a light sleeper and get easily woken up by noises and sunlight, then don't choose this hotel as i can guarantee you that you will not get a decent sleep in this hotel with all the noises from the cars, motorcycles, trucks that pass by as you can hear them from your room. And in the early morning between 5 and 6, you can hear the flock of birds chirping and a little later the sunlight is up as the curtains in the room were not enough the deflect the sunlight.

If you're desperate for a hotel it is really ok, but yes it's very noisy. Needs some improvements. Other than me going to surgery I would have picked a better hotel. This would be a last resort. Hey but if you really need it, go for it

If you are looking for a great location, reasonable price hotel please continue to look for other hotels. The pictures are deceitful, this hotel has 2 buildings one is going through a renovation and the main one needs to be renovated. WARNING!! If you decide to visit this establishment please take pictures of your room before and after, if you don't they will charge you for items that you supposedly broke in the room. Some staff members were disorganized. The hotel food was distasteful and expensive. They charge you for internet if you need access and charge you daily to go in and out of the parking garage versus a set daily price. My next visit to Hawaii will be at a hotel that I am familiar with or stay on one of the military bases.

We recently stayed in the Terrace building at the Pagoda and we were unhappy with the condition of the rooms that we booked. The furnishings are quite worn, the beds were old and stained, and paint was peeling from the walls. I get that renovations are ongoing, however the rooms should not be rented under any conditions. They are just plain awful.The only reason for two stars is because of the wonderful customer service from the staff.

The property is conveniently close to Ala Moana Center and Waikiki. We stayed in the Terre building. It is undergoing renovation which we were not notified before our visit. The parking lots were closed and our van was too big to fit in their other lot. We had to find street parking which was a hassle. The rooms were clean and rather quiet, but paint was peeling on the ceilings. There was scaffolding all over the property. I would avoid it until the renovations are completed.

As a retired couple in town for a family re-union, we found it suited our needs very well. I would classify it as an honest to goodness 3 star hotel - value for money and good at what they do. The staff were consistently pleasant and helpful - especially in the restaurant. We had excellent breakfasts there every day and some good family dinners also. For Honolulu, the room size is generous, clean and well-maintained. You don't have room service, but that's OK because you are near to plenty of restaurants at the Ala Moana centre. They don't have a laundry service so you don't get charged $10 for a pair of socks, but you can use the Laundromat in the basement. No valet parking, but you get a special rate in the car park just across the street. Above everything else, you don't get charged the room rates that you would a few blocks away in Waikiki.One beef? Noisy air-con in our room, but we turned it off at nightWe would definitely return

courteous people working at this hotel; everyone was most helpful! I love the restaurant.;it is very unique and well maintained. The garden and fish were a treat! The food was also excellent. I wish the restaurant and the bar were open till 11 or 12 pm. 9 pm is often too early for me when I am traveling.

From the moment we arrived, we were treated like ohana (family). When making the reservations, we had asked for a quiet floor and were given a very quiet room on the top (12th) floor looking at the ocean. We checked in before our room was ready and left our bags in the storage room. When we returned later, the woman who had checked us in remembered our names. This was particularly impressive, as the hotel was completely sold out our first night and was very busy. The housekeeping was very friendly and did an excellent job cleaning. We were even helped in printing out our boarding passes when we left.

Overall I gave the hotel a VERY GOOD rating. We always stay at Pagoda when we travel to Oahu, because it is centrally located, and not in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. We stayed in a 1bedroom at the Terrace. Check-in was smooth,no hassle, Friendly front desk staff, we got to the hotel early (about 130pm) and we were able to get an early check-in!! :) As stated at the the front desk the Terrace was being renovated, but didn't notice or hear any of the construction workers. The room we were in on the 3rd floor of the Terrace, seemed to be partially renovated, with new carpets, fresh paint, new shower stall, flat screen tv, etc. however the bathroom floor wasn't completely done, and the shower/tub water took forever to drain. When ever we passed the maid they always acknowledged us with a smile and "aloha", which I thought was nice. It would have been nice to have free wi-fi in the rooms or lobby area...

This hotel is in a great locationWalk to Ross / Walmart /ala moanaShopping mallAlso many good nearby restaurantsI took I bus from the airport here 2.50 and got off at the ala moana shopping center n walked abt 15 mins n found the placeNice easy check in and friendlyThe room in the tower is totally acceptable Nice big room n clean bathroom

Room was much nicer than the last time we stayed there. Very clean and all rooms are no smoking. Saw a lot of people there from the island that we are from. Nice to see familiar faces. Very convenient location for us locals. $10 parking across the street from the tower where we were is not too bad. Staff was very helpful at the front desk and all the staff in general were very friendly.

PLEASE HIT THE LIKE BUTTON IF THIS REVIEW IS OF USE TO YOU, THANKS IN ADVANCE.1. Booked a kitchenette room but was next to the building site so were quickly and smoothly moved to a superior room in the main hotel block.Kitchenette room was basic but ok to sleep in. TV was the older type and made a humming sound when on.2. Superior room was clean, had very nice beds with memory foam mattresses which had protectors on them. Aircon was good in the room.Toaster, fridge with small freezer section and microwave were included.Front desk provided us with plates and some plastic cutlery.Plenty of hot water in bathroom, towels, shampoo, soap.Hair dryer in room. New flat screen tv with good choice of programs.Very sadly no free wifi which was upsetting, this should be a given in any hotel, even hostels seem to have it free....3. Pool looked nice, we did not use, it was unheated and had nice sunbathing area around it.4. There is a restaurant but did not use it.5. Staff are exceptional, nothing is too much trouble and they genuinely want you to enjoy your stay.6. Easily walkable to large shopping mall with all the top names, McDonalds, restaurants , waterfront. 7. Near the mall are bus stops which take you where you need to go.8. We walked to Waikiki beach, around 45 mins.ALL IN ALL A GOOD STAY BUT THERE WAS NOISE EARLY MORNINGS FROM LORRY REVERSING ALARMS, IT DID DISTURB US BUT WE MANAGED TO PUT UP WITH IT.

We found the front desk staff to be friendly, thoughtful and helpful. They stored our bags when we arrived very early and again after we checked out. The restaurant service and breakfast was delightful, plus, the garden is beautiful and we took many pictures of the waterfall and fish.

I find Pagoda Hotel always a very convenient hotel to stay at because of its location. I love the new renovations being done at the hotel to upgrade it. New hotel management is very friendly and very helpful. The hotel is located at very secure and safe environment. Maids are very are very pleasant.

review_body: We often plan a short island get away and we like the convenience of staying here. It's easy to walk to all the neighboring eateries and try something different. Ross and Don Quijote are just across the street as well as some other big box stores. It's easy to get on/off the freeway without much of the traffic jams. We've always found the staff friendly and accommodating. It's nice to see that they are continuing to upgrade the facility. We just got back and the room we had was clean, neat and wonderful! We'll be back for sure. Mahalo from Maui

If you are just looking for a decent place to stay, Pagoda Hotel is a good one. We stayed in a room with a kitchenette, so we were able to cook a quick meal if needed. Everything that you need is all close by the hotel. My sons visited the Koi pond and fed the fish . I recommend the hotel if you just need a comfortable place to stay.

Very unfriendly staff, where we stayed was not attached to the main hotel, it was not what the pictures looked like on the nett when booked, building was a dirty looking building across the road from the main building, disappointing all round, even the locals we spoke to were amazed we were staying there; its only benefit was it was walking distance to wallmart, I was there in may 2012, never again.!

One great location. Walking distance from Ala Moana BLVD and many more important places. Wall-mart is a whisper away. Rooms are average and the bed is comfortable. No free wifi is a big disappointment. You need to pay $9 and $.40 tax per day for internet via a cable. You need a laptop for that. if you are only on a smart phone or tab, good luck.The location is the reason to select this venue. Rooms will get road noise!

We live in Hawaii and needed a place to stay while home repairs were being done. Pagoda Hotel was the perfect solution for us. It's conveniently and centrally located in Honolulu near shops, various eateries; yet also minutes away from Waikiki. Great value and service, very friendly and helpful staff. It was like our home away from home for us. We stayed in a Tower Deluxe room; it met our needs (comfortable queen beds and pillows, also loved the room's layout). We enjoyed our stay, would stay there again, and recommend it to others.

When we arrived we were given a room in the Terrace. It was really horrible, with old damaged furniture and depressing colours. When I rang the front desk, we were moved straight to the Tower (building with reception in it). Our room was refurbished, similar to the one pictured above, clean and had a view. The staff were extremely helpful, they made up our room every day, gave information and change and twice when I rang for maintenance a man arrived in about 5 minutes. The location is good, close to many restaurants and walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre for gifts, food and transport. There was usually at least one taxi waiting outside the door too.

Bedroom had fist holes in the door. The upholstery was worn through so badly you could see the foam padding. The carpets were badly stained. The aircoditioning unit in the bedrrom had leaked and stained the carpet. The air conditioner from the room above had leaked through the ceiling and the plaster had fallen off. The veneer had fallen off the coffee table. We arrived after 11pm and were told our room was not in the main block but up the street and across the road - no offer was made to help with bags or escort us to the room - not very comforting for 3 women late at night.

Great accomodations in a very convenient location. Close to Ala Moana Center (5 min. walk), Waikiki (15 min. walk or 5 min. bus). Fantastic on site restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Near lots of shopping including Walmart and Don Quiote. All the employees, especially the front desk and restaurant were wonderful. Had a room in the tower on the 12th floor. When you stay here, forget about renting a car, no need. We look forward to returning to be a part of the Pagoda Ohana (family) again. Mahalo to all.

We spent one night at this hotel before leaving Hawaii. The Hotel is way different from what is shown in the website photos. The rooms are not well kept although not dirty. Extremely old fashioned and overpriced. In the corridor there was an hawful smell. The personnel was very friendly anf helpful.

We stayed in our room for about two hours - which was the time it took us to organise accommodation elsewhere. The curtains were stained as was the carpet and the room smelled awful. The plaster was falling off the ceiling and the bathroom was grotty. Even our shuttle bus person commented - please let us know if you decide to change!

the pagoda hotel is still the most affordable hotel for local people...very basic....the renovations by the wave chain are very poor....ugly color....did not fix the bathrooms.....but it is clean and well located....parking is reasonable across the street and you can walk to the shopping cntr, if you wish......there are a large no of places to eat......get a 'NO SMOKING" ROOM.....or it can smell of old smoke.....

First we chose to stay in the terrace because it was a big room and had a kitchen. In the pictures it looked okay. When we got there we saw what a nightmare it was. The room looked ugly as hell and the puke looking green carpets were dirty and ugly. In the kitchen there was ants and cockroaches and in the bathroom the wall was a little teared. After 2 days staying there we complained in the lobby and they gave us a different room in the terrace. This room wasn't too much different than the other only that it smelled pee. So we went and complained again and they gave us a room on the main tower. This room was actually pretty decent. Only that it was smaller and didn't have a kitchen. There was a small fridge and a microwave though. This room was much fresher and we didn't have any problems so we stayed here. Pagoda can be a decent stay if you don't stay in the terrace. The location is pretty good and the service is decent. Walmart, Sams Club and Ross are across the street. Ala Moana Center (mall) is only a couple of blocks away. I could give this review a 3 star if there was free Wi-Fi and free breakfast but they cost money. So the Terrace give a 0 star and the main tower I give 2 star.

When we first arrived we booked in then we were told to go out the door turn right go across the road and go in the locked gate oh yeah no one bothered to help with our suit cases. Then we got to our room shock horror couldn't close windows and the wind and rain blew in. It was supposed to be The Pagoda Terrace what a lot of crap. You should up grade your profile and show what the hotel is really like. The profile we saw was nothing like what we got. Oh and l nearly forget when people cook in their rooms it stinks the whole floor out.

We bought this through Expedia as it was described as close to airport. It's not. It's about 40 bucks by cab. Although the rate is not expensive there is no excuse for a smelly room with body hair on the sheets. There are better places to stay that are a lot closer to the airport.

We stayed here because of the low cost but were pleasantly surprised how nice it was.Very close to public transit, Wal Mart across the street, restaurant on site and about 10 restaurants less than a block away.My only complaint is there is no jazzui.

The AC unit in the room is extremely loud and there's a faint smell of cigs even though the room is non-smoking. The place is older and it shows in the rooms, however it was one of the cheapest hotels in the area so understandable. Staff at the front desk was very nice and helped me book shuttles to/from the airport.

Although the Terrace is undergoing renovations and will no longer be part of the hotel effective March 2014, I am both happy and sad -- happy for renovations and possibility of my owning a unit there, and sad that I won't be able to stay in the Terrace in the future as I enjoy the convenience and affordability. Then, again, happy and looking forward to staying in the hotel tower as it has been highly recommended to me. It was great, so convenient, friendly and quick service, rooms were clean, and I had everything at my fingertips that I could possibly want while traveling and meeting with family!

I am a senior kamaaina and like to go off island and visit Honolulu "The Big City" for three days every year. I am able to do that because of the "Lite" rates the Aqua group offers at the Pagoda Hotel. I take an early a.m. interisland flight for the first night and a late departure for the second night which gives me three full days to sightsee, shop, dine (my favorite place for dim sum, The Royal Garden, in the Ala Moana Hotel is actually walking distance). Next time I will not go to the expense of a rental car because of the hotel's proximity to public transportation, shuttle, trolley and taxi...avoiding car rental rates and $10 and up daily parking rates. Ala Moana Beach Park and Ala Moana shopping mall are all walking distance. I am comfortable in the least expensive of rooms. The rooms and furnishing are a little older but very clean. Microwave, coffee maker, small refrigerator and a window air-conditioner are in place and all worked very nicely. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. I was pleased for the security now in place with room and elevator access cards as well as uniformed security at the doors and in the parking lot immediate to the hotel entrance. Pagoda Restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner and, of course, the Food Court at the Ala Moana shopping center holds about 30 food concessions to meet every taste from A to Z.

In town for a wedding, and did not want to stay in Waikiki. Pagoda was perfect. Near shopping and restaurants. Reasonably priced. Clean, spacious room in main tower, end of the hallway. Good AC. New flat screen tv. In room fridge, coffee, iron, ironing board, blow dryer. Key card elevator and floor access. Complimentary newspaper. Friendly front desk personnel. Would've been perfect if the towels were thicker and softer, and the parking ($10 daily) was more convenient. Will definitely return.

I had been a while since we stayed at Pagoda since there were other hotels in Waikiki closer. We missed the friendly service & hospitality of the people at Pagoda. You actually feel like you are at home...the renovations & upgrades are amazing!!! Will definitely be back again!!!!

Clean, adequate and comfy those are the words to describe the room I had in the tower attached to the lobby. The view was mauka (mountain) on the 7th floor. Unfortunately, with all the nearby businesses needing daily trash pick up, I was awakened each morning about 5am. I will ask for the other side of the building if I stay there another time to see if there are less truck noises on that side. The light bulbs in the bathroom are a bit dim after the bright lights in the main room, but your eyes adjust easily. The water pressure is good and the hot water shows up very speedily for the height in the building. I chose to use cabs to get around to my appointments. There's one usually outside of the lobby on Rycroft. Or you can call for other taxi services.Earlier this year I stayed at a nearby 'top' hotel. This option is a much better value! The attached restaurant is available for all meals, including an island-famous buffet on the weekend evenings. Will review that separately.

Stayed in the main tower (not the Terrace) and loved the room. It was clean and pretty spacious. The price was also pretty reasonable. I stayed at the Ala Moana the day before. It was about $60.00 more and the room was smaller.

I recently stayed at the Pagoda Hotel and it was very clean, quiet, nice, large room, comfortable bed, and convenient walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Walmart, and Ross. I recommend it to anyone who values convenience, great price, and cleanliness.

Pagoda used to be the hotel of choice for kamaaina's visiting from another island, but it was beginning to show its age. Now under new ownership and management, it is really a great place to stay. I hear they are still making more modernization changes, which will be great. For the price, it is a great value, and I rather save my money to spend on other things. We will be back!

Happy to report that the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu is a great bargain. We stayedin a deluxe room which had been recently renovated . It was clean and well appointedwith coffee maker,microwave, toaster, refrigerator ,and even a safe! The rates were very reasonable and the staff was hospitable and efficient. We will return!

The Pagoda is truly "no ka oi" (the best!) place to stay on Oahu. The Pagoda ohana radiates the Aloha spirit through its welcoming, friendly, humble, responsive and kind ways. Accommodations: clean rooms, excellent housekeeping services, secured elevator access restricted to guests, reasonable parking ratesAmenities: microwave, good size compact refrigerator, very cold A/C, handy bar sink in the bedroom, HDTV, Wifi, free ice (ground floor), swimming pool, award-winning Pagoda RestaurantLocation: walking distance to many establishments including 24-hour stores (e.g., Walmart, Don Quijote), Starbucks, Ala Moana Shopping Center, beaches, trolleys, restaurantsThe Pagoda Hotel is one of the best kept secrets on Oahu.

review_body: The room and service surpassed our expectations! The front desk personnel were so friendly and helpful explaining things when we checked in and also when we needed something from housekeeping after hours. We will definitely stay here again!

Hotels.com booked me with another hotel due to their misinformation and then redirected myself to Pagoda (who is pet friendly)Hotel. With the stress of driving around to a 2nd hotel and the inconvenience due to time - the staff at Pagoda were very accommodating, professional, supportive and a customer service of "kindness" that words can not express. An unpleasant situation occurred while at the hotel and ALL the staff deal with it immediately reassuring my safety and that they had a 0 tolerance. So even though it is not a 5* updated renovated hotel - the comfort and basic rooms combined with the staff made my stay pleasurable. I would like to thank Jasmyn (front desk), MeryKnoll (Mgr.), Daniel (Security) and Emyl (Technician) for all their help. Helen

Our stay at the Pagoda Hotel in Honolulu is always a pleasant one and this one was just as pleasant and we had an issues that the Hotel had brought to our attention and it actually happen and I am glad they let there hotel guess know when they check in. they are working on bettering there hotel and making it a safer place to stay. I will stay there again with my family.

review_body: This review is for the pagoda terrace only. I stayed here for two weeks because it was near the medical center where I was being seen. The room was very basic and could use a few upgrades but it was clean and came with a kitchenette which was nice because I did not have to eat out every night. The location was great and was with in walking distance to walmart, don Quixote, Ross, fast food and sit down restaurants. My husband and I particularly liked Asahi, which is a yummy local restaurant. We ate breakfast and dinner here. I'd recommend the fried rice and saimin!If you are a light sleeper I would reccomend purchasing a pair of earphones. My unit was on the parking lot side and at times it could get noisy and, like I said before, the hospital is near so you hear a lot of sirens.I also liked that there was a coin operated laundry facility on the floor I was staying on. (4th floor). It really came in handy for me since I was there for a long period of time.

I recently returned to the Pagoda Hotel for a brief stay while in Honolulu. Although it's not a luxurious hotel, I found the familiarity comforting... Checking in took a bit longer this visit-- the lobby was packed with people waiting for rooms. When I finally got to the front desk, Daniel took great care of me-- quick check-in, no hassle. Since he knows a lot about the area, he easily answered my questions regarding restaurants, cultural sites, and shopping.The room was rather simple, but having a fridge was very convenient...Unfortunately, the surrounding rooms were on the noisy side. All things considered, the hotel was quaint and the room was a bargain. I will definitely return, and would recommend this place to friends visiting Oahu.

Can you believe I was born and raised in Hilo, and had never stepped foot in this hotel? Over the years, I've heard MANY things, as this is where many locals stay while visiting Honolulu. For the most part, many say not to expect a whole lot, simply because it's an affordable place to rest your head. It's all about the location (which, after spending four days here, I will say CANNOT be beat!)You can imagine my concerns when I finally started to look at reviews (especially on TripAdvisor). Roach/ant infestations, horrible service, and old beds. Like many of the previous reviews mention, talking to friends and family about the Pagoda were met with sighs, side glances, and worst of all: silence.I'd heard a few good things about the renovations, and the location. So, rather than running away, I decided to wait and see. I booked a 4 day/3 night stay Tower room, room & car package for about $550-600... not a bad deal, if you ask me.Arriving at the Pagoda Hotel, we were met with a speedy, efficient check-in. I'm glad to say that both of the elevators in the Tower are now working (previous reviews say they were not at the time). Elevators DO require your key card... a good security measure.We drew our breaths as we opened our room door, wondering what we were in for. The rooms are okay. It was very obvious that the room we got was one of the renovated ones, as the walls were newly painted, the carpet seemed new, the bathroom was clean. I checked the beds and they felt brand-new/fresh. I wouldn't say the room was pristine-- you could tell that the wall paint was a layer over what was there before-- but the room was clean, and actually felt pretty comfortable. Very doable, and acceptable.A couple of weird things. We had a room with two double-sized beds. Next to one of them was a wall-sized mirror with a shelf and a sink. A sink next to a bed...? I can't imagine what kind of scenario they were thinking about when they were laying out the room. Yes, it's weird, but I will admit to using it once or twice. An odd convenience! lolSecond, the AC unit, while new, emitted a weird "milky" smell. We observed that the smell only came out when it reached the set temperature and switched from AC to Fan mode. After catching a whiff of it the 3rd time we entered the room, we decided to do something about it. We went to Wal-Mart across the street (did I mention the location rocks???) and picked up one of those Febreeze car air fresheners that attaches to the AC vent. Worked like a charm!As far as ant/roach infestations... they were not existent during our stay, except for 3 tiny ants, which were immediately smooshed and tossed away.The biggest reason I would recommend Pagoda is the location. This is a PRIME spot for anyone who is anticipating a lot of shopping and moving around Honolulu. Ala Moana Shopping Center is 2-3 blocks (5-10 minute walk) away. Around the corner is the Don Quijote (not Quixote) store, where they have a bunch of outdoor eateries, and tons of Asian stuff. Across the street you have Wal-Mart and Sam's Club. I would highly- HIGHLY recommend checking out Likelike Drive-In. They have a good menu, their prices are right, and their service is on it. We ended up eating there more times than any other place during our stay.In the end, I was fairly happy with our stay here. The room, while I can't say it was flawless, was acceptable and comfortable enough. And, I think I forgot to mention the location is awesome.

The hotel was not what my family and I expected. However, you have to keep in mind, you get what you pay for. The check-in process was smooth and the agents were friendly and very helpful in making suggestions with shopping destinations and activities that would keep the kids entertained. The room, was another story. It was horrible. No matter the price, I could not subject my family to those conditions for 5 days. I called down to the front desk and spoke to Daniel, he was very helpful and understanding. He went out of his way to find my family a different room. He even helped us move. The new room was way better (and cleaner). We were able to really enjoy our vacation thanks to the wonderful service that Daniel provided us.

I would mainly like to say thank you to Daniel at the front desk for taking the time to give us suggestions for both site seeing and restaurants. He was always so patient when giving us driving directions. Thanks again Daniel for showing us that true Aloha Spirit. I would have given the hotel an "Excellent" star rating, but it is time for a lot of renovations. A good start would be new beds!!!!!

Stayed at this Pagoda Hotel for 6 days this June 2013, and didn't enjoy a minute of it! The room we stayed in was a 2 bedroom kitchenette on the 3rd floor. The kitchen had ants galore! Stove took 10 to 15 minutes to heat up. Any food we brought there was attacked by these ants. There were pigeons nesting between the window jealousies and the screen, making all kinds of cooing noises all day & night long. Not to mention the problem of diseases and lice from these birds right by the kitchen window. There was a big dark wet stain on the carpeted floor in the main living room area uncleaned, also the smoke detector was hanging off the wall. We made complaints to the front desk, than couple of hours later a repairman came by and said the detector was working...but still hanging off the wall. Then our microwave started smoking, a repairman took the broken old one to the next room and exchanged it out with ours. After complains to the district manager, we received no compensation in any way, no apologies, he told us he tried calling and for us to call back. We did, left a message twice a month after the stay and also emailed him, sent him photos and still didn't get any response to the problems. We gave up phone tagging him and calling or emailing, we ain't getting no where with him. His name was Paul. What a ripoff and bad customer service from Pagoda Hotel. We wish we didn't even come to Honolulu to this place! There were also problems with children going in the elevators all soaking wet from the swimming pool, no noise control from all the loud people that were staying there. People smoking and hanging out by the main gate that leads to Rycroft Street fronting the hotel late at night. We were afraid to go out of our room once it got dark. Children running on all levels playing chase master. Never again!! Beware tourist and kamaaina, better to stay in Waikiki, better hotels there and service! I will send this review also to the BBB and State Health Department.

We had to stay at this hotel due to our apt was being fumigation. I was looking for a place to stay and the Pagoda has always been my go to place. And mainly of their kitchenette, I always like that in a hotel.and having kamaaina rates always help a local on a budget. The only thing I didn't like was the check in & out time. Too bad one is not able to check in and out when they wanted to. I would come back here again and recommend to my friends and family.
