review_body: My room was clean.Desk clerk friendly,anything that was wrong in the room.They fix or exchange.No peeling,hair or anything in the room.It was clean.No stained carpet.And everything,I needed was close by.Including Walmart 5 minutes walk.Ala Moana Center . Mcdonalds,Jack in the box and more.Taking my husband there.And the restaurant good food.Even has a pool ,not a big pool.Price reasonable.

The Pagado has been here for years. A local hotel off the beaten path of Waikiki. Close to Mall and other shops. The beach is a short walk. If you're on tight budget and need a place to crash, Room rates are reasonable. Then this is the place. It is old,still has window AC units.The Pagado Floating Restaurant is very nice. I love having breakfast here. Prices are reasonable. When the management does an upgrade, it will be very nice.

I booked a 1 bedroom room kitchenette online and the photos online of the rooms in the Terrace building are NOT accurate. I found hair and dirty sheets on 2 twins, the paint was peeling in the tub, the rubber non-slip grip for the tub was moldy, there were ants, a dirty stained carpet, dry yellow mildew stains on the cabinet doors in the kitchenette, and tiny mold specks on the box spring. I asked the bed sheets be changed and got new sheets (I hope), but it has a hole from a cigarette burn - totally tacky. I also got a $20 ticket when I parked the rental in the parking lot behind the check-in counter marked reserved for hotel guests. This was terrible because in the 10 minutes I spent checking in and in the process of getting a parking pass, I got a ticket. The TV also turns off and on randomly after an hour or so, and resets to the main menu screen. I wish I had known what I was getting into. The tub is unacceptable for use with an infant because there is pain chipping off and I have never stayed in a hotel with such conditions. The AC in the bedroom is good, but the AC in the living room is extremely loud to the point where sleeping soundly will not happen. My mom is helping me look for a more suitable hotel for my wedding guests because this is just ridiculous and kind of embarrassing. I recommend spending that extra $20-40 to stay at a better hotel elsewhere. I have stayed in economy/budget European hostels to Super 8 motels to even a scary Holiday Inn in Oakland, CA with cleaner, safer accommodations.

I'm disappointed in the cleanliness of the rooms. 1st bad exp. Was cockroaches dead all over the floor. That was the building across the front desk bldg. Seen about 10 of them as soon as I entered. Next was the security door (same bldg), couldn't open it from the eastern door which wasn't that big of a deal. Recently stayed there and got bit by something all over my body! My whole body is itching and I got blisters on most of the bites. I must have over 50 bites and I'm embarrassed to go out in public! I left an email letting them know about my situation and to bug spray the whole room, but haven't got a response. The hotel is very old so I guess it happens, but I'm sure they could fix the problem. The location is very good. Convenience store next to the front desk, 24 hr Korean restaurant across the street w/a sushi bar, karaoke room across, many restaurants near by, walmart and Sams club walking distance, Ross a block away, ala moana shopping center walking distance, beach about 20 minutes walk, local /asian 24 hr restaurant few minutes away, and so on.If you need a cheap place, then this is one of the cheaper places to stay, but beware of the cleanliness!

Booked a room here because of a function that I knew was getting out late. It was way better than what I experienced years ago. First, their elevators were completely modernized and has that key-card security feature that I absolutely loved. Second, I was given a room on the 12th floor which was totally refurbished. Loved the splash of color on one of the wall, and the way the beds were set up. Lastly, it's great to see that a hotel who's been around for about 50 years is finally getting the upgrades it truly needs. The only thing I think I really didn't enjoy about this stay and kept me from giving a 5 star is the bed. I'm very particular about my bed and it wasn't the best sleep I had in a hotel and I travel a lot. Please change the type of bed you put in the rooms. But aside from that keep up the good work on beautifying the Pagoda!

The hotel was kind of what you would expect to get for the price you pay but I had ants crawling around in my bathroom which was a bit disturbing making me wonder what else might have been crawling around.

We've stayed at this hotel on several occasions. This hotel was the most affordable during our time of travel and we chose to stay there on this trip. I was very impressed on some of the room renovations; new clean A.C. unit, new carpet, new tile at entrance, new paint, new and brighter linens, and new interior in the elevator. The outer, lobby, pool, and hallways were still run down, but the hotel was still under renovation. The other downfall is that additional parking is located across the street (you can only park on levels 4 and up due to the other levels belonging to Ross customers). Location is great as there are several great shops and restaurants around (Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ross, Wal Mart, Kick'n Kajin, Yogurstory, Starbucks, Jumba Juice, etc.

We stayed on the Terrace side of the Pagoda hotel for 20 days while doing a job in Honolulu. It was the most inexpensive place the company could find during high tourist season. The rooms were very old. Paint, carpet and furniture was showing its age. All the appliances worked. The staff at the hotel (especially housekeeping) tried to do the best they could with the run down state of the facility. We saw a few ants every day and only one roach. The pest control contactor was in once while we were there. The pictures do not represent the state of maintenance that you will find. It was a place to sleep and eat, not much more.

The reviews and pictures of the hotels did not represent what our room looked like at all...when we first entered our room we were both shocked at the run-down carpet with major wrinkles, majorly damaged furniture, creaking air conditioner, bad smell, antiquated wiring, and obvious decades-old paint. When we requested another room we were offered another room in the same complex which would not have improved our experience and we were unable to find another hotel within our budget with available rooms for our 8 day stay. We were inundated by numerous insects including cockroaches, the shower ran first boiling hot then freezing cold water throughout the experience, the room smelled terrible, the windows did not close completely and we could near people talking as if they were in our room and when they smoke outside it entered our room, there was mold growing in the bathroom, cracks in the linoleum, and housekeeping did a very poor job of cleaning our room. Even though were were "compensated" by not being charged for parking during our stay, I would never recommend nor stay at this hotel again if I were to visit Oahu again. We actually worked hard to spend time away from the room as we hated being in it but felt very stuck, and did not feel safe there due to the type of people who were hanging around the hotel. The elevaters were out several days and we had to walk a long distance to the only other one in the building and the second day we were there they left a note that exterminators would be entering our room in the morning and that we had to vacate our room.

I am usually one of those people that will give an establishment the benefit of the doubt. Even after reading some not so great reviews about this hotel, I decided to give the Pagoda a try after comparing the rates to other hotels and not wanting to be stuck in the middle of Waikiki. I thought that since we would be on vacation and be out and about - we basically needed a clean & safe place to sleep. We arrived late at night and the parking situation was terrible. Front desk staff was not at all friendly as I am accustomed to with most businesses in Hawaii. Each shift had conflicting information about the parking. Although Wal-Mart was close by the immediate area around the Pagoda did not feel safe and there were suspicious individuals loitering in parked vehicles outside the hotel which made me feel like they were in the middle of a drug deal. The rooms were old, smelled funny, and upon our arrival there was a note asking for our cooperation to let workers in our room the following day to "treat for cockroaches". When we called housekeeping to inquire what type of treatment and who would be doing it, they informed us that the company contracted would be spraying in the "corners" and would be unescorted. We put up the "do not disturb" sign because we did not want out personal belongings to be affected. The room door did not have any type of security latch or deadbolt. I ended up having to buy Clorox wipes at Wal-Mart because the toilet did not look clean and even had hair on it. We slept on top of the covers as even the sheets didn't seem clean. We did not feel safe in the room whatsoever. The one good thing was it was quiet and there was no outside noise other than the trash truck which comes way too early. Like other reviews, there was still only one, very small, working elevator so my family decided to use the stairs which smelled of urine and we practically ran down because it too looked like it was out of the scene of some horror movie. We ended up using the elevator for the duration of our stay there but it was always a long wait. The internet and staff will tell you that you need a room key to access the elevator. This is NOT true whatsoever. Anybody can enter the hotel and use the elevator - there are no security measures or swipe machine. My children are so embarrassed to tell people where we stayed for vacation. Lastly, when informing friends or relatives in Hawaii where we would be staying, their initial response was that we should find another hotel!! I have stayed at Ilikai, Hilton, Ihilani, Best Western, Maile Sky Court, Pearl Harbor & Tripler Lodging and a place in Kaneohe so I do have a frame of reference to make comparison.

My family and I stayed at the Terrace in Room No. 409, from July 14 to 18, 2013. When I checked in at the front desk I was told that even if I use my credit card to pay for our room, that we would have to pay up front for the whole bill. I asked the clerk at the front desk if this is their new policy and she said it was and that at the behest of the management, they would have to enforce it. This is not only asinine it is different from other hotels I have stayed at. During our stay, the elevator on the east side of the building was not working a couple of times. We had to walk all the way to the other side of the building in order to use the other elevator. The room was supposed to have utensils including knives. I called the front desk to ask for knives but we never did get any until we left. The Terrace was full of people who were not only seeming under the influence, they were not necessarily people whom you wanted to invite to your Sunday picnic. The attitude of the people at the front desk especially males need major "renovation" just like their hotel. They were rude and uncooperative. This is so different from the usual and ubiquitous Aloha spirit that Hawaii is known for every day. They should not be working at a visitor industry, or they need major, major training in customer services.My overall review of the hotel is that the daily rate is a bit too high for the quality of service they have plus the Terrace side of the hotel is very old and need a major big time renovation. I would not recommend this hotel.Yoichi

Great location, clean rooms with A/C, mini fridge and coffee pot all at a moderate price. We stayed in the tower portion of the hotel and it did have Wi-Fi as well. The best part for us was in the morning we went down to the Floating Restaurant for breakfast and not only was it beautiful, but the prices were great! Later, the groundskeepers gave us food to feed the huge Koi fish in the waters surrounding the restaurant and we took pictures of us in front of the waterfall. Very relaxing. We will be back!

AlaMoana shopping center is about 3 blocks away. Walmart and Ross within 1 block. So plenty of shopping!The hotel is pretty non-discrip but it is safe and clean. A nice bonus is the in room mini fridge, microwave and coffee pot.  All the money saved on room cost can now be spent shopping!

I booked the Pagoda based on a friends recommendation from Maui. I usually stay on Waikiki and of course it is lovely to wake up on the beach however I found the Pagoda to be a pleasant surprise. It is conveniently located, reasonably priced, with a friendly helpful staff. Somehow I was given an upgraded room on the 8th floor so street noise was no issue and the bed was super comfy. I slept great. One disappointment was the towels were scratchy. They could use bigger, nicer, softer towels. To access internet you must pay $9. that I think they could just invest in a good wi-fi system for the entire hotel. Little things make a difference however for the price, you cannot beat the Pagoda. The Pagoda Floating Restaurant next door has a fantastic buffet with King Crab legs, poke, salads, vegetables, and desserts. The servers were super nice and I enjoyed the entire experience.

The hotel was priced within my range of places to stay and close to the freeway. Upon arriving I noticed no entry way parking to unload baggage. Across the street is a parking garage where the 4th through 6th are reserved for hotel guests. I discover after checking in WiFi isn't available and they charge for internet hookup and parking garage. After negotiating I got that cost down. The room was clean with twin beds, wide screen TV and included a moldy smell from the AC. Seems the hotel maintenance staff does not understand the concept of preventive maintenance. A few dryer sheets purchased from the Walmart conveniently across the street solved that problem. The Pagoda restauraunt does not have continental breakfast and the cost is what you would expect from a iHop. Supper is expensive and consists of exotic fish plates. Good luck if all you want is a simple meal.  Overall the experience wasn't all bad. The staff were very friendly and tried to work with us as much as possible to make our stay comfortable. It is one of the oldest hotels on the island and the owner is in the process of upgrading the rooms. For the cost it's OK but needs major improvements especially in the maintenance of the rooms, parking, networking and restaurant meal choises.

Handy to ala moana shopping center. A bit of a homeless hang out area. We had a noisy window air conditioner. Had a coffee maker and one free serving of coffee, the room was a nice size. a bit musty smell.The restaurant had large breakfasts. I ordered toast and it was half cooked. My friend ordered extra toasty English muffin for eggs Benedict and it was not toasted, Surprisingly disappointing food from a 50 year old cafe. Beautiful fish ponds.

All the staff was friendly, helpful. Had a variety of guests from locals to foreigners. Pagoda restaurant was surrounded by coi (sic) canals and waterfals, very picturesque and the food was good. It was off the beaten path, but accessible to all the major tourist places of interest. Pagoda is probably the most economical hotel in Honolulu, yet the room was clean and spacious. The only downside was difficulty in getting internet.

The check in took way too long, but not a big deal. Upon receiving my key I went to the Pagoda Terrace room and entered the gate among a group of people lingering at the entrance smoking cigarettes. Upon entering the room it smelled strongly like cigarette smoke. The carpet had many burn marks and stains. The place is outdated and looks like they got their linens from a second hand store, the bed was rock hard and the pillows were like cardboard. There was graffiti on the closet door. Generally it was uncomfortable and disgusting. After one night, I left and checked into another hotel for the remainder of our stay.

We first got a 2 bedroom room, which turned out to be very dated, and rather run down, in a whole different section. When we requested, the staff moved us to 2 rooms in the main hotel, which was decent. Still could use some work, but a nice value for the money in Honolulu.

The Pagoda hotel is considered a "local" hotel meaning that many people from the neighboring islands consider it their home away from home. The rooms are clean, large, but spartan. People visiting relatives on Oahu generally stay here. It's near to the Ala Moana Shopping area, Walmart, Don Quijote (a Japanese chain department store) and a host of restaurants in the area. Minuses include only one working elevator (it's been out for about 3 months already), and you have to pay for parking, either in one of their lots or across the street at Ross' parking lot. Staff were attentive and polite and definitely try to work with what shortcomings the property may have. Rates are reasonable considering the cost of hotels in Waikiki, and the beach is not nearby but accessible. Better to have a car if you are staying at this hotel. I have used this hotel several times in the past year.

Firstly, the reason for our stay in Hawaii was for my parent's 20th anniversary celebration and ceremony. Checking into the hotel went smoothly until we reached our room, we booked the suite that had a king bed and 2 twin beds. The tower they put us in had chained up gates, the slowest elevators ever, and was very run down. The room that we received was even worst! There was such a big gap under the door that COCKROACHES were getting in. We woke up to find roaches all over our belongings and in our kitchen; sink and counters, and we were on the 2nd level of the tower too! When we went to complain about it and to move we found that those room types were only offered in that tower so we accept a SMALLER room in the main hotel. The biggest issue was that there wasn't enough room to accommodate all guests. Since we paid through a 3rd party they weren't able to financially accommodate our stay but did waive our parking fees; 2 vehicles, which we did appreciate but what we really needed was another room so that we didn't have anyone sleeping on the floors but we had to pay for another room! We didn't come on this vacation to try and cause trouble at the hotel and give a hard time or to get anything for free, this trip had become so uncomfortable for my family and especially my parents. It was very hard coming back to the hotel at the end of the day because we were so unhappy. Even after speaking to manager all they could offer was another room in the same tower that we had bug issues (among other issues), a smaller room in a different tower and to waive our parking fees. Even simple requests such as extra towels were a hassle, it would take over 30 minutes each time we requested for any. Now maybe they're understaffed, but when being told they are on their way I would expect them in the next 5-10 minutes, it was just very inconvenient. It's sad to say but I unfortunately would not stay here again, and the main reason being is that these issues were not simple fixes and they were not handled properly; I work for a hotel and the service that was provided does not compare to the service that COULD have been provided.

This is an old, dated hotel; it is also an institution among islanders with large families staying in Honolulu. I suppose it is possible to stay in the Waikiki Hotels with 6 family members, but not for less than $200 a night. My daughter stayed in a nice hotel, before we arrived and it was almost $200, just for the 2 of them. So yes, the carpets, bedspreads, and general ambiance is dated, and you pay for WiFI, EVEN IN THE LOBBY but the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, parking is only $10 a day, the location is convenient, and the price is right. I will always stay here while visiting Honolulu.

I stayed at the Pagoda for 2 days and encountered a few things that were not up to par. Upon checkin the fridge was not cold/not working. Had to call Front desk to get it replaced with another fridge that worked. The Hotel had 2 elevators but only 1 worked. The other elevator was "Out of Order" which was such a inconvenience, especially when exiting and entering with your luggage. Had to wait a few times for the elevator to return to my floor, as it was full with hotel guests. I had requested a microwave at checkin to be delivered to my room and was told by Housekeeping there weren't any available and I would have it delivered the next day. I never go the microwave. I had to go to the Front desk to heat up my food & beverage. Another inconvenience.

I stayed at the Pagoda twice within the last month, needing an inexpensive night before catching a flight to Asia. My room was decent. The carpeting was kind of worn in spots. There seemed to be some mildew in the tub/shower. The room's air conditioner is rather noisy and isn't completely sealed so that outside noises were very noticeable. One night they were doing roadwork outside with a jackhammer. Another complaint I have is that they don't seem to have any "real" queen or king size beds. They say there rooms are two queens but the are more like double bed sizes. Also, in two different rooms, both tv's had trouble with the on/off switch on the remote. They have two elevators but both visits only one elevator was working. I guess you can't beat the price and location if you don't need the beach or Waikiki nearby.

So I would stay here again. But here is what you should know. Hotel very date. In lobby it says they are under renovations. Probably true since I witnessed them bringing up new matters's to the rooms. But maintenance is an issue. Grounds are full of litter. I watched a staff member clean the parking lot. He sure missed a lot of stuff lol. Some facts;One elevator is out if order. Long term guests (I think they live here sinc they say both elevators were out for a week or so and they had to use stairs) (this is a high rise with I think 13 floors). It is a pain waiting on one elevator when all the rooms are sold out. They are packed. Spider webs on light fixtures. With spiders attached. Pool is not heated, about the size of two very large spas. Parking very limited and $10 per night. Our room is strange, it has a sink next to the bed. Trashe scattered in employee only areas. No pride of ownernership. WiFi in lobby $10 per night (I think). I did not try hooking up, just sounded like a problem want to be so I used my phone the entire stay. Good things. Close to Walmart and Starbuck an other shopping. The area is hopping at night. Though I think it also gets working girls if you know what I mean (I observed two very nicely dressed laidies negotiating with two men at 6am going to the Starbucks. When I turned around they were all gone. Only one car in the entire street, lol). Water pressure good, water always hot in shower. Priced for room was good about $100 per night. That is about itOverall I felt safe and had no problems. This is just a place for me to sleep and move on out to other places to enjoy. Will add a few photos to show you my observations.

We stayed here for 3 days for Pearl Harbor. Pros... I liked the Kitchenette,(no roaches) everything works and the refrigerator was big, not just your average room cooler. and the rooms were spacious. Excellent location for shopping. Walmart within walking distance, and Walgreens and other food eateries. CONS...Run down. Back Breaker Beds, No pictures, and the bathroom floors buckled, almost cave in, they came in to check, so they knew about the floor in the bathroom when asked to move they said they did not have availability. The way to spot the building is look for the building that has mold on the outside, it is the oldest looking building on the street.

Santa Rosa, California, United States

review_body: I recommend this hotel for an average price with a little distance from the ocean. This hotel have good food, nice pool, excellent staff, and a restaurant that is surrounded by a fish pool. It is a nice hotel to talk about with a Hawaiian clothes store across the street.

First of all, while the furniture, facilities, carpet, etc. are tired and worn, the service, housekeeping, a Corazon in particular, was excellent. You cannot beat the location either if you want to be away from the Waikiki tourist trap. Everything else is what you should expect given how much you paid. My only complaint was that they had 2 elevators and one never worked the three days I was there. The other one was working but they decide to work on it one day so at the time there was no elevator service and guests had to walk up and down up to twelve flights of stairs! They are trying to improve as the elevator work they were doing was to upgrade its security features. I would have given them a two-rating, but when I complained to the management I promptly received a response and apology from the manager. The immediate attention paid to my review is impressive and unexpected. I hope they can maintain their improvement as there is potential to this property. I look forward to their continued efforts to upgrade the hotel and would definitely try them again.

Requested a room with one queen bed as it was the wife and I. Upon arrival we have two twin beds and were told it was just a request. Poor staff, everyones a "manager" no one willing to work with you. The only and I mean oly plus was the parking is by far the least in the area @ $10.00 nightly. But to be honest I think next time I'd rather sleep in my car!!

Location: It's close to everything! Walking distance to Ala Moana, Ross, Walmart, FHB,...everything which was perfect! Waikiki isn't far away either. Employees: From the check-in staff, to the housekeepers, maintenance, and check-out staff, all were friendly, very helpful, and concerned about our comfort and willing to resolve any issues. Restaurant: I'm pretty sure they still have the buffet style for dinner so I recommend that because looking around they had lobster which looked delicious. We had the steak which was also very tasty so if you enjoy a meal being brought to you, it's still great here. The waiters are very friendly and joke around which gave off the aloha spirit. There was also two waiters during the breakfast hour that were fantastic at their jobs. They were on top of everything from getting our orders, bringing our food, and asking if anyone needed refills. Room amenities: There's the AC, mini refrigerator, flat screen TV, alarm clock, hair dryer, iron and iron board, telephone, and coffee maker...in the room. Internet access is available with computers and a printer down in the main lobby area you just have to put in a couple dollars/ or use a credit card. There's also a pool that goes to 6 feet deep if you want to relax by the water...otherwise like I said this hotel has easy access to everything which means that Kapiolani Beach Park is about a 5-10 minute walk through Ala Moana. Remember that this is the main Pagoda Hotel, not the terrace. When we first came one of the elevators was still undergoing maintenance but they switched the elevators and the one being used now is nice and fancy! It even speaks to you! lol Great upgrades going on at this hotel.

I understand that the bugs are impossible to kill and maybe we shouldn't have booked the kitchenette suite but when you come back from dinner, turn on the lights and see the bugs run there is something WRONG! I called the front desk 3 times about this and they said they'd come spray. At checkout I was told we could have been relocated into the main hotel instead. We would have done that if I had known. It is a great location but the roaches and ants have left a terrible impression!!

I reside on another island and have stayed at this hotel intermittently for the past 30 years. First the good. It is located in walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center, major shopping and countless eateries. Also close to big box stores such as Walmart, Ross for Less, etc. Employees are extremely friendly and courteous. The hotel is reasonably priced for Honolulu. Now the downside. Hotel was recently purchased and is undergoing renovation. The rooms are stark, at best, and haven't changed in decades. There was a distinct odor in the hallway, less pronounced in my room. Major negative, due to renovations, there is only one working elevator. Stairs are located at the far end of the hall. It was common for me to wait 10 - 15 minutes for the elevator only to find it jam packed, unless you're using it early morning or late evening. Per the sign posted, the elevator situation will continue for another two months. Thus, I would not even consider staying here until after June 1st. Even if the elevator is repaired, I would think twice or more about staying here again. Definitely consider staying here after all the renovations are completed.

We were stuck in Honolulu and were looking for a decient but cheaper room. This was scary how bad this room was. Dirty, smelled, with the sounds of drunk transients piling into the room all night long. Do not ever ever ever stay at this hotel. Horrid. Only exception is if they pay you to stay here, then maybe consider it......

I'm a former Honolulu resident who visits once every year or two, usually for about 3 weeks, and typically I'll spend half of that time at the Pagoda. There's no denying that the establishment shows its age and the rooms are fairly simple. During my stays, I've always found the staff to be friendly and helpful -- in fact they often go out of their way to offer me help before I ask. The location is what keeps me coming back. I don't want to be in Waikiki. I want to be close to shopping and the bus lines to other neighborhoods so I can easily visit my friends. The Pagoda is an easy walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ross, etc. There are also a number of eateries around besides the ones you'll find at the mall. Between the bus stops at the mall and those you'll find on other streets nearby, it's quite easy to get around.However, depending on where you stay, you do tend to get noise from outside. Between the Terrace and the Tower, I found the Tower to be a bit better in this regard. I got some noise from the pool area, but at least that closes at a reasonable hour. When I was in the Terrace, the noise from the parking lot never seemed to stop. It wasn't so much the loudness as it was the constant nature of it -- hard to sleep when someone is always outside talking.The rooms I've had were a good size and comfortable. I've never tried the Internet there and have no intention of doing so at the rate they charge. No in room safe, which is a bit of a negative to me. The beds were fine. The bathroom has both a tub and shower. Good pressure in the pipes, plenty of hot water. The air conditioner can be loud but at least that helps drown out the sound of voices from below.If you're looking for an affordable place outside of Waikiki, this isn't a bad bet. However, first time visitors to Hawaii might find this a bit of a letdown if they're looking for something more than a clean secure place to rest.

This is an older hotel but if you want to look for affordable, this was a fine place to stay. We needed 5 beds for our family with 3 college aged children. We got a corner unit with 2 bedrooms, a living space and a full kitchen.We didn't need all that space but was the only option to accommodate 5 beds. The place was mostly clean: carpet was old and maybe the vacuums were too - but it looked like the staff had done their best effort. Beds were very comfortable. Kitchen and bathroom were clean and there were enough towels for all of us. The staff were friendly and helpful. If you want to spend the extra $150 elsewhere, go ahead but we chose to spend it on food and surfing lessons! We probably wouldn't stay a whole week here, however. We headed to the north shore for the rest of the week.

Given the age of this hotel, I won't complain about it at all. So far I've enjoyed my stay here, except that I have to pay for my internet accessibility. What I would like to say, though, is the superb room service provided by one particular employee named Leonida who provides the best service of our room at the Pagoda Terrace. During the several weeks that I've stayed here, I can really tell if she is the one servicing our room because of the tidiness she leaves behind. Our restroom, mini kitchen, floor, and bed are neatly cleaned or made. Thank you Nida.

This hotel was so worn out from inside to outside. The lobby got no air-conditioning and the setting looked like those in the 70s. The elevator looked so old. The room carpet had a dirty green colour. The air-conditioner, mounted on the window below an adult's eye-level, was very noisy. The room door, bath tub and sink were full of scratches. The most ridiculous thing was, there was a big mirror and sink (not working) right next to the bed in the room. Apparently, the management had removed a picture from the wall -- don't deny, there was a big stain on the wall. The room got no desk. Internet? Plug in Ethernet cable only! Funny thing was, I paid $10 for Internet at check-in desk, the lady gave me a password, but when I got connected, the log in page only asked me for credit card info, no prompt for entering password. As expected, I got charged twice for Internet and had to talk to the staff for a refund. Parking was outside of the building, a 2-minute walk, $10 for 24-hour parking. The hotel location was very good though. The Korean grill restaurant right across the road was very good. There were many Korean or Thai restaurants within five minutes walk. There was a Walmart within 3-minute walk. Next time, I would pay more and stay elsewhere.

Run away from this place! The images on their site are completely deceptive. The giant pool? Less than 4 feet across. The rooms are disgusting. Burns on the carpet, holes in the bed, and barely working amenities. The street noise is so loud you wonder if there is even glass in the windows. And to top it all off, they charge an insane $12/ day for their wired Internet. I can only hope that the Aqua group of hotels that owns them will do the right thing and burn the place to the ground.The guest parking lot requires you to go through the back door, between two dumpsters. It is also not handicap friendly as you have to go down a flight of stairs. The elevator in the building barely works. If it actually makes it to your floor, it takes you twice as long to arrive at your destination than if you took the stairs.The constant presence of drunks, homeless people and police around the building makes you afraid to leave the room.We lasted exactly one night before cancelling the rest of our reservation.

You know those public bathrooms you walk into and don't want to touch anything in? I have stayed at hundreds of hotels in my life. None get the prize for the worst hotel compared to the Pagoda in Honolulu. Forget the cheap rates. Absolutely scratch it off your list! Sure, the front desk employees were friendly, but so is everyone in Hawaii. The rumpled carpet, broken A/C,duct tape on mattress, torn curtains, junk in the tub, and street noise is enough to drive you kookoo. All I need is a clean place to sleep. I don't ask for sketchy people loitering outside of the hotel and in the elevators. I don't need to hear people at 7am sweeping the parking lot (you know the windows are old if you can hear someone pushing a broom). And I sure don't ever need to stay here again. I worried all night that bed bugs were crawling underneath me...never again will I stay here! The place needs to be torn down and re-built completely.

Stayed here for 6 days in a 2 bedroom with kitchenette. The hotel is old and so as the furniture, beddings, towels, tv, air condition, etc. Our room was at the end of the U shaped structure building and so our windows at the bedroom facing a street and the kitchen/living room faced another street and so theres a lot of noise especially that windows were fitted with jalousies. One time they were cleaning or changing the water at the koi pond that they were using a water pump just imagine the noise of that for like 2-3 hours..However, you get what you paid for considering the price of the room here compared to the 4 star hotels which is 2 to 3 times higher. For just basic clean room to go back to from all day adventure on the island was good enough, and for the next vacation, definitely a different hotel!

we stayed at Pagoda Hotel for two years in a row. its an older hotel and renovations in progress. We were actuallymthee for medical reasons. Staff very accomodating and service is great. last year in April of 2012, i made reservations for our stay and upon arrival we were greeted by hotel staff. I would like to,thank the front desk manager for upgrading our room from a studio to a one bedroom with kitchenette. i will be back again this year and i would like to rent the same one bedroom with kitchenette.

Me and my family picked this hotel cause it looked great on the website and it was affordable... When we got here it looked nice at first and than we got to our hotel room... It smelled horrible. We couldnt even walk on the floor without shoes cause the floor was so gross. The bathroom was small and had ants in it. When we took a shower and the tub was clogged and wouldn't drain. Found a cockroach in our room. And to top it all off people were partying around us and were loud all night.. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed at the Pagoda for three nights.It is an older hotel and renovations are in progress in various places. Everything in our room was clean and comfortable. Having a fridge and microwave was very convenient for us.We were able to buy food at the Walmart just around the corner from the hotel. The Ala Moana mall and beach/ park are within walking distance. Staff are very friendly and make guests feel welcome. The rate for a room with kitchenette was about one hundred dollars, which is a great deal for Honolulu.

The Pagoda is a nice hotel in a great location. If you want to get away from the crowded Waikiki streets, stay here. Or room on the tenth floor was very clean, didn't smell and everything worked. The service is great, as well. You are always greeted by the staff. You are close to all of the major bus stops and only a fifteen minute walk from Waikiki. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again. We were there for two weeks.

review_body: We stayed in the one bedroom with kitchenette. The room was huge, and the price was good. In order for that to happen, pretty much everything else gets compromised. Furniture is crappy, there is cracked, stained linoleum in the bathroom, the towels are thin and scratchy, the corridor smelled funny, etc. However, if what you want is an clean enough economical place to stay with room for a bunch of people, then this fits the bill. The restaurant was fun with the gardens and koi. The food is OK quality but kind of expensive. Room service was one of the extras I missed -- with time differences and jet lag it would have been very nice to get a meal or two delivered.I usually stay in nicer hotels and found the compromises a bit frustrating. But hey, it's a perfectly fair value for the price, and made an expensive vacation closer to affordable. Those nicer hotels are going to be two or three times the cost of this place. If you understand what you're getting into and value economy and space, it's a good choice.

This is the old,old hotel for locals to stay. There are renovations ongoing and it is convenient to Ala Moana shopping center. The bus terminal is at the center so most of Oahu is at your finger tips. The resturant was closed for breakfast. This used to be a good morning treat and we disappointed .street noise is minimal and they do have a small pool on site. Rooms are minimal and have aged but ours was clean. Prices are moderate for Waikaki. I will stay again.

review_body: stay away ! ever since the current corp. owner took over, approximately 4 years ago, Pagoda has slide to the bottom. the response from management consistently rebuffed any mention of an issue. the stained carpet, broken furniture, filthy bathrooms, and smell that would make a person choke. new management kept telling me that improvements were being made. not so. i am in Hawaii quite often for family. i now stay at the Ala Moana Hotel.

Well i booked this hotel at last minute ,im thankful there was availability. The location is good next to like like drive inn and a few blocks away from Ala Mona Mall. Only thing i did not like was outside noise from the room i could hear everthing going on at street level and i was on the 8th floor. beside that a good stay.

we ( 3 adults me, my daughter and her boyfriend) stayed for 12 days at the pagoda terrace hotel in a 2 bedroom +kitchenette roomthe room has a very good space and woul easily accomodate 5 persons .Kitchen and "living room"are good for breakfast and some fast food meal , has rice cooker,cofeemaker,microvawe,refrigerator,full suplie of tableware and dishes.very good localization, walking distance from Alamoana shopping/wallmart/Ross and even if you like to walk, Waikiki beach.bad points: as we arrived the room had a strong smell of fish ( probably from the previous guest)and it took almost a week and lots or room spray to feel ok.it do needs renovation ( they said they were renovating the hotel and this room definatelly would need it) elevator didn't work properly 2 evenings in a row.( or it was turned off)I found a roach in the bathroom and I do killed it with my flip flop.but it stayed at the wall for 2 days till we removed it .( cleaning of the room was average)even though the parking is paid separately, we have received 2 parking tickets : one for parking at a wrong spot ( we were told to park in the parking building werever we wanted ) and the second one because the parking "voucher"was not properly placed ( we did not removed it the 12 days we stayed there) both ticket were voided after we went to the parking office ( at least i hope they did) because at the front desk I was told that they could not help and that I had to go to the parking office.Wifi not available ( only ethernet cable) and is collected separetely as well as the parking ( Thanks God I took my laptop with me)They charge .75 for local calls even if you dial a 1-800 numberI did not used the pool or any other hotel facilities.

We traveled to Hawaii the first time in 2011 as a couple, then in 2012 decided to take the family. The first time we stayed in Aqua Wave Hotel which was nice. When booking the hotel we thought that we did not need a nice place, all we need is a place to sleep, and shower, after all we would be out and about all the time so wasting money on a nicer hotel seemed ridiculous. Plus the pictures made it seem like a rather nice place. Boy where we ever wrong, this is just horrible. You cannot imagine how bad this hotel is! Every morning, yes EVERY morning even Sunday, garbage trucks made very loud banging sounds while picking up the large medal garbage containers on the street. This happened from 2:30am - around 6:00am, our guys usually sleep like rocks but even they woke up. We traveled with a young couple and their baby could not sleep at all, so they transferred to the Aston on the beach in Waikiki and paid $300 more, I wish we would have done the same. Rooms, filthy, stinky, moldy, beds uncomfortable, the halls are not even painted, cracks at the seams in the drywall, my garage has a better interior. The AC units have large gaps around as they are the "in window" type, ours almost fell out. The window opened and closed like a shutter blind which let in a-lot of sound at night as previously mentioned. Bathrooms are dirty, tile was cracked and peeling off, the bathroom doors had gaps in them which you could clearly see into the bathroom if someone opened the door to the hall. Also when we where the they were doing renovations and starting at 7:00am they were drilling and hammering outside and it sounded like it was in your room! Pool was also closed.This hotel also is NOT structurally sound! Call me insane but when I placed my coffee on the table it was not level, so out of curiosity I went into the WalMart next door, purchased a small level and to my surprise parts of the floor where almost 3/8" off level, the walls and ceiling are also not level. I don't know who their inspector , but here in Cali those structural problems would have them shut down for sure. This hotel is for the "hourly" people only, this is not a Hotel to say with a couple or family.The Pagoda Restaurant has bad food too, at high prices, not nearly as horrible as the hotel but we went in for breakfast it tasted stale and wasn't fresh, even our toast tasted off :/ There is a McDonald's & Denny's in walking distance if you want a better breakfast. In conclusion, I would say cancel your Beach-side Steakhouse reservations and pay the few hundred dollars more for a nicer place. You can actually get a nicer hotel for a mere $30 more than this. Just stay away.

Great location - very close to conference center, shopping and beach but needs painting, better decorating and upgrading the bathroom.Nice staff, clean rooms. Nothing special but overpriced - like all hotels at this time of the year.

Stay away from this hotel! Their prices are incredibly high for what it is! It makes a motel 6 look like a 5 star hotel. We were actually upgraded to a better room and it was a total disappointment! It was old, smelled like feet, had no wifi and charged $10 for using cable internet, it was very noisy, and the shower had sudden and unpredictable bursts of scorching hot water. For the price, you can have a much better deal in a hotel that's in a nicer area of Waikiki and with far better service! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!

I stayed at Pagoda for a day and it was ok. The staff were very accommodating. They answered all the questions I had and even recommended a couple of places they thought would interest me. The room itself is not too special. It is not a flash room but serves its purpose. The only problem I had was the air-conditioner which was a little noisy but that did not bother me too much. The thing I really liked was the size of the room. Compared to other rooms I have seen in Hawaii, this room was pretty large. Also, on the day that I checked out, the hotel stored my luggage until my evening flight. So overall I was happy with the service I got for my money. Don't go with very high expectations and you will be fine.

The Pagoda Hotel is suddenly charging astronomical rates for their rooms. We planned to come to Oahu in January/Feb. 2013 for the Chinese New Year but the rates are now $139-159/night. Typically, they average $79/night or less. Who can afford these new rates? The Pagoda Hotel has traditionally been a hotel that caters to the local community, including people that live in Hawaii and those that were born there and return to visit. Now, the Pagoda is charging exhorbitant prices like Waikiki! It's a 2-star hotel, not an exquisite 5-star hotel. Improvements have been made, but they're not of the magnitude which would justify these new prices. We like the hotel and have stayed there many times before, but we may actually cancel our trip to Hawaii because of this. Wake up, management. You're about to lose the very people that have supported the Pagoda all these years! Why don't you at least offer the cheaper rates for elderly people who were born in Hawaii and are returning to visit?

We got this place because we needed a cheap place to stay for Our last night! To start, the rooms are nasty looking. There is a date on the mattresses written on the side that say 1995. review_body: Our stay was12/10/12-12/12/12 and I believe we stayed in rm 353. Our rate was $79 a night. If you are looking for something very affordable in Honolulu, look no further. If you are really picky and can't handle the dated 'ness' and the current remodelling of this property then save up some more money and look elsewhere. We were staying two nights en route from the mainland to Australia. It was clean comfortable and basic. The bed wasn't the best but I have a bad back. They are currently renovating the outside. The staff are pleasant. They have Wi-fi for $10 a day but is incredibly slow and uses the same company all the surrounding motels use for internet access. Also there is no access in the laundry room (2 washers and 2 dryers). Dryers are 25c for 10mins, washes are $1.25 ea, one use boxes of tide are $1... I spent about $5 per load of laundry. Quarters are available from the front desk. There is a small convenience store in the building. Parking is $10 a day. A shopping centre with Walmart & Sams Club is just two blocks up the road. There is a coffee maker in the room. There is also a mini-fridge.

We stayed at the Pagoda from 12/07/2012-12/11/12, we had a great experience with the room, we requested a nice clean room before our arrival because of all the reviews i read, but when we arrived at the hotel we were greated by warm spirited front office staff, the room was nice, clean, bed was soft. We didn't spend much time in the room of course because of other great things to do in the city! great location though!

For local residents of Hawaii, this hotel ranks as one of the favorites. It has been around for a long time and return visitors know what they will get for their money. It is conveniently located in walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and Ala Moana Beach Park. It's location makes it the gateway to Waikiki, but visitors must take a bus or drive into Waikiki.Although the Hotel claims to have remodeled the room that we stayed it, there appeared to be minimal changes. It still had that well lived in looked that was both welcoming, but not fancy. The only problem was that during my five day stay, only one elevator was working. Lines were frequent, but for a mostly patient and understanding crowd. Front desk personnel as well as housekeeping are friendly and helpful. They are very accommodating. You can get a special rate if you are from another island and on Oahu for medical reasons. You need to inquire at the front desk. Late check out is available. The restaurant is popular with the local crowd...prices are reasonable. For a short stay to do shopping at Ala Moana and Walmart, it can't be beat. Parking is available for a fee. You could stay here without renting a car, but unless bus travel and waiting for the next bus is your thing, then i would advise against it.A stay here won't break the bank, but don't expect 4 star service.

This was my second stay in the Pagoda. It's an excellent low price hotel, giving very good quality for the dollar. The Pagoda is also very well located. Ala Moana is just blocks away but the neighborhood is not the slightest bit touristy. My room was large, bright and clean, though there were quite a number of broken or rusty things. The TV was nearly antique! The A/C thermostat turned off both the fan and cooling leaving the room silent. Then it cycled back on with a big swoosh! Fortunately I'm a sound sleeper. The bath was sparkling, much nicer than expected at this price. The public spaces, the dark halls and the outside had a run down feeling. The management said a major renovation and complete painting were in process. The much ballyhooed Koi ponds were a let down. The Pagoda is my hotel of choice in Honolulu when my brother's home is full.

We selected this hotel because of its location. Only 5 minutes to Ala Moana Shopping Center,2 minutes to Walmart, Walgreen,Ross stores. There are many small ethnic restaurants within 4 blocks of this hotel, The best Japanese Sushi restaurant,called "Sasabune" is 4 minutes walk from here. Sasabune's dinner for 2 was equivalent to 2 nights hotel here. Pagoda employees the best people, friendly and efficient. Housekeepking staff are hard working people. It is a very Basic hotel but Clean. We liked the big Korean Restaurant across the street as they are open 24 hours and menu selection is large and food delicious. Good idea for travellers suffering from different time zone. Pagoda room (Terrace section) was much larger than any Waikiki hotel, had a stove, small refrigerator and microwave oven. This is the only hotel we will stay while in Honolulu. Enjoyed shopping at near by super store called " Don Quijote". The price of souvenirs was the lowest at this superstore.This area is more fun than Waikiki.

My Boy Scout Troop and I recently spent a weekend at the Pagoda Hotel. We had a large group of Scout's and Adult Leaders that participated in our traditional Urban Camp. This event starts in the morning and ends up at the Pagoda Hotel at night. We do an Urban Hike which takes all around the Ala Moana and Waikiki area . It's a very fun and educational experience! We have been staying at the Pagoda Hotel for years and have always had a very positive and enjoyable experience. The Staff is very professional, and will always accomodate my Group. They have plenty of Aloha Spirit! The rooms are nice, they have great ammenities and the price is outstanding! Great location with plenty of parking. It's in the middle of fun and excitment central.

I stayed at the Pagoda for a total of 10 days. It was a great experience one which I would love to repeat!Location: Pagoda Hotel has a great location. It is a great place to start exploring Honolulu on foot. It is situated within 5-7 minute walking distance of many shops and restaurants and the Ala Moana shopping center. (There is a bus stop at the Ala Moana center from where you can explore Hawaii by bus). Staff and Service: Both the front desk staff as well as the housecleaning staff are friendly and efficient. Example: I flew in from India and arrived early in the morning at 9:30 a.m and I was in need of a good wash. Since my check-in time was 3:30 p.m, my room was not available. Mr. Carlos at the front desk arranged the needful, and I was free to explore Honolulu for the next few hours. The housecleaning staff were quite good too. The towels and sheets were changed regularly, and coffee was made available in the morning

stayed here only one night. Having had read some of the reviews i wasnt certain at first if this was gonna be the place to stay, but after some deliberating, i decided that i would stay at the Pagoda after hearing some good words from some of my friends who have stayed here in the past. being a solo traveller who was in Honolulu only overnight on a business trip, the Pagoda suited me just fine. sure, its a bit dated, and there is some work going on currently to improve the property, so at least that shows that the hotel is working on its appearance and maintainence issues. the room itself that i took, was an internet special priced, was decently cleaned all around, the air conditioner, you need to crank up to high, as the room is a bit stuffy as the windows dont open, but overall it suited me just fine. the Pagoda hotel staff was very prompt and curteous to all my needs during check in and check out.. plus this hotel is always busy. and another good thing is it being centrally located by a huge shopping district. overall i enjoyed my stay here and would choose the Pagoda upon my next visit to Honolulu. Cheers!

The hotel has two parts, a high rise with an okay view of other high rises. The other portion of the hotel is across the street, young adults hanging out. Our room view was blocked by bricks, smelled unclean and not up to date. Relocated to the high rise we originally the rooms were nicer, but not up to date, we could not get a queen bed, we had two full size beds for our 5 night stay to sleep in. Found out days prior to our arrival, the restaurant was closed for renovations. Internet/parking daily fees.

Originally I booked a 2 bedroom unit at $129.00 per day but was given a one bedroom with 6 twin beds which was great. Linens were changed daily, the room cleaned, bathroom stocked daily and when more towels were needed they were provided right away. When we checked out which took all of five minutes I was surprised with a $145.00 refund. I love this place.

I can't even rate this! The Pagoda is the closest property to the Queens Medical Center. Exhausted from surgery and a very long day, I did not notice how filthy the bed I slept in was until the following morning. Seriously, the stains looked like someone was stabbed or had a very bad case of diarrhea and housekeeping just covered it up like nothing happened. This was in room 354. The furnishings are outdated, carpet is so worn and stretched you can trip over it. Not a bargain at $90 for the night I stayed...which was Oct. 24, 2012. Showing a photo I took with my phone to the front desk, asking if he would sleep in a bed like this, he said.."no, sorry" and turned away. The department of health needs to shut them down. I will gladly share my photo with anyone who is interested!

I have been waiting to write a review on the Pagoda Hotel until I finally spoke with the manager regarding our BEDBUGS experience at their hotel. I was hoping I would be able to write that despite this disgusting, uncomfortable, time consuming experience the manager handled this situation professionally and accordingly; the manager HAS NOT contacted us. No phone calls have been returned, no compensation, NOTHING. The reviews from other guests who stayed at this property regarding their experience of BEDBUGS, dirty showers, a dingy smell, and questionable cleanliness is completely accurate. I might have been able to handle everything mentioned above, but the BEDBUGS were the worst! If anyone has ever experienced them, you know what I’m talking about. If you have not, well, I’d recommend NOT staying at the Pagoda Hotel, or as we are now referring to it as “The BEDBUG Inn”. In addition to the BEDBUGS, our reservation was not accurately noted; we were put in a smoking room when we requested non-smoking, were moved to another room, and then moved again to another room, which is where the BEDBUGS were. Would I stay here again? NO. Should you? NO.

Ok....being a former kamaaina I wasn't expecting The Royal Hawaiian Hotel for the minimal price I paid for The Pagoda Hotel. But, come on if your property or rooms are not ready to sell.....then don't. Check in took me over 20 minutes which included initialing a long form that stated all these penalities I would incur if I didn't follow the rules. I have stayed at other Aqua properties in Waikiki and they did not require this. I finally had to get uppity with the clerk and demand my keycard. I was extremely hungry & tired and just wanted my room. They put me in an annex across the street (an old apt bldg) . The halls were bare concrete, no wall hangings in the room and no blackout drapes with just white curtains. So....when the sun came up I was up! The room was very clean and the staff very personable. No wi-fi (if you can believe this) and the lobby computers were very expensive. btw...the water was in the shower alternated between scalding and cold. Parking was $10 a day but always available. Lots of restaurants and stores and centrally located near my friends and family. I recd a reply from my survey which was mostly from a template. She also explained that they were in the process of selling the bldg I stayed in. Then....why rent a substandard room? Good luck with that. This property was okay for me because I was traveling alone. I would never subject a friend to this type of crap. The restaurant was closed for renovation but as a boy I remember it being a real treat to eat there.

The Pagoda Hotel is not very fancy, but is clean, convenient and accomodating. Don't expect Waikiki but you don't pay the prices of Waikiki either. Clientel is made up of locals from the neighbor Islands that come into Honolulu for business or medical care. Convenient to both Downtown and the Hospitals. We highly recommend it.

We took advantage of their $79 a night special. The wait in line to check in was over 30 minutes. One of our room keys didnt work for the whole stay and everytime I wanted to change the key the front desk line was huge. Finally when doing laundry, I decided to stand in the long line. I got the room key and it still didnt work(for the second time.) But the worst part of it was one of the front desk guys. I had called down from the room to ask about the in room internet access, he said to come down and get the password and pay the $10 daily access fee. When I asked another question on the phone he got huffy and as if talking to a little kid said to "just come down sir." I was a little pissed about his tone and it was the same guy who gave us a defunct key the first time. The rooms were a bit runned down and disappointing but got used to it. The bright spot were the housekeepers, very sweet and friendly. The front desk people were were suffering from overwork or something because the one guy was just out of his element, he should NOT be in a customer service position. Lastly, the terrace which we were staying seemed to funnel and amplify noise so dont expect to sleep in past 7am. Overall it was a $49 a night experience.

The begining of the stay, was not so pleasant since the room was not clean and there was a smoke odour. We were seriously considering to change the hotel, however the hotel pesonnel - Jasmine saved the situation! She was very helpful and courteous and skillfully resolved our concerns! Mahalo Krish.

Don't expect anything like what their website shows of this hotel. Their site makes one believe that the Pagoda Hotel is classy, clean and relaxing. Instead we were greated by staff who could care less if we stayed, deteriorating rooms and smoke filled halls. Also, upon arriving we found the restaurant was closed (one reason my wife picked this hotel) and they did nothing make up for this. The room was terrible. There were holes in the walls, stains and burns in the carpet a noisy air conditioner. The shower tile was dirty and needed replaced as well. This place was horrid and their staff had an attitude of "I really don't care what you want."This hotel left a bad taste in our mouth in regard to Honolulu.

our trip was great for the most part,from the tours, must do,to the city bus rides,cheaper than a rental car, and could get around easily . the room at the pagoda hotrel was a nightmare and the only dissapoiunting part of our whole trip, our upgraded room consisted of bed bugs,huge roach's,ants,spiders mold,ruined laundry,keys didnt work,no hot water,BAD place to stay never again,and even beer bottles thrown at our door,and no security? and resturant was being fumagated so no place to eat there,had to walk alot,but will go back just not to that hotel, people were awesome except the hotel made no effor to compensate us for our horror, loved the rain,the beaches the people and wish i was back, we used the go Oahu Card and also shows like legends, GREAT show,magic show,was kewl and best was the Ali Kai catamaran around waikiki loved it! going to Big Island next any ideas or help please email me at navymom56@hotmail.com, Enjoy, Aloha debby

The hotel has done a great job with cleaning up the place and also improving on its customer service. It is conveniently located to the shopping centers and has ample parking. One advise is to start including services for the elderly and others who are not able to move their luggages around easily. Friendliest staff was the nigh shift guy (forgot his name) and Alice at the front desk :)

It was better than expected. The ad in their website describe well the place.We were looking for something affordable, clean and comfortable enough, we got all of it!It was the closest hotel to Kapiolani Hospital, which was the reason of our trip.Thanks for the friendly and helpful staff !Aloha!Ana

the earlier reviews were pretty accurate. It is an older hotel, BIG room with 2 queen beds, flat screen, hair dryer, iron, another sink in the bedroom so we could both get ready. We were on the 5th floor, above the Pagoda Restaurant. The trash trucks came every morning at 6:30 a.m. and the window air conditioner were distracting. But if you are not going to spend time in your room this is a great place. The parking was across the street and $10. the restaurant was delightful. There is a pool. The walk to Ala Mona Shopping Center is about 15 minutes straight down the road so you can't get lost. The walk to the surf lesson on the beach at Waikiki is 25 minutes down the street. The trolly and bus stop is at the shopping center. We were satisfied.The hotel guests varied from locals, to families, to older, one younger with the black clothes and piercings, to young couples.

You get what you pay for. This is an older hotel that is convenient, clean with a friendly staff that is not in the middle of Waikiki and makes Hawaii affordable. If you want Waikiki you'll pay for it, dearly. If you don't plan to stay in Waikiki this is a great central location to home base. There is Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Moana Beach Park, Walmart, Ross, Starbucks and MANY restaurants within walking distance. There is ample parking available, additional cost, or at night you can many times find free on street parking. If you want to bus it Ala Moana Shopping Center is a hub for many of the bus routes. The kitchenette rooms can make your visit even more affordable. Although, I prefer to take advantage of all the different local foods available! You might want to bring eye covers though as the sun is bright early and the curtains don't block much. For me it just motivated me to get up early and make the most of my day. My ratings are price/value based.

Convenient, ROSS, Wal-Mart, Ala-Moana Shopping Center nearby and many other great shops. As long as you have a bed, privacy (using the bathroom), your fridge, TV, air-con, you should be well off. The hotel said you may stay here, but, not live here. Thank-you for all the HARDWORK you do; It's hard, then to have critics, the worse-ugly ones, makes you only want to quit or work harder, don't quit, just ignore...lol. I may be a few who rates your hotel well, but, there is a lot of us out there who appreciates all that you do. Highly recommended your hotel to everyone. Aloha, AM.

My boyfriend and I booked a room at the Pagoda through bookit and other than the extremely friendly staff were quite disappointed. Flat out it is just very old. The halls are dingy and smell of old folks home.Our towels had stains and so did the bottom mattresses. There was cockroach poop on the table in our room. It is incredibly noisy as the windows don't close all the way and the bed feels like a table top so don't expect any restful sleep. We had requested a queen bed but were given a room with doubles so we had to squish quite uncomfortably on a tiny bed. They were not able to accommodate us except for switching to an only smoking floor which was not an option as I am allergic to cigarette smoke. The shower temperature never stayed consistent and sometimes only half the water came out of the shower head, so you were partially taking a bath as well. Parking is across the street at the Ross for only $10 a day but you can only park starting on level 4. This would be reasonable if the elevator worked but it did not, so we had to walk up and down 4 to 6 flights of stairs multiple times a day. We called and complained to bookit and bookit called on our behalf and our parking fees were refunded. All in all, you get what you pay for. Spend the extra money and go some place nicer.

Stayed at the Pagoda as a non-Waikiki alternative, and it's definitely cheaper. The room was bearable. My standards aren't that high. However, my laptop case was stolen in the front lobby right in front of me-by another guest! It was caught on camera. We called police, who were great, but the management more or less ignored the problem, despite the fact that it was a registered guest who stole. No security in lobby, nor any ID checks of registered guests. This guest was registered under a false name by the front desk. Staff didn't seem very surprised that this had happened, and I wonder if it's fairly normal at this hotel. The management promised that their insurance would take care of the losses but they haven't actually done anything in this regard, nor have they returned my request for contact. Next time I'll pay the extra few dollars and stay somewhere a bit more secure.

Pagoda was not that bad. I have friends who like it, and many people I know have stayed in the past. I didn't know it was a 2 star until after we left and I was asked to review it for another travel site. If it's a 2, it's a pretty good 2. We planned to stay at a resort for 3 nights of our trip, so I was looking for somewhere less expensive for our 2 nights in Honolulu. Pagoda's good points: clean enough. Very friendly and helpful staff, especially Jasmine who remembered my name twice. Pool was small, but nice and clean. Beautiful gardens, pond and waterfall at the restaurant next door. Convenient location to Ala Moana mall, walking distance to the beach, restaurants nearby. We ate at LikeLike driven across the street, were able to take a quick bus to Waikiki Beach, very easy. It was good central location without having to stay in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Parking, although across the street, was only $10 per day compared to $20-$30 in Waikiki. Appreciated the ice water in the lobby. Happy to have a fridge and microwave. The negative: a few minor things, I don't mind outdated decor and furnishings as long as it's clean enough. While the room was pretty clean, the carpet felt grubby and felt the need to wear socks in the room. There was kind of a musty smell, not a horrible odor, probably from the old school window ac, which was loud. When we got there the room wasn't ready, and the front desk although very pleasant was short staffed and the wait to check in took way too long. One of the elevators was out for a day and a half of our 2 day stay, so sometimes the wait was longer. Overall, I would stay there again. if you're looking for a 4 star hotel and luxury accommodations, this isn't going to be for you. But if you plan to spend your time on the beach, exploring the island and visiting all the wonderful foodie places nearby and you want a less expensive and convenient location, I recommend the Pagoda Hotel.

review_body: I stayed at the Pagoda for 8 nights at the end of May. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the 5 story building across the street. The roomThe bad: Our louvered (jealousey?) windows over looked the parking lot. The windows didn't close very well and we were able to see the ground through the closed windows. The good: We had a window air conditioner that worked well. The bad: We had to run it almost 24 hours a day. The good: The parking lot was a blessing. Two other couples in our group overlooked the pool and there were noisy groups there until very late. We had a small fridge, microwave, coffee maker (bring your own coffee and filters) and stove. Decor was really outdated but functional and clean. The locationThe bad: It was a 15 minute walk to the beach. The good: I've stayed in Waikiki for every other visit and I much preferred this Honolulu location. There was a mix of residents and tourists so it felt much more friendly and A LOT more reasonable for meals. There is a Walmart and Sam's Club at the end of the block and a really unique market named Don Quijote that was an experience! You can buy motor oil, steaks, a comforter and bananas all in one store. I'd opt for Don Quijote because the prices are the same and it is such a wacky place. There is a great coffee place named Poppy's that we visited regularly. A very friendly place. There are lots of Pho places close by but my husband is not a fan so I wasn't able to try any. Bottom line: The hotel is OK. Lots of families, I felt safe and the staff was friendly. Having said that: The hotel was dated & the AC was loud and endless. For a good price it would be fine. When I return I will probably look for another hotel in the same area. I really loved feeling like a resident of Honolulu instead of a tourist in Waikiki. For a first trip I'd stay in Waikiki but for a second I'd stay near the Pagoda. Hope this helps.

review_body: My wife and I decided to do a staycation and chose Pagoda since it was close to Ala Moana shopping center and alot of great places to eat in the area. We checked in later in the afternoon and although the line was long, the front desk staff remained upbeat and showed Aloha Spirit to every one they came in contact with. We got a 2 bedroom with kitchenette and found it to be clean and well maintained. We needed extra pillows and called Housekeeping who came right away. My 2 boys and daughter enjoyed the pool area as well. Overall we had a great experience and will recommend Pagoda to all our friends and family as a kama'aina friendly place to go.

After reading the other recent reviews, I will say our 3 night stay was was fine.  We chkd in on 4/21 for 3 nights in their std room w/2 beds on the 6th flr. The room was very neat & clean with cable TV (not flatscreen), round table w/2 chairs, dresser you can put your luggage on & the 2 beds that were comfortable enough. There is a small sink by one of the beds which is convenient if you need running water. The bathroom was older but it was clean with nice white towels, a shower with good water pressure & a drain that really drains. Isn't it awful when you end up standing in ankle deep water at the end of your shower? But not here! Keep in mind this is not the Ritz Carlton so there was no view, no lanai but that's okay. Every unit has a room airconditioner but didn't use it. The elevator is a little wacky sometimes by not stopping at your floor, but press your floor button again & it will get you there. No big deal. I found the associates at the check-in desk to be professional & helpful when I needed directions. The hotel is within walking of Ala Moana (2 blks), Ala Moana Park (a longer walk crossing a busy street), Don Quijote and the HNL Convention Center. The area of the hotel is considered Koreatown, so there are many Korean restaurants & Korean owned shops. Heard good things about some of the restaurants. Would probably stay here again staying in the main hotel bldg or would try another Aqua location. But overall it was a very good stay with good value and clean rooms.

We Stayed at the hotel from April 20-April 23, 2012. We live on the Big Island of Hawaii and was visiting Oahu. We got a good deal through expedia for only $93 a night for a studio with kitchenette. Well we got off on a rocky start, arrived at the hotel after 3 pm which is the check-in time but our room wasn't ready till little before 5 pm. So we killed time by walking to the stores near there, there is a Ross and a Wal-mart (which is very good where you can buy groceries, and close to Ala Moana Mall nearby and checked out the eateries along the way. $10 for parking, maybe we were lucky because we were always able to find parking right near the building. We stayed at the Pagoda Terrace which is across from the street from the main hotel, in a studio because of the kitchenette, our refrigerator was leaking so we called the front desk. They sent someone fast to fix the problem. Overall, the room we were in, looks like they are in the middle of remodeling the room, looks like it was recently painted. The bathroom looks like it was being remodeled. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Hot water every time you take a bath or wash dishes. We were facing the parking lot, so it does get noisy when you are trying to sleep. Could hear other guests talking, yelling, slamming there car doors, car alarms going off. We told the front desk and they were understanding, they said we could call back when the manager comes back and ask to change room. But we just decided to stay in the room we were given because I think the noise would still be there because there are clubs nearby. The room has a microwave, stove with two burners, toaster, coffee maker, pots, pans, plates, forks, knives, can opener which were all clean, also ironing board and iron. Our room was cleaning on a daily basis the entire time we were there, we would go out for an hour or two and when we got back the room was cleaned, we got fresh towels and our beds were made, thrash taken out. I had been reading the reviews before I left for Oahu and was kind of nervous of what kind of room I would be getting since some of the reviews I read were bad so I had emailed the hotel several times and made some requests such as requesting a remodeled room and to be by nearby family who was staying at the hotel. I had a one night stop in Oahu for a quick meeting on my way to Kauai. They have a restaurant I didn't sample and a sundry shop open late. It is a short walk to Ala Moana Center, so if you have a big need to visit a mall, that's convenient.I would not stay at this hotel again even if it were free.

I recently stayed at the Pagoda though it felt like I went back in time. The hotel is stuck in the 70s. Pros: Great location for those not wanting to stay in touristy Waikiki, located within walking distance to Ala Moana Center, Ross, Wal-Mart, Sam's Club, and several restaurants including the Hotel's own Pagoda Floating Restaurant.Excellent Friendly staffMini Fridge/Microwave in room.Spacious Rooms (especially the units w/Kitchenette in the Terrace located in a separate Apartment style complex located accross the street from the Hotel's restaurant) esp. good for those like my parents needing special access (wheelchair/Walker).Cons:No Wifi Internet AccessInternet Access via network plug-in cord = approx. $10/dyThe rooms are older and have a 70's/80's feel/decor to them. Do not go with the expectation of flat screen tv's or the latest furnishings as that is not the market that they serve. The rooms are spacious comfortable and clean While the Hotel could use new carpeting and furniture, such a remodel (esp. in this economy) would likely be reflected in a huge price increase. For now, the rooms are comfortable, clean & affordable. While Pagoda does cater to the local Hawaii population (esp. local folk from the outer island like myself) this hotel could also appeal to the value conscious mainland visitor seeking accomodations comparable to many mainland chains such as Ramada, Motel 6, Super 8 and the like. Their excellent staff are very friendly and helpful. Kudos esp. to Bill at the Front Desk for being patient & understanding with an indecisive guest and for recommending/finding a great room that was a short distance from parking/elevators so that my elderly father didn't have to walk far. I also appreciate the Housekeeping staff who knew immediately about the items I had left in the room at checkout whe I called and who made arrangements to get those items back to me. Bottom Line: Save your money on the fancy hotels and use that money to enjoy the many fine restaurants and activities that Hawaii has to offer.
